name: Antoinette Goodwill
bio:
Lifestyle choices for a healthier you.
More and more people are living long and healthy lives with diabetes. Let’s work together to make a plan for a healthier you. Invest in your future, invest in your health.
Hello, I am Antoinette Goodwill and I am passionate about helping people living with diabetes through lifestyle changes. I have worked for more than 10 years as a diabetes dietitian in the NHS. During this time I have worked as a non-medical prescriber which helped me have a better understanding of diabetes medication. Overall, I have more than 20 years of clinical experience working in the NHS in various specialities. This enables me to have a holistic approach to provide food and lifestyle choices to suit people's overall health.
Through the years, working as a registered dietitian within the NHS, I have seen what a big difference food and activity can have on diabetes. It is truly inspirational! Even small daily changes to your routine can make a big difference to your blood glucose levels and overall health, no matter what treatment you are taking for your diabetes. That is why I feel strongly that everybody with diabetes should be offered the opportunity to talk to a registered diabetes dietitian. Unfortunately, this is not always possible due to NHS resourcing constraints. If you do not have access and want more support, please contact me.
For more information please visit the website www.malvern-dietitian.co.uk or contact me on 07900303990 or email info@malvern-dietitian.co.uk to book an appointment.
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Diverticulosis, Freelance Practice, Lecturing/ training, Menopause, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Obesity, Women's health

name: Azmina Govindji
bio:
Azmina Govindji, Founder of Azmina Nutrition, is a multi award-winning dietitian, consultant nutritionist, international speaker and best-selling author of 20 books. Her latest peer-reviewed book, Vegan Savvy: The Expert’s Guide to Nutrition on a Plant-based Diet is supported by The British Dietetic Association (BDA) and The Vegan Society.
In July 2024, she was awarded a Fellowship by the BDA. A Fellowship is the highest honour that the BDA bestows on a dietitian and it is conferred in recognition of outstanding service in promoting the profession and the science and practice of dietetics. 
Azmina is known for her upbeat personality and optimistic attitude. She is a media spokesperson for the BDA and works with the food industry to enhance their brand credibility in health and nutrition. Recent projects include Instagram campaigns, corporate wellness days, healthcare professional roundtables, staff training, brand messaging, cook-alongs and recipe development.
Her television appearances include Sky, BBC and ITV news, This Morning, Victoria Derbyshire show, the One Show, Inside the Factory and Food Unwrapped.

Azmina was previously Chief Dietitian to Diabetes UK and a Member of the British Heart Foundation’s Ethnic Advisory Board. Her career highlights include having breakfast with President Jimmy Carter and advising Bill Nighy about his beans on toast on The One Show.
She enjoys long-term relationships with her corporate clients and is always up for a challenge!
industry_services: Social media, Media, Media / PR, Consumer Press, Content Creation, Cooking demos, Recipe development, Product development, Writing, Writing and editing, Television, Radio

name: Laura Coxden
bio:
I have been a Registered Dietitian since 2012 and specialised in gastroenterology in 2015. I specialise in  conditions including irritable bowel syndrome, functional bowel conditions, inflammatory bowel disease,  pancreatic insufficiency, coeliac disease, liver disease and diverticular disease. I also provide services for nutrition support (weight gain) and cancer patients. 

I offer video or telephone consultations for those in the UK as well as in-person clinics at The Hampshire Clinic or The Candover Clinic in Basingstoke. I require a referral letter from a general practitioner or consultant prior to booking an appointment to ensure I have a full medical history. 

I am a registered provider with all the main UK health insurance companies, please let me know who you are insured with and I can let you know what I offer. 

I also work part time as a specialist gastrointestinal dietitian in the NHS.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Gastroenterology, IBD, IBS, Low FODMAP, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support

name: Rebecca McManamon
bio:
Rebecca is a HCPC Registered Dietitian with a wealth of experience in helping clients manage health conditions through dietary change.
Rebecca has extensive experience working within MDTs for clients with complex needs, in particular those impacted by brain injury, spinal injury, polytrauma and cerebral palsy, as a treating dietitian in legal cases. 
Rebecca uses her skills and knoweldge to produce expert witness reports for liability and quantum, acting for claimant and defendant solicitors or joint instruction.
Since Rebecca worked for over 10 years in the most multi-cultural area of the UK, she has a real understanding of how our relationship with food may differ according to our culture and religion – our unique identity – thus ensuring that any recommendations are considerate of individual food choices and beliefs.
Rebecca is a full member of the BDA and is a BDA Media Spokesperson. Rebecca has been featured in The Times, The Guardian and on BBC Radio and Channel 5. She is a member of the Gastroenterology, Paediatric, Diabetes, PENG, Mental Health and Neurosciences Specialist Groups.
Rebecca has had over 50 articles published over a breadth of range of nutrition issues, and is an editor for CN Magazine and honorary lecturer for the University of Hull
Rebecca has expertise in a range of conditions, including:
Weight Management
Diabetes
Pre-Diabetes
Cardiovascular Disease
PCOS, Fertility
Gastrointestinal (Digestive) Conditions e.g. Coeliac Disease, IBS, Pancreatic conditions
Renal (Kidney) Conditions
Cancer
Difficulty in gaining weight/ experiencing unintended weight loss
Neurological conditions e.g. Brain Injury, MS, MND, Dementia, Spinal Cord Injury
Enteral tube feeding
Anaemia
Please contact Rebecca via her mobile 07535 840235 or email rebecca@urbandietitian.net to find out more.

name: Paola Falcoski
bio:
My passion for empowering individuals to overcome their challenges and live a fulfilling life is what drives me every day.

I achieve this by providing a safe space with my loving and compassionate presence.

Using a holistic approach, I create space for emotions to be felt and processed, especially in the body. I know that changes take time and I take a curious approach, respecting your unique journey and pace. By following your lead, I support you in integrating all experiences and regulating your nervous system for long-lasting growth and healing.

My interventions are tailored to your specific needs, drawing from a combination of approaches that I am trained in. You can trust that each session will be customized to best support you on your path to self-discovery. Whether it's cognitive-behavioural therapy, mindfulness-based approaches, or other evidence-based treatments, I will work with you to find what works best for you.

With over 12 years of experience in clinical settings, I am an Advanced Specialist Eating Disorder Dietitian (anorexia, bulimia, binge eating, ARFID) and a Somatic Experiencing Practitioner, holding a Master's degree in Public Health and currently taking a diploma in Autism and Mental Health.

My expertise lies in delivering high-quality care for both groups and individuals in both outpatient and inpatient settings for Eating Disorders. I am also highly experienced in Sport Nutrition and ADHD.

My extensive training includes SOS, CBT-t, CBT-e, FT-AN, Unified Protocol, and Safe and Sound protocol.

As an active member of the healthcare community, I am committed to contributing to research, teaching, and event speaking. I also provide supervision for dietitians, helping to support the development of the next generation of practitioners.

I currently works at CAMHS Eating Disorders Team as well as privately
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Eating disorders, Facilitation/ training, Mental health, Obesity, Sports nutrition, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Advanced clinical practice, Freelance Practice, Lecturing/ training, Leadership, Nutrition support, Neurosciences, Research

name: Adam Cummins
title: MSc, BSc
bio:
My name is Adam and I am a registered Dietitian and health and performance nutritionist with over 15 years’ experience, helping 1000’s of people optimise their health and performance in areas including but not limited to:
- Weight management
- IBS and gut health
- Female health including PCOS, menopause and amenorrhea
- Sports and performance nutrition from gym training to professional athletes.
I have had a love for food and cooking from a young age, training as a chef before entering the health and fitness industry before going on to becoming a dietitian.
I provide a 100% guarantee that all my advice, plans and content are completely personalised to you and that I never provide “cookie cutter” plans as is often the case.
I take into consideration every aspect of your lifestyle and provide personalised, evidence-based nutrition advice to help you achieve your goals in a way that suits your current needs, wants and requirements.
My aim is to help you achieve your goals but also get you to a point where you do not need me or any other professional again in the future. I aim to empower people to take control and responsibility for their lifestyle and manage their own nutrition. I place a great emphasis on education as I want you to not only understand what you should do to achieve your goals but why.
I will help you achieve results, create a healthy, strong relationship with food and equip yourself with the knowledge needed to empower you to make informed decisions yourself.
No matter what your goal, your experience or relationship with food, the level of support you require or the budget you have, I can help you get to where you want to go.
To book a free consultation, to discuss your goals and how I can help you click here. 
For more information about my services please visit my website www.adamcummins-nutrition.com
industry_services: Corporate Health, Lecturing & teaching, Recipe & menu analysis, Recipe development, Speaking, Television, Workplace nutrition
clinical_expertise: IBS, Lecturing/ training, Low FODMAP, Sports nutrition, Weight loss, Women's health

name: Kinga Topolowska
bio:
Kinga Topolowska is a highly experienced senior specialist neurosciences dietitian with a strong background in acute clinical care. With over 10 years of clinical experience, she has worked in some of the largest NHS hospitals in London, as well as smaller local units, catering to a diverse range of patient needs.
In the early years of her career, Kinga gained expertise in various specializations within dietetics, including general dietetics, weight management, nutritional support, tube feeding and oncology.
For the past nearly 8 years, Kinga has focused her expertise on neurosciences, working in a renowned neurosciences tertiary centre in London. As a senior specialist neurosciences dietitian, she is dedicated to helping patients with a wide range of neurological conditions, including motor neuron disease (MND), multiple sclerosis (MS), brain tumours, Parkinson's disease, Huntington's disease, strokes, neurosurgery, neurorehabilitation, and many more.
With her in-depth knowledge and understanding of the complex nutritional requirements associated with neurological conditions, Kinga provides invaluable guidance and support to patients, helping them optimize their nutritional status and enhance their overall well-being.

I have specialised in Paediatrics for a large part of my career gaining a great deal of knowledge and experience in this field. name: Sarah Kate Ford
title: BSc (hons) Biomedical Science, PG Dip, MSc
bio:
KATE FORD BSc MSc PG Dip RD
Digestive Health Dietitians
I am a dietitian working in both NHS and private practice, with over 17 years of experience running outpatient clinics and caring for people on inpatient wards. Through lifestyle and dietary advice, I have been able to help patients with a variety of conditions including respiratory disease, weight management, diabetes and cardiovascular disease. I hold the role of Highly Specialist Dietitian at Salford Royal Hospital where I use my skills in clinical leadership, providing clinical supervision and mentorship to dietitians and students.
With 15 years experience working within a surgical gastrointestinal multidisciplinary team at a specialist centre, I have extensive knowledge of oncology and gastrointestinal disease. I understand the nutritional difficulties and social impact gastrointestinal conditions bring.
I am able to provide expert dietary advice in gastrointestinal cancers and oncology treatment including preoperative dietary and lifestyle advice, colostomy and ileostomy diets, good nutrition to promote postoperative recovery and a healthy diet for prevention of cancer recurrence. I regularly support people undergoing treatment for gastrointestinal conditions such as inflammatory bowel disease and liquid diet therapy, irritable bowel syndrome, pelvic radiation late effects and liver disease. I understand the lifestyle changes required when following a gluten free diet in coeliac disease and gluten sensitivity and have practical tips on hand to aid dietary change. I regularly see patients with dysphagia (swallowing difficulties) and have expert tips for following a texture modified diet.
I have a strong research background and an ethos of promoting evidence based practice. As a registered dietitian with a degree in Biomedical Science, I am expertly placed in translating science and research in practical dietary advice.  I achieved my Master of Science through completion of a research project involving enteral nutrition after upper gastrointestinal surgery, helping patients in their postoperative recovery. I recently presented the research at the British Association of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition (BAPEN) conference.
I am a low FODMAP diet therapy trained and specialise in advice for functional bowel disorders. As a team, we had the pleasured of showcasing our low FODMAP diet work at the British Society Gastroenterology (BSG) conference. Through low FODMAP diet therapy we have been able to demonstrate effective dietary treatment for IBS sufferers. I work with clients to treat IBS holistically, providing nutritional assessment, recognition of trigger foods and ensuring a balanced diet.
I am passionate in caring for my clients and tailor consultations to the needs of the individual, communicating in the most effective way for each person.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Gastroenterology, Nutrition support, Oncology

name: Angela Jefferson

Registered Dietitian and Registered Nutritionist
Co-founder of Nutrition4.co.uk
Editorial Panel of Healthier You magazine
Freelance since 1998 – you name it & I've done it!
I’ve researched, written and discussed with consumers and health professionals almost every aspect of diet, wellbeing  and health.
Working with a diverse range of companies and organisations enables me to combine dietetic and communication skills with a desire to win in business.
Recent projects include a wide variety of work, ranging from Creating bespoke weight management programmes for all age groups, creation of app content, policy briefings to MP’s, media interviews, chairing expert panel meetings, conference speaking, writing consumer and health care features & project managing the development and delivery of website content.
Published peer-reviewed articles on pregnancy nutrition in the UK and Australia.
Over the years I have had the privilege of working with some of the UK’s largest companies, including Kellogg’s, Solutions4Health, Twinings, Galaxo Smithkline, Allied Bakeries, Danone and AG Barr to name a few.
I also act as an adviser to the Menopause Exchange – a charity supporting women during the menopause.

name: Rachel Zibe
bio:
I’m an experienced dietitian, specialising in Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), weight management and nutrition for sport.
Through one to one consultations, I can tailor nutritional advice to support individuals improve their health and wellbeing.
I am trained in the dietary management of IBS, including the low FODMAP diet, which can help some people with IBS and digestive issues gain relief from their symptoms.
As a previous paediatric dietitian, and mum of three active children, I am also passionate about the importance of good nutrition for children and teens.
I am experienced in recipe analysis and menu planning, having worked for a group of care homes across the North East of England, and also recently designed and analysed the menus for a private day nursery in London.
I offer private consultations at Newcastle Physiotherapy. Please get in touch, if you would like friendly, expert advice. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Nicola Guess
contact_address: DU CANE ROAD, LONDON United Kingdom
bio:
I am a Registered Dietitian with a PhD in the dietary management of prediabetes from Imperial College London. 
I currently work at the University of Oxford where I investigate how nutrition can help prevent and manage type 2 diabetes. My particular interest is how nutrition can help manage type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular risk independent of weight loss. This is important to have as an option because many of my patients don't want to or find it difficult to lose a lot of weight. 
In fact, even if people don't lose weight, there are ways to use nutrition to lower blood sugars, blood pressure and cholesterol. Of course, if people also want to lose weight, very often these effects can be additive. 
My clinical studies and experience working in glucose regulation and insulin resistance has also given me considerable expertise in managing polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS), reactive hypoglycaemia and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). 
I also spent 5 years working in the Department of Medicine at Imperial College London, which specialised in appetite regulation. Therefore, I also counsel patients for weight management with a focus on utilising foods for their role in satiety and fullness. 
Finally I also have an interest in the nutritional quality of plant-based diets, and was a Fulbright Scholar at Johns Hopkins and Tufts Universities in the US where I looked at sustainable protein.

name: Tazmin Lewis
bio:
Hi, I'm Tazmin a Registered Dietitian based in London with ten years of experience and specialising in pregnancy, diabetes and paediatric nutrition. You can book a free discovery call online via my website above.
I balances my time whilst working in the NHS and freelance. I am currently a Paediatric Specialist Dietitian within diabetes & neonates for the NHS. I have vast experience within diabetes for both adults and paediatrics supporting people with Type 1 Diabetes, Type 2 Diabetes, and Gestational Diabetes. I am able to advise on diet and lifestyle changes to balance glucose levels and also able to analyse data from blood glucose monitors, continuous glucose monitors and insulin pumps.
I have supported thousands of women through their pregnancies since 2014. My aim is to help women feel the best they can during their pregnancies by optimising their diet, preventing and treating nutritional deficiencies, whilst meeting the nutritional needs of mum and baby. I am also a breastfeeding peer supporter so have unique skills to support those throughout the forth trimester too.
I currently have two programmes on offer to support mums within Gestational Diabetes and Prenatal Nutrition. Please check out my website for more details on this.
I also have a wealth of knowledge in other areas of nutrition such as high cholesterol, IBS, weight management, nutrition support and vegan/vegetarian diets.
I can offer individual appointments as well as workshops/webinars and food diary/recipe analysis.
Outside of work you can find me spending time with my two young children, eating at delicious restaurants, cooking/baking, the occasional run and foraging in nature.

name: Lucy Greveson
title: BSc, PGDip
company_name: Specialist Gastro Dietitian- The Ilkley Dietitian
bio:
About Me
I’m a registered dietitian with a passion (and borderline obsession!) with the Gut Microbiome. I currently work as a Highly Specialist Dietitian in the NHS and am now exploring my love for ‘good’ bacteria through private practice. I strongly believe that optimal gut health is at the heart of being happy, energetic and a healthy weight.
Through realistic and individualised dietary changes, I can support you with any gut-related issues, other long term medical conditions or simply to improve your general health and well being.
Areas of speciality
- Irritable bowel syndrome (including support with a low FODMAP diet)
- Chronic conditions: type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, raised cholesterol, overweight & obesity
- Gut disorders: coeliac disease, diverticular disease, lactose intolerance, constipation
- Low body weight
- Vegan & plant based diets
- Other conditions: pancreatitis & pancreatic insufficiency, BAM (bile acid malabsorption), liver disease, iron deficiency anaemia
This list is not exhaustive, so please visit my website (see link above) to find out more information or to book an initial Discovery Call.
I look forward to hearing from you,
Lucy

name: Ruby Godfrey-warner
contact_address: Strang, Isle of Man, Isle of Man Isle of Man
bio:
My name is Ruby Godfrey-Warner and I am a knowledgeable and experienced HCPC registered dietitian. I have greater than 12 years of clinical practice working within the NHS and Manx Care, in both the acute and community setting, treating an array of complex medical conditions.
Dietitians are the only qualified healthcare professionals to assess, diagnose and treat dietary and nutritional problems. Therefore I can provide you with expert, individualised & evidence-based, holistic advice in the following areas:
Gut and Digestive Health: Supporting gastrointestinal conditions such as but not limited to IBS. I provide tailored dietary strategies including the use of the Low FODMAP diet for which I have used in clinical practice for more than 10 years.
Chronic Health Conditions: I provide education on the dietary management of chronic health conditions and empower you to manage your medical conditions to continue to meet your lifestyle goals and optimise your health. I provide dietary council for the following but not limited to long term health conditions e.g. Diabetes, PCOS, respiratory conditions, Heart health e.g. high cholesterol and blood pressure.
Weight Management: I can help you to achieve sustainable healthy weight loss in a holistic manner that’s respects your body's individual needs.
Healthy Ageing & Hormone Health: I can guide you in navigating the challenges of changes to levels of the hormones responsible for menstruation and fertility, with tailored dietary advice to improve your vitality and quality of life.
I am passionate about working with clients to help them achieve their dietary and lifestyle goals and provide evidence-based, holistic, compassionate individualised tailored care. I offer consultations online so I am not limited by borders.

name: William Hadfield
title: MNutr
bio:
Will is a Registered Dietitian specialising in Pre-Diabetes, Type 2 Diabetes, Type 1 Diabetes, Gestational Diabetes & complex weight management.

Will offers simple, tailored and individualised nutritional therapy to empower YOU to achieve YOUR health goals. Personalised packages are made to develop holistic, achievable and sustainable long-term health changes.

Consultation & Pricing:
One-off consultation with detailed dietary assessment, starter advice, written information for your GP/ medical team at your home or via video-call: £125/hr
Personalised package (As above but with long-term support & coaching): £100/hr

Find out more at www.wenutrition.co.uk

Experience
Will has 10 years experience in the NHS, research, non-for-profit & private sector:
Private sector: Will is currently the Clinical Lead Dietitian for Xyla health and wellbeing. In this role will oversees all nutritional aspects of health programmes, including creation, review and evaluation and exploring new opportunities for innovation. 
NHS: King’s College Diabetes Centre and Nottingham University Hospitals. Nutritional therapy in 1-2-1 and groups with children & adults. Type 1 and pump therapy, continuous glucose monitors, low carb diets, sports & exercise, weight management. Type 2 and very low calorie diets for remission, complex weight management. Pre-conception for Type 1 & 2, Gestational Diabetes. Pre-Diabetes. DAFNE Educator. Service development. Research for new tech.
Freelance: Client based 1-2-1 consultations, personalised packages, workplace education, healthy eating workshops. Professional sector lectures/ conferences/ workshops. Book reviews, magazine articles. Visit www.wenutrition.co.uk for more info.
Charity/ Volunteer Roles: British Dietetic Association Diabetes Specialist Group – website design/ management, resource development, book reviews, literature reviews. TheFoodChain nutritional workshops. Diabetes UK volunteer.
Research: Interest in social media/ new tech to support diabetes and long term behaviour management. Reviewer for protocol.

When not working, Will can be found seeking adventures in the great outdoors, street food markets, restaurants or making a mess in the kitchen.

name: Maria Cazzulani
title: BSc, PGDip, MSc
company_name: THE SOMNIO for emotional and physical wellbeing
bio:
Hello, I’m Maria,
Registered Dietitian & gut-directed solution focused hypnotherapist.
I bring over 20 years of experience as a Registered Dietitian, having started my career in weight management at the prestigious University of Milan. More recently, I have specialized in gastroenterology within the NHS, focusing on complex digestive conditions such as Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis, and Coeliac Disease.
My passion lies in understanding and addressing Disorders of Gut-Brain Interaction (DGBI). I have completed the KCL-Advanced Dietary Management course and gained expertise in the low FODMAP Diet for IBS. To complement my dietetic practice, I am also a qualified Hypnotherapist, specializing in gut-directed hypnotherapy, offering a holistic approach to managing gut-related conditions

Book a free 20 minutes discovery call

My colleagues and I are passionate about combining nutrition, medical care, and psychology to provide the best support. We're commended on our level of care and commitment to our clients.

group workshops

and much more

name: Gillian Killiner
bio:
121 Dietitian is owned and managed by Gillian Killiner BSc. (Hons) MSc. RD. Gillian has over 25 years of extensive hospital and freelance consultancy experience. 
Gillian and her team provide a nutritional consultancy service available throughout the UK and worldwide via Belfast clinics or using a secure online portal (GDPR compliant). 
121 dietitians' unique programmes are designed for the individual and provide tailor-made advice bespoke for each person.
If a company, nursing home or other organisation require dietary, food and nutritional information we also welcome you to get in touch.
121 Dietitian regularly provides workshops and roadshows for corporate companies/schools/groups promoting healthy and regularly has feature articles in the media, assists Charities with promotions, and is a contact for local /national radio and TV. 
You can also find 121 Dietitian on YouTube, Facebook, LinkedIn and Instagram
Areas of specialist interest include:
Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) (Trained: Low FODMAPs practitioner @ Kings College London 2011), 
Gastrointestinal disorders; including coeliac, IBD, reflux, SIBO..
Diabetes /Prediabetes - nutritional management
Weight management: trained in the Counterweight Programmes these specialise in Motivational Interviewing and Behaviour Change for lifelong client success
Health promotion, CSR in the workplace increasing productivity/reduce absenteeism,
Sports Nutrition
Women's health, Menopause, PCOS
Eating Disorders
Nutritional analysis, food allergies and food intolerances
Vitamin and Mineral deficiencies, 
Auto-Immune conditions - assist patients with ongoing fatigue 
As a BDA Spokesperson Gillian is available for all areas of media correspondence. 
121 Dietitian provides services to GPs, private and NHS hospitals also.
121 Dietitian's practice is located at Maypole Clinic Holywood as part of the Kingsbridge Private Hospital Group

name: Lisa Rowlands
bio:
I have 18 years of clinical NHS experience working in many areas. My passion is to provide reliable, practical and tailored evidence based nutrition information to help individuals make sustainable long-term changes to improve their health.

I am an empathetic, friendly and caring dietitian who can offer personalised nutrition for a range of clinical conditions. I offer flexible one-to-one appointments, as well as video / virtual consultations to suit your needs. My main areas of interest include:
   Kidney disease (all stages, including dialysis & transplant)
Gut health or Gastroenterology (irritable bowel syndrome (FODMAP trained), small intestinal bacterial overgrowth, coeliac disease, chronic constipation or diarrhoea, diverticular disease, bile acid malabsorption)
Women's health including peri-menopause, menopause, endometriosis, polycystic ovary syndrome
Hypothyroidism & Hashimoto's thyroiditis
Hyperthyroidism & Graves' disease
Sports nutrition

Previously, I was a long distance runner which is why I became interested in food, nutrition and it’s importance in applying sensible daily eating plans to ensure the provision of adequate fuel to fulfill sporting potential and recovery. As a dietitian who has an interest in sports nutrition, I am passionate about working with sports enthusiasts / athletes to empower and enable them to make informed timely food choices based on up to date scientific research.

Qualifications:
  2.1 BSc Honours degree in Human Nutrition & Dietetics
Post Graduate Diploma in Applied Sports Nutrition passed with Distinction
BDA course on Irritable Bowel Syndrome – Evidence based first-line dietary management 
BDA course on Low FODMAP Diet for IBS 
‘Trained on the use of a low FODMAP diet for IBS by Monash University’
Diploma in Mindful Nutrition
Diploma in Gut-brain connection
Nerva app training - Nerva IBS clinicians course
Completed specialist training - 'Fertility course for healthcare professionals'.
Identification & management of disordered eating in gastrointestinal disorders by Monash University - 2023
IBS Dietitian's course - 2024
  Memberships:
  Registered Dietitian with Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC)
Full member of British Dietetic Association (mBDA)
If you have had a recent diagnosis or are struggling or anxious about your symptoms with an existing medical condition and would like to find out how evidence based nutrition can support you, then please email me: contact@clinicalandsportsdietetics.co.uk.

I am here to help you.

name: Jodie Relf
bio:
I'm Jodie Relf, a Registered Dietitian specialised in PCOS (polycystic ovarian syndrome). 

After being diagnosed with PCOS in my early 20's I quickly realised how little and poor the support was for women with PCOS. I did an extensive amount of research, including training with PCOS experts in the US, and combined my knowledge around PCOS and intuitive eating to create a non-diet approach to managing PCOS. Did you know that weight loss is not a proven or effective treatment to managing PCOS. 

I empower my clients with the knowledge and tools they need to better understand and manage their PCOS in ways that fit in with their lifestyle. Helping them live a life free of the symptoms of PCOS. 

Take a look at my website for more information and don't forget to sign up to the free 7 day trial for my PCOS ReBalance programme.

name: Penny Vlachou
bio:
We are all born with good intuition around food, however our life experiences, our environment, and all the conflicting advice from the media, can mean that we lose touch with this. Learning what your 'nutritional balance' looks like and how to incorporate it in your life will put you back in control of your choices. How we nourish our bodies has a significant impact on our immediate and long-term health and quality of life. Embrace a way of living that is both healthy and enjoyable!

Areas of interest:
· Eating Disorders and Disordered Eating
· Weight loss and management
· Women’s health: Fertility, Pregnancy, PCOS, Menopause
· Nutrition for sports and exercise, RED-s (relative energy deficiency at sport)
· Eating well under a busy lifestyle
· Prevention and Management of Heart Disease, Type 2 Diabetes, Metabolic Syndrome etc.
· And much more: Plant-based diet, chronic fatigue, low energy levels, IBS etc.
As every person has different needs, your nutrition goals will be built around your lifestyle and routine so that they are realistic and sustainable. I incorporate intuitive and mindful eating tips in my overall compassionate approach, which can be particularly helpful for individuals who want to address emotional eating or feel ‘trapped’ in unhealthy dieting cycles and want to learn to trust their body again. It is important to be able to enjoy a nice dessert or sip a glass of wine with friends without feeling guilty.
Qualifications:
COSCA-counselling Skills Practitioner
PG Cert in Eating Disorders
Certified to use Guided Self Help for Disordered Eating
MSc in Human Nutrition with specialisation in Obesity and Weight Management
BSc in Nutrition and Dietetics (distinction)
I have additional training in psychological techniques including CBT, DBT and motivational interviewing, which is integrated in her clinical practice, when supporting clients with behavioural changes. With your consent, I may liaise with other health professionals involved or your support network ensuring a holistic treatment approach.

name: Deepti Loomba
bio:
Deepti is a specialist in weight management, hormone- driven conditions and irritable bowel syndrome.
She currently works as a Senior Specialist Dietitian in Primary Care where she supports other clinicians with complex obesity cases in ensuring that we continue as a team to provide optimal delivery of dietetic care to individuals. She has achieved exceptional results as she believes it is not a one size fits all as weight loss stems further than just to simply ‘eat less and move more’. She provides personalised care and shapes others knowledge to improve various markers of health.
Deepti’s passion is to empower individuals to gain knowledge and confidence to manage their health conditions and to sustain habits for life long. She finds it incredibly rewarding to improve an individual quality of life and to help others reach their desirable goals. As a result of her progressive career in the NHS, digital health care, primary care and private sector, she has extensive knowledge in dietary counselling and supporting various conditions. She frequently supports those in achieving sustainable weight loss in the following areas emotional eating, type 2 diabetes (inc. remission), polycystic ovarian syndrome, plant – based diet, metabolic diseases and can adapt to a cultural diet.
She is also experienced in nutrition support to help others achieve weight gain. Deepti is also qualified to support those living with IBS to improve symptom management. She also maintains an active lifestyle and completed an additional qualification to become a Personal Trainer. Prior to this role, she was as a lead Dietitian in Complex Obesity and Bariatric Surgery in Cleveland Clinic London hospital, she designed and streamlined the surgical pathways for the Bariatric Surgeries (Gastric Sleeve, Gastric Bypass, Endoscopic Sleeve Gastroplasty and Gastric Band) and developed the patient resources. She was a Bariatric SME advocating best practice using BOMSS and NICE Guidelines to her team members and to other disciplines.
Deepti shares her knowledge in blog Instagram post to support the public in improving their health. You can find examples of this on her professional Instagram page.
Deepti is available as a freelance dietitian for virtual clinics (telephone or zoom meetings). Here she can advise on the following specialist areas: weight management (weight gain and weight loss), irritable bowel syndrome, polycystic ovarian syndrome, lipid lowering, blood pressure management, type 2 diabetes, vegetarian, cultural and vegan diets. Should you wish to speak to Deepti about any other dietary issues outside of these areas, please get in touch.

bio:
Liz is a Registered Dietitian who loves supporting people to positively transform their health and well being through food and lifestyle changes.
Are you living with Type 2 diabetes and looking for information, advice and support to help you to manage the condition and reduce your risk of developing complications?
Or, do you have high blood pressure or high cholesterol and need advice and support to lower them?

name: Tamsin Kivi
bio:
Are you sick and tired of being sick and tired? Are you seeking symptom relief? Well you’ve come to the right place! This is where your journey to OPTIMUM HEALTH starts!! Whether it is symptom relief, weight loss, help with identifying food intolerances or you are looking to achieve optimum health, you will get expert advice and support from a Registered Dietitian. Specialising in Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Small intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO) and Food Intolerances, you will get a full nutritional assessment, review and plan to suit you. 
  I am a HCPC registered dietitian (BSC Hons Dietetics and nutrition). I use the most up-to-date, scientific evidence through my practice to provide evidence based nutritional support and adhere to a code of conduct and am governed by a professional body (HCPC). 
  I have a huge passion for all things food and health! My aim is to support you through your journey to achieving optimum health and achieving YOUR best results! Our digestive tract is probably the most undervalued organ in our bodies? Did you know this wonderful organ is responsible for regulating almost all of our vital bodily functions. For example, regulating 90% of the immune system, fighting infection, absorbing vitamins and minerals to nourish our body, removing toxins, as well as the regulation and production of hormones such as serotonin – also known as the happy hormone! So in short, your gut is responsible for how you feel and how you feel can influence your gut!!
  Feel free to get in touch with any queries with no obligation, I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Sarah Idakwo
title: B.Sc
bio:
As a registered dietitian and eating disorder specialist, I am deeply passionate about empowering individuals and families to overcome the challenges of eating disorders and disordered eating. I specialise in supporting families and individuals with a history of trauma, including domestic abuse, and helping children and teenagers navigate the complexities of eating disorders, particularly those stemming from adverse childhood experiences.
Having personally experienced the struggles of an eating disorder, I intimately understand the isolating, confusing, overwhelming, and frightening nature of these conditions. However, I also firmly believe in the transformative power of recovery, I believe very strongly that 100% recovery is possible. 
My career is dedicated to guiding individuals and families toward eating disorder recovery. I primarily work with busy moms, young children, and teenagers, crafting personalized treatment interventions that address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of eating disorders. My approach is rooted in the Intuitive Eating framework, body image healing, and weight-inclusive, trauma-informed care.

I actively engage with primary and secondary schools to implement prevention programs that educate on eating disorders, raise awareness of warning signs, and empower educators to support their students effectively.

At the heart of my practice lies a commitment to creating a safe, non-judgmental space for my clients. I encourage achievable, accessible health behaviors and genuine self-care, shifting the focus away from numbers on the scale and toward holistic well-being.
My unwavering belief is that recovery is within reach for everyone, and I am committed to walking alongside you on your journey to healing and empowerment. Together, we can reclaim the power of food and embrace a life of nourishment, self-acceptance, and joy.

My approach fosters trust and ensures practical, measurable, and lasting health improvements.
If you’re ready to take control of your health with a trusted expert, I offer tailored one-on-one consultations, meal planning, and structured programs to meet your needs. Let’s work together to transform your health and wellbeing.

name: Samantha Howard
bio:
Samantha is a highly experienced Dietitian and co-founder of Sunlight Nutrition Limited. She graduated from the University of Nottingham in 2007 with a Master of Nutrition Degree. Samantha spent 10 years working in the NHS in a variety of clinical roles including gastroenterology, nutrition support, food allergy and more latterly in paediatrics and school nutrition.

Samantha has been working privately since 2016 and in 2017 she set up Sunlight Nutrition Limited with her colleague Dr Lynda Rigley.

“Working in private practice has allowed me to deliver a high quality client led service. I am able to see clients in our outpatient clinic, virtually or in their own environment and to take the time to truly understand their circumstances and provide a personalised dietary plan”.

Samantha works with a number of children and adults with acquired brain and spinal injuries and  complex medical needs whose care is managed by a case manager. Samantha works with families, carers and support staff and with the wider multidisciplinary team to share her recommendations.

Samantha completed training in the SOS Approach to feeding in 2021 and works with individuals and families where there are complex struggles with eating.

Alongside her clinical work Samantha directs the Behaviour Change Training and is an expert in the behavioural approach and patient centred care. Samantha is passionate about improving her clients’ experience and enhancing their journey to better health. Training other health care professionals on the behavioural approach, which puts the client at the very heart of everything we do, Samantha hopes to improve the experience and enhance health outcomes for many more people.

name: Claire Pettitt
title: PhD, MSc, PG Dip, BSc
bio:
As a UK and Singapore Registered Dietitian and Nutritionist, my goal is to provide evidenced based nutrition advice to all those in search of sound nutrition information.

I specialise in women's health nutrition, with my real passion being supporting those with Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). I also see those looking for support with infertility, endometriosis, peri/menopause, pregnancy and postpartum nutrition and IBS. I work within a holistic framework supporting people with developing long-lasting health behaviours which will improve both physical and mental health, often through an intuitive eating paradigm.

I have a wealth of experience working across many dietetic settings including clinical practice, private practice, academia (lecturing and carrying out nutrition research), and freelance work, including working with start ups, advising healthcare related companies, providing corporate nutrition sessions and much more.

I am registered with the UK HCPC and am also a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and it’s specialist groups: Freelance Dietitians Group (FDG), Gastroenterology Group (GSG) and the Maternal Nutrition and Fertility Group - the last of which I am a committee member.

name: Michelle Bremang Evans
bio:
I have nearly 20 years of experience treating patients in the NHS, freelance and private sectors and have completed further training to specialise in Fertility and Prenatal Nutrition. I am also a member of the Maternal and Fertility Specialist Group of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).
I believe that one of the most important times to eat well, is in the lead up to and during pregnancy - but it can also be the most difficult time to eat well. I support my clients to achieve this goal.

Fertility clients:
I offer consultation packages for individuals and couples to optimise fertility and the chances of a successful pregnancy. 
My service offers advice to clients:
With pre-existing dietary conditions who would like advice on managing their condition in relation to fertility and pregnancy
Who are older and would like to quickly optimise their chances of a successful pregnancy
Undergoing assisted reproduction therapies, IVF
Experiencing recurrent miscarriage
With irregular menstrual cycles
Looking to lose weight prior to assist with conceiving
Requiring tailored advice on nutritional supplementation to ensure micronutrient requirements are met to help achieve and sustain pregnancy and for optimal genetic programming

Pregnancy clients:
I help women reduce their risk of nutritional deficiencies and give their babies the healthiest start in life. I also offer 'mini consultations' at an affordable price for women experiencing side effects of pregnancy who need advice quickly. 
My service offers:
Treatment of pregnancy related side effects (such as nausea, reflux, constipation)
Calculation of personal dietary requirements to manage weight and nutritional needs 
Tailored advice on nutritional supplementation to ensure micronutrient requirements are met 
Dietary advice to reduce the risk of prenatal complications and improve the long-term health outcomes for mother and baby
Support with dietary changes to optimise baby’s future health outcomes through genetic programming
Advice regarding high-risk foods in pregnancy

Please get in touch to discuss consultation fees and packages available

name: Rachel Wood
bio:
Specialist paediatric dietitian with 18 years experience

name: Bethany Francois
title: MSc
bio: My name's Beth and I'm a specialist eating disorders dietitian. I provide online 1:1 support for individuals with looking for guidance around improving their relationship with food and for those with diagnosed eating disorders. My approach to eating disorder support is rooted in compassion, hope, and freedom. I work closely with my clients to develop personalised plans that support their unique needs and goals. I combine evidence-based practices with a deep understanding of the emotional complexities of eating disorders. My goal is to help my clients find lasting recovery and rediscover the joy of nourishing their bodies and minds.

name: Fiona Brannigan
bio:
Hello I’m Fiona, an Ayrshire-based dietitian with 25 years of experience specialising in gut health, long term health conditions and recovery after illness in older adults.
I know how challenging it can be to navigate conflicting dietary advice, especially when you're already dealing with health concerns. Are you or a loved one struggling with digestive issues, poor appetite, or health conditions like diabetes, heart disease?
I can offer the personalised, evidence-based support you need.
I help people manage their health conditions and gut symptoms, giving them confidence with their diet—so they can get on with living a full and vibrant life without second-guessing every bite.
What to Expect
I offer a free discovery call to understand your health concerns and discuss your goals. Together, we’ll create a personalised nutrition plan that fits your lifestyle and helps you feel your best—whether that means enjoying meals without discomfort, improving your overall health or helping your body recovery.
Why Choose Me?
With extensive experience in community rehabilitation in Glasgow, supporting those with long term conditions, recovery from illness and gut issues. I’ve helped countless individuals regain confidence in their food choices, and worked alongside home care staff to ensure your unique needs are met. I know the challenges of accessing timely NHS appointments and ongoing support, and I’m here to provide the expert guidance you need, when you need it.
Let’s chat about how I can help you feel your best. Send me a message today to book your free discovery call and take the first step towards a healthier, happier you!

name: Victoria Mann
title: BSc, MSc
bio:
Victoria is both an experienced Dietitian and Personal Trainer and is therefore in a unique position to advise on both diet and exercise. Victoria graduated from King’s College London in 2011 and practiced as a registered Dietitian within the NHS from 2011-2018. Since then she has focused on her private practice and offers Dietetic clinics and Personal Training services in Oxford and surrounding areas and online.

Victoria offers a full online coaching service delivered via the Oakman Coaching App. This provides a holistic package with personalised workouts, lifestyle monitoring and dietary advice. 

Victoria has always been fascinated by the impact diet can have on health and wellbeing and how nutrition links into the bigger picture of both physical and mental health.

Since graduating she has gained a wide variety of expertise in treating medical conditions with nutritional therapy including obesity, cancer, pancreatic disease, heart disease, stroke, arthritis and diabetes.
Victoria has spoken at international conferences on the importance of nutrition in pancreatic cancer and the Dietetic management of Type 3c diabetes. She was also a 2018 Macmillan Professional Awards finalist for her work in developing the pancreatic cancer service in Oxford.

Her passion is now for the management of both health and disease through good food and nutrition. Many people have a complex relationship with food, we eat for many reasons far beyond just the nutrition the food gives us. Food is such a big part of our lives and therefore the management of diet can be complex. Change can be hard but with Victoria’s skills in behaviour change techniques and extensive knowledge regarding therapeutic diets she will be able to guide you through making sustainable, lifelong changes to better your health.

If you are struggling to know what foods will help you feel your best, have unwanted weight gain or weight loss or want to know what nutritional changes can help with your medical conditions, then Victoria can help.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Advanced clinical practice, Digital healthcare, Freelance Practice, Heart health & thoracic, Menopause, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Obesity, Oncology, Rehabilitation, Sports nutrition, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Weight loss, Women's health

name: Sadia Latimer
company_name: Sadia Latimer The Good Gut Dietitian
bio:
Sadia Latimer is an experienced gastroenterology dietitian registered with the Health Care Professional Council and a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).
She has seventeen years of postgraduate experience in the National Health Service (NHS) across a wide variety of clinical settings, specialising in digestive health conditions in 2010.
Her main areas of interest are Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) and Coeliac disease. She has undertaken specialist training at King’s College on the low FODMAP diet, which is an effective treatment for functional bowel disorders like IBS. She has successfully run specialist dietetic led clinics for coeliac disease, and functional bowel disorders in the NHS within the hospital and community settings.
Her clinical expertise also includes lactose intolerance, bile salt malabsorption, constipation, diverticular disease, and inflammatory bowel disease.
She is currently working as a private practice gastroenterology dietitian in Altrincham, South She is a member of the Freelance Dietitian, and Gastroenterology Specialist Groups of the BDA.
Her friendly, empathetic and holistic approach enables her to provide individualised evidence-based dietary modification advice and treatment plans for her clients to treat their condition, whilst ensuring a balanced diet and preventing nutritional deficiencies.
clinical_expertise: Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, IBS, Low FODMAP

name: Kate Costello
bio:
Kate as a registered dietitian and has over 15 years of experience of working in the NHS and privately in both adult and children’s nutrition.  Kate has worked at the Royal Free Hospital in London and is currently working as a Specialist Paediatric Dietitian at the John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford.



Kate strives to use her expertise in diet and nutrition to promote health and to prevent and treat disease. Kate is very experienced in working with families to help them achieve a healthy lifestyle and uses behaviour change techniques to support families making dietary/lifestyle changes.



Inspire Dietetic Consultancy is based in Oxfordshire and serves all parts of Oxfordshire and surrounding areas.



Kate provides a Consultation Service for adults and children with a range of health problems and dietary needs. Her services are professional and individualised to provide dietary advice to suit your requirements and lifestyle.



Kate has been involved in many freelance projects over the past 10 years, including;



- Working with "magnificent munchers"- Food therapy for children with fussy eating.  Kate's role here was to offer one to one support for families with severe fussy eating problems and to analyse food diaries and advise on ways to achieve a balanced diet/recommend supplementation if appropriate



- Working for "The Healthy Food Company", Kate has been involved with recipe analysis and development of healthy frozen meals for children for the last 7 years.  Kate is still involved with this and is helping to launch the meals into hospitals around the UK, Wales and Scotland.

- Kate has developed weight management programmes for Dorset NHS Trust and North East London Foundation Trust.  These programmes have been aimed at children and young adults and have been rolled out across the areas.




In addition to individual consultations, Kate also provides a range of other services:



-Training courses to health professionals, schools, nurseries and corporate businesses on a range of nutrition related topics of your choice.


-Menu analysis for catering companies, businesses, schools or nurseries. Kate can analyse menus, advise on nutritional content and provide suggestions to make them healthier.


-Lecturing on infant, child or adult nutrition to colleges or universities.


-Nutritional assessments and health related advice to corporate businesses, organisations or companies. Consultations can be done individually or lectures on nutrition and health related topics can be designed for groups.

name: Clare Thornton-wood
bio:
I am an experienced Registered Dietitian (RD) with a specialist interest in paediatric nutrition. Contact me for a free initial discussion, to see how I might help you or visit my website for further details of my practice. I hold clinics in a number of locations; beautiful clinic rooms in Central Guildford, rural West Sussex and can also offer home visits or consultations via Zoom.
Alongside my private practice, I work at Great Ormond Street Hospital as a paediatric dietitian in the feeding and eating disorders team, having previously worked locally for the NHS in multidisciplinary allergy and diabetes clinics, and also at a boarding school for children with severe epilepsy and autism.
I graduated from the University of Surrey with a BSc in Nutrition and Dietetics and I am a Registered Dietitian (RD). After a period in adult dietetics I have undertaken additional training in paediatrics, taking two MSc Modules in Paediatric Dietetics at the University of Plymouth.

I have undertaken additional training in a number of areas, including autistic spectrum disorder/ADHD, allergy, neurodisability, coeliac disease, diabetes, eating disorders and weight management. Clinical practice is constantly evolving and I regularly attend study days, meetings and conferences to keep my practice up to date. I am a regular contributor to articles in the press and online in my role as a BDA media spokesperson. I have also written for a number of trade publications and undertaken recipe analysis and worked with small companies to develop new recipes. I also act as an expert witness in cases requiring dietetic reports.

When not working, I am a wife, mother of three children and a keen musician, performing in a number of local orchestras and choirs. I also love to cycle and of course cook, invent and adapt recipes and eat!

name: Carin Hume
bio:
I want every patient to feel heard and cared for, knowing that the path to achieving their health goals is as unique as they are.  My areas of expertise include IBS, food intolerances including Coeliac disease, inflammatory bowel disease, diabetes (type 1, 2, gestational), hypothalamic amenorrhea, and fibromyalgia. 
My journey to becoming a dietitian started in Stellenbosch, South Africa.  Followed by obtaining a MSc degree in sports nutrition.  I gained extensive experience having worked in the NHS as a specialist diabetes dietitian and in more recent years as a consultant dietitian in private practice.  I have broadened my skills and knowledge, in Functional Medicine, through my training with the Kresser Institute.
I love breaking down the science into practical steps, while incorporating elements of behaviour design, to allow patients to achieve lasting.  I consult with clients in Reading, Great Missenden, London (Marylebone) and remotely.

name: William Wilton
title: BSc (Hons), PGCert, RD, SENr
bio:
About Me
Since qualifying in South Wales in 2019 I have had the pleasure of working in the NHS in both Wales and England which allowed me to gain experience in a plethora of clinical conditions; helping people from all walks of life, ages, ethnicities and with specific personal requirements.
I believe that health and nutrition related issues are unique to each individual and are frequently combined with the stresses of daily life such as work, finances, mental health, family and caring responsibilities. With this in mind, I take a holistic person-centred approach when working together and put your needs at the forefront of everything we do, this ensures that the plan we create is both realistic and attainable.
Qualifications and Background
- BSc (Hons) in Human Nutrition and Dietetics
- PGCert in Sports and Exercise Nutrition
- Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC)
- Sports and Exercise Nutrition Register (SENr)
Prior to my work as a registered dietitian, I worked as a team lead at Waitrose for little under 10 years, working across all departments but specialising in food service which sparked my interest in nutritional quality and healthy eating. During this time I competed in multiple national natural bodybuilding competitions and to this day continue to weight lift 8 hours/week, run, kayak and enjoy scuba diving.
I have worked in a variety of clinical settings and my experience includes but is not limited to:
- Bile acid malabsorption
- Cardiovascular disease and heart health
- Care of the elderly, dementia and Parkinson's
- Cholecystitis and cholecystectomies
- Coeliac disease
- Colorectal surgery
- Delivery of group education sessions (weight management, diabetes, cardiac failure and public health sessions on older persons nutrition and early years)
- Diabetes (Type 1 and Type 2)
- Diverticular disease
- Enteral nutrition e.g. PEG, NG, NJ, JEJ
- Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GORD)
- Gastrointestinal dysbiosis
- Gluten intolerance
- Hypercholesterolaemia
- Hyperlipidaemia
- Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
- Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
- Lactose and dairy intolerance
- Liver disease
- Nutrition support and low weight
- Oncology
- Pancreatic disorders
- Stoma nutrition
- Weight management and obesity
Please send me an email and we can have a free discovery call to discuss your needs and expectations. I look forward to talking with you and working together to achieve your goals.
Email: ukdietetics@outlook.com

name: Joanna Injore
bio:
Hello, I am Joanna a Specialist Oncology Dietitian with over 20 years experience of providing expert evidence-based nutrition advice for people with a cancer diagnosis.

I help cancer survivors to improve their diet and relationship with food during and after treatment, to reduce cancer reoccurrence.

I also have experience in a range of other areas from healthy eating, family nutrition to specific medical conditions such as cardiovascular health, menopause, or weight management.

In addition I can offer a range of bespoke services for businesses, from menu analysis to healthy workplace programmes and featured in the Channel 4 programme 'Food unwrapped'.
I offers flexible 1-2-1 appointments to suit your needs. 
To book a free 15 minute call to discuss your needs please click here: https://app.acuityscheduling.com/schedule.php?owner=17378956

name: Jennifer Bazely
bio:
Jenny is a Registered Dietitian with The Health Care Profession Council and has been practicing dietetics for 16 years. Having qualified from The Robert Gordon University, Aberdeen with a BSc in Nutrition and Dietetics in 2006 she has since worked in many varied roles throughout the NHS. She obtained a Masters in Advanced Dietetic Practice from Nottingham University in 2015 and she is a member of the British Dietetic Association.

Jenny has been interested in nutrition from a young age and has the strong belief that our nutrition has a vital role in both our short term and long term health. Having lived in Leicester for 14 years and having travelled widely throughout the world as given her an extensive knowledge of food and food cultures, both of which an invaluable when supporting individuals with their dietary management

Throughout her time in the NHS she has worked with many different clinical conditions and specialist areas, including weight management, gastroenterology and those with type 2 diabetes both as inpatients and outpatients. Working with those with chronic conditions and the critically ill has reinforced her belief that nutrition and diet has an essential part to play in ensuring lifelong healthy living and would value the chance to help you achieve an optimum diet for you.

Jenny enjoys providing clients with detailed, personalised and practical advice on a one to one basis.  Seeing many with clients with bowel disorders from inflammatory bowel disorder to irritable bowel syndrome, perimenopausal woman struggling with weight management and symptoms control and supporting individual's mental health through diet.  

It is of huge importance that all advice is practical and therefore achievable, and this client lead approach is what many individuals find so valuable.

Jenny is approved by many insurance companies and therefore can provide care though health insurance.

Jenny also provides corporate training, consultant expertise for nutrition companies and 1-1 client work within insurance companies.  

Nothing is too much trouble, so please, if in doubt - just ask!!

name: Rachael Colley
bio:
I am a Registered Dietitian (RD) and a Full Member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).  I specialise in the areas of weight management, chronic health conditions and dietetic needs of those with learning disabilities. I have 23 years’ experience of working in the NHS and bring this to my freelance practice.
Using my NHS experience as a Weight Management Specialist Dietitian within a Tier 3 weight management service, I am ideally placed to support you if you are self-funding weight loss injections (Mounjaro, Wegovy or Saxenda) or medication (Orlistat/Xenical). I am experienced in supporting those with multiple health conditions bringing different dietary challenges. I offer evidence-based expert guidance, tailored support, a personalised plan and bring an empowering, encouraging holistic approach.
Using my NHS experience as a Long Covid Lead Dietitian, my personal experience of MS and living with someone with psoriatic arthritis and fibromyalgia, I bring a unique perspective on the multiple challenges of long-term energy limiting autoimmune inflammatory conditions. I’m passionate about supporting people to eat well for better health in the here and now, despite the difficult symptoms (including unwanted weight gain) that these conditions can bring.
I am a lead member of a working group of UK Dietitians focussing on supporting those with energy limiting conditions (including ME/CFS, Long Covid, Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS) and Postural Tachycardia Syndrome (PoTS).
Using my NHS experience as a Specialist Learning Disabilities Dietitian I am keen to use my skill and expertise to provide training for those providing care to adults with learning disabilities. I can offer tailor-made programmes to educate and empower carers who work with and support this client group. 
I am currently the Education Officer for the BDA’s Learning Disabilities Sub Group.  In 2024 I co-facilitated the BDA’s virtual classroom courses “Advancing Dietetics in Learning Disabilities” and “Assessing Capacity regarding Diet, Weight and Health”.
I will be co-delivering a workshop "From Awareness to Practical Solutions: Nutrition and Healthy Living for Better Health" at the British Institute of Learning Disabilities (BILD) annual Growing Older with Learning Disabilities (GOLD) conference on 12 March 2025.
industry_services: Private practice, Lecturing & teaching
clinical_expertise: Weight loss, Obesity, Facilitation/ training, Learning disabilities

name: Ruth Conroy
bio:
I qualified in 1994 from the University of Surrey with a BSc (Hons) in Human Nutrition and Dietetics (SRD), following my training at University College/Middlesex Hospital London. I have a wide range of experience in adult clinical dietetics and worked as the lead specialist oncology dietitian for 11 years at Mount Vernon Cancer Centre, Northwood. 

Since 2011, after completing training on the low FODMAP diet at King’s College, London, I started using this approach to treat IBS patients.  The low FODMAP diet is a diet low in fermentable carbohydrates which has been shown to be effective in improving symptoms of IBS.

Working closely with gastroenterologists and oncologists, I provide high quality care for all patients and maintain up to date practice through continuous professional development- attending regular workshops, short courses and meetings. I strive to provide excellent standards of dietetic care and improve patient outcomes.

Some of the principal treatments carried out include:

Cancer and palliative care
Gastroenterology disorders, including IBS, coeliac disease and diverticular disease
Nutritional support including patients with dysphagia (difficulty swallowing)
Weight management, pre diabetes and type 2 diabetes (not on insulin)

I specialise in being able to provide high quality, evidence based, tailored advice.  After a detailed consultation, exploring your individual needs, eating pattern and lifestyle, I will provide summary notes of the consultation and liaise with your consultant or GP, as appropriate.

For trusted healthcare reviews or to leave a rating, please search for 'Ruth Conroy' on the following website:  iwantgreatcare.org

name: Anna Burton
bio:
Anna Burton PGdip, BSc Hons RD.

Anna is a UK registered Senior Specialist Pancreatic Dietitian.  Graduating in 1997 with a BSc Hons degree in Nutrition and Dietetics. Since then, Anna has gained 25 years experience in multiple areas of clinical dietetics and nutritional support whilst working within the NHS.

Pancreatic surgical dietetics won Anna’s heart in 2007 and she has since led the pancreatic dietetic service in a large teaching hospital in the UK.

Anna is highly skilled in the nutritional treatment and care of people with pancreatic conditions, including Pancreatic Cancer, Pancreatic Diabetes (Diabetes of the Exocrine Pancreas), Acute and Chronic Pancreatitis.  Anna has a passion about supporting people to help them gain understanding about their condition, enabling them to take control of their eating and symptoms.

Anna has a private practice offering online video or telephone consultations.

Anna completed a PGdip in Advanced Nutrition from Leeds Beckett University in 2019.  Anna is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) and is a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).

name: Emily White
title: BSc
bio:
Having worked in a leading teaching hospital for 17 years I have developed a wealth of experience in the nutritional management of many health conditions.  My specialist area is renal/kidneys stages 3 to 5 on dialysis, where I have supported hundreds of people to manage their condition with diet and help those not on dialysis to stay off for as long as possible. I hold a masters certificate in supplementary prescribing and can lead on the medical and dietary management of renal bone health which is vital for preserving bone strength and a healthy vascular system.  
A renal diet must be tailored to individual requirements and I aim to support my clients in knowing what to eat and what to limit, by arming them with the knowledge to build confidence and take away the confusion and anxiety surrounding food. 
Self funding and Bupa registered provider.

I am currently working as a freelance dietitian and sports nutritionist and am based in Glasgow, Scotland.

name: Debra Thomas
bio:
IBS Dietitian UK - I'm a multi-award winning Specialist IBS Dietitian with over 20 years’ experience of advising on a range of therapeutic diets, including nutrition support for weight gain and Coeliac Disease. However, my expertise is in IBS treatment. To date, I’ve advised over 2000 patients with IBS symptoms using the low FODMAP diet.
Can a dietitian help with IBS? - I've helped so many IBS sufferers and here's an extract from a recent review:
"I have just finished the first phase of the low FODMAP diet. I'm now symptom-free, having suffered for many years. Debra's process is easy to follow. If you have IBS issues, don't wait like me, speak to Debra."
If you have IBS and want to improve your gut health, I can help you change your life too. My online treatment to support you in your journey includes:
Afree initial telephone consultation; symptom evaluation and assessment; general diet and low FODMAP advice; online sessionsacross the UK; comprehensive low FODMAP booklets; and ongoing support between sessions.
Usually only 3 sessions are needed.
So, let's book in a call to discuss how you can gain IBS relief.
You're not alone - we can do this together!
Call me on 07754 901784 or email: debrafodmap@gmail.com. For more information about IBS symptoms and treatment see mywebsite.

name: Victoria Deprez
bio:
Working as a dietitian for over 20 years, Victoria is a Registered Dietitian and Nutrition Consultant experienced in translating evidence-based health and dietary advice into simple, practical, and realistic advice to help you reach your goal. Working collaboratively, a one-on-one session with Victoria will equip you with the knowledge, skills, and confidence to make the best changes for your mind, body, and health.
Victoria has a wealth of experience supporting clients with Gastrointestinal conditions, including Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Inflammatory Bowel Disease, Coeliac Disease, Pancreatitis, Liver Disease, and Stoma management.
Victoria works with women, supporting them to navigate menopause and the host of symptoms that follow, including brain fog, weight management, mood changes, gut symptoms, and energy levels.
Additionally, Victoria uses her skills and knowledge to help clients who feel stuck in the chronic dieting cycle and are keen to find a better way to manage their weight long term.
Victoria offers one to one consultations in person or online, provides dietetic consultancy service for medico-legal cases and runs workplace wellness seminars.

name: Kirsty Porter
bio:
Nutrition4kids is led by Registered Dietitian Dr Kirsty Porter who is a full member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).
 
I have over twelve years experience working with families within an NHS setting and previously worked in academia and research at both the University of Nottingham and Ulster University. 
 
I am passionate about supporting babies, children and their families to achieve health and happiness with feeding and nutrition - for life.  I provide evidence-based and practical advice for families, specialising with dietary or feeding issues including; food allergies, food avoidance or aversion, weaning, constipation, fussy eating and nutritional deficiencies. This can be in the form of 1:1 support, online courses or webinar workshops.

name: Bethany Willson
bio:
Bethany is an expert HCPC Registered Dietitian specialising in gastroenterology and IBS, based in a leading London hospital. With extensive experience in managing complex gut conditions—from post-surgery recovery and pancreatic disease to functional gut disorders like IBS—Bethany offers personalised, evidence-based support to help you feel your best.
Whether you're struggling with digestive discomfort or navigating a chronic gut condition, Bethany's 1-to-1 online consultations are designed to provide you with tailored advice, and practical solutions for long term support.
Bethany also has experience creating insightful blog articles on a range of gut health topics and is available for freelance writing.

name: Chanda Pattni
bio:
THE LONDON DIABETES DIETITIAN
Hello, my name is Chanda Pattni and I am The London Diabetes Dietitian.
As a registered dietitian (since 2003) my career has spanned both the NHS and private sector working in diabetes clinical practice, research and health promotion.
Hello, my name is Chanda Pattni and I am The London Diabetes Dietitian.

As a registered dietitian (since 2003) my career has spanned both the NHS and private sector working in diabetes clinical practice, research and health promotion.

I am passionate about helping people with pre-diabetes (Impaired Fasting Glycaemia and Impaired Glucose Tolerance), Type 2 Diabetes and Type 1 Diabetes to manage their conditions and reduce the risk of developing long term complications.

The London Diabetes Dietitian was created to give people the tools to manage the impact of diabetes on their lives.  I want to understand what your health and lifestyle goals are in order to provide you with tailored dietary advice and practical support which makes a real difference.

I translate nutrition science into understandable, practical information about food, allowing you to make appropriate lifestyle and food choices to prevent or manage diabetes by creating meaningful and effective dietary plans which you can follow for the rest of your life.



Qualifications:

Degree of Bachelor of Science with Honours in Dietetics (Abbott Laboratories Research Award)

Training and Professional Development:

Type 1 Diabetes Patient Education; DAFNE                                       

Type 2 Diabetes Patient Education; DESMOND, X-PERT and Conversation Maps

Behavioural Change Skills; Levels 1 and 2

Low FODMAP diets; Kings College London



Memberships and Registrations:

Healthcare Professionals Council

British Dietetic Association

name: Samantha Ward
bio:
Sam is a UK Registered Dietitian and Sports Nutritionist. She has been a qualified Dietitian since 2019 and specialises in Gastro conditions such as IBS (including the low FODMAP diet), coeliac disease, pancreatic disease, liver disease and more. During her time in the NHS, she has also gained experience in nutrition support, heart health and cancer.
Having competed in CrossFit (placing in the top 4% in the world at the CrossFit Open!) and triathlon as well as having a full-time job working as a Specialist Gastroenterology Dietitian, Sam fully understands the need to properly fuel the body not just for sports performance but also to have the best quality of life as possible.
Sam has worked with many endurance athletes who have struggled with gastro issues, and the dreaded "runner's gut" and finds its very rewarding to help overcome these and see someone not only thrive in performance, but also in everyday life!
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Gastroenterology, IBS, Low FODMAP, Nutrition support, Sports nutrition

name: Nadia Lanman
company_name: Nutrition for Healing and Health and living better with chronic gut and neurological conditions, particularly Parkinson's
bio:
Hi! I'm Nadia, a registered dietitian and nutritional therapist, with a First Class Bsc in Nutrition and Dietetics, and a Diploma in Nutritional Healing (N.H.F. Dip). I work with clients with a wide range of conditions, but have a special interest in helping people live better with chronic gut and neurological conditions, in particular Parkinson's. I have a practice in Bristol and on line, based on the naturopathic principles of treating each person as a whole, and focusing on allowing the body's natural ability to heal itself. 
Before training in Nutrition and Dietetics I had spent many years as a professional cellist. Sadly, this career was cut short by hand and shoulder problems which turned out to be a forerunner to Parkinson's Disease. The diagnosis left me feeling isolated and let down by my body. But, I was determined to do as much as I could to help myself, and regain control of my health, as far as possible, with nutrition. By combining a predominantly plant based diet, optimisation of hydration, dramatically increased specialised exercise, and nutritional healing principles, I've managed to keep the Parkinson's in check. I've been able to lead a full and fulfilling life, and still have none of the obvious appearances of the disease. So, I haven't found a quick fix, but my experience of determined, long term commitment to an appropriate dietetic and nutritional healing approach shows the possibility of mitigating the effects of chronic disease, in ways that traditional medicine might not be able to. 
I am committed to helping people reclaim their health and get to a place where they are thriving. I believe my personal experience greatly enhances my ability to help you develop the necessary powerful can-do mindset which, together with healthy eating habits, has the potential to transform your health for life, not just in the short term. 
If you would like to learn more about my approach, please visit my website www.nadialanman.com
clinical_expertise: Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, Neurosciences, Veganism and Vegetarianism, IBS, Low FODMAP

bio:
Sean is a registered dietitian with over 7 years of experience working in the NHS and has spent 6 years working in specialist gastroenterology settings.

Low FODMAP trained, Monash University
