Background:
Sean has worked in acute hospital trusts in Sussex since 2016 and currently works as a senior specialist gastroenterology dietitian at University Hospitals Sussex. Sean Is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) and the British Dietetic Association (BDA).

Throughout his career, Sean has maintained a specialist focus on medical and surgical gastroenterology and works as part of a nutrition support team that provides services to inpatients on a digestive disease unit. In addition, he runs an outpatient service for patients with inflammatory bowel disease.
With a passion for public health, Sean is currently a population health fellow with Health Education England and is undertaking work to raise awareness around fatty liver disease.

Services:
Sean provides a holistic evidence-based dietetic service for conditions including but not limited to inflammatory bowel disease, constipation, diverticular disease, irritable bowel syndrome, coeliac disease, and cancer. 
Currently, only online video and telephone appointments are available.

name: Katherine Meek
bio:
P Nutrition was founded in February 2021 and I joined the team in 2023. Myself and my colleagues at KP Nutrition have over 10 years of experience and offer specialist dietary management conditions including IBS/Functional Bowel Disorders, IBD, Pancreatic Disease, Coeliac Disease, Liver Disease and optimising the gut microbiome. As well as the gastroenterology field, I specialise in surgical dietary management and work with patients for pre- and post-surgical dietary optimisation, including complex bowel and gastric surgeries, stoma formation, and gall bladder removals.
We offer individual video or telephone consultations for those in the UK & Worldwide, allowing you to have your appointment in the comfort of your own home. Taking into account your history and dietary & lifestyle preferences, we will work together to form a realistic & bespoke plan to help you achieve your goals. Care, compassion and evidence-based advice is at the forefront of my practice.
KP Nutrition has 7 Gastroenterology Consultants & 2 Colorectal Surgeons who regularly refer to us and we also accept self-referrals. We are a registered provider with all the main UK health insurance companies. 
Alongside KP Nutrition, I also work full-time as a Specialist Surgical and Gastroenterology dietitian in an NHS trust.

name: Lore Wormsbächer
bio:
I help people with Type 2 Diabetes stop yo-yo dieting so that they can lower their blood sugar and HbA1c for good, without giving up all of their favourite foods!
Stop sugar cravings, have more energy, lose weight, and reduce medications with a personalised nutrition plan for you
Work with me if you want to:
- stop yo-yo dieting and achieve lasting results
- lower your blood sugars and HbA1c
- reduce stress-eating and emotional eating
- have more energy and sleep better
- reduce or stop your diabetes medications
- have clarity about what and when to eat for YOUR body
- prevent the long-term complications of T2 diabetes
- feel calm and in control around your favourite foods
- feel comfortable and confident in your body
If you're ready to do things differently and are open to a unique coaching approach, then apply for my program "Ditch Diabetes & Thrive" today!
I look forward to working with you to get better blood sugar and improve your health

name: Ewelina Korc
bio:
Ewelina is a HCPC Registered Dietitian with over 9 years of clinical experience gained through working in wide variety of settings within the NHS. 
She provides bespoke and evidence-based nutritional services that focus on helping you achieve your health goals and what matters most to you.

Currently Ewelina works in one of London's leading Teaching NHS Foundation Trusts as a specialist renal dietitian in the Kidney and Urology department. 
Kidney health is Ewelina's main clinical specialty. She strives to support her clients to manage their kidney condition and symptoms, while also enjoying a well balanced diet.

In addition, Ewelina has a wealth of clinical experience in other areas of dietetics gained through clinical work to date, including: chronic liver and pancreatic disease, critical care, oncology, general and gastrointestinal surgery, diabetes, weight loss, heart disease, nutrition support, including oral, tube, and intravenous nutrition support
 
This broad clinical experience allows Ewelina to take a holistic and big-picture approach when working with clients and analysing their unique clinical circumstances.

Ewelina offers consultations in English and Polish.

For more information, or to book a consultation with Ewelina go to Kore Nutrition website www.kore-nutrition.com .

bio:
I’m Lizzie Sanchez; a Dietitian registered with the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) based in Croydon, South London and Surrey with over 10 years of experience in the NHS and privately.
I am passionate about using the most up-to-date research to help you make changes to your diet and lifestyle to manage health conditions and improve the quality of your life. I love helping people to feel better and live life to their fullest!
How I can help you:
I specialise in helping people with the following issues:
• Gastrointestinal disorders; including Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) and the low FODMAP diet, SIBO, Inflammatory Bowel Disease
• Weight management
• Type 2 Diabetes
• Cardiovascular Disease
• Healthy eating and nutritional deficiencies
• Plant-based, vegetarian and vegan diets
Click here to download my Free One Week Low FODMAP Plant-based Meal Plan.
Offers and fees:
Fees: £97 for the first hour session and £69 for 45 minute follow-up sessions. I am registered with health insurer WPA.
I offer special packages including unlimited support between consultations for:
• Weight loss: including a personalised weight loss plans and meal plans.
• IBS: including low FODMAP advice, lots of recipes and meal plans if needed.
More about me:
I have a Bachelor’s Degree with Hons from King’s College London and graduated in 2013. My previous NHS roles include Specialist Gastrointestinal Dietitian at East Surrey Hospital and Community Dietitian for St George’s Hospital.
I offer virtual and in-person consultations from my lovely garden office in South Croydon.
Book a free 15 minute discovery call or appointment directly here, alternatively contact me by email at lizzie@greenhealthdietetics.com (check junk mail for replies) or call on 07929104615. I'm looking forward to hearing from you!
Read my 100 % 5* Google reviews.

name: Hannah Nahorniak
bio:
I am Hannah Nahorniak, a freelance Registered Dietitian and founder of HN Nutrition & Dietetics.

I have always had a love for food. Growing up the science of nutrition, and how our diet can influence the way our bodies function, fascinated me. This led me to my career in dietetics.I initially completed an undergraduate Masters of Nutrition degree, with state registration in Dietetics, at the University of Nottingham. Moving to London, and during my time working at Guys and St Thomas’ NHS Foundation Trust, I went on to complete a MPhil in Nutritional Sciences, in the area of Nutrition in cancer treatment.

I have over 20 years of clinical and managerial NHS experience in a variety of hospital and community settings, with further experience in the food services and foods for special medical purposes industries.  

My specialist areas include gastrointestinal diseases including IBS, nutrition in cancer and achieving a healthy weight, albeit the need to gain or lose it, product development and innovation. 

Above all my passion is to make people feel better, by providing the tools they need, to take care of their bodies through the food they eat.

name: Dorottya Norton
bio:
Dorottya is an experienced dietitian specialising in eating disorders and complex weight management. She has considerable clinical experience in working with children and adolescents as well as adults in both these fields and is well suited to provide expertise in supporting clients with multiple physical and mental health complexities. Dorottya’s practice aims to create a therapeutic environment and is informed by psychological approaches for sustained behaviour change. She is passionate about empowering her clients to implement realistic and sustainable changes that make a lasting difference for long term well-being.
She currently holds the position of clinical and service lead in a complex weight management service in the NHS with her experience in the public sector totalling 13 years in a variety of inpatient and community settings. Dorottya is a guest lecturer at University College London on the Eating Disorders PG Pip course and has been involved in nationwide training and mentoring to eating disorder services on the nutritional aspect of care. She has written material for group based public health and specialist education sessions and has worked in the corporate sector on health promotion projects.
Dorottya has published the abstract of the outcomes of a children’s weight management programme in the Journal of Nutrition and Dietetics and has contributed to the Clinical Guidelines for Dietitians Treating Young People with Anorexia Nervosa: a Family Based Therapy Approach.

name: Aleeza Rosenberg
company_name: Aleeza Rosenberg T/A The Balanced Dietitian https://www.aleezarosenberg.co.uk/
bio:
Aleeza Rosenberg is a highly specialised eating disorder dietitian. She graduated cum laude with an Honours degree in Dietetics and obtained a MSc in Eating Disorders with distinction from University College London (UCL). She has almost 20 years of experience working with people of all ages in both the NHS and in private practice. She was the lead eating disorders dietitian for London’s largest NHS eating disorder service for 7 years and left the NHS to focus on her private practice and her family. 

She specialises in all types of eating disorders, weight management, fertility and pregnancy and sees patients from age 13 years either face to face in her rooms in Hampstead and Finchley (North London) and also offers virtual appointments.  
 
Aleeza believes that everyone can achieve a healthy weight and a healthy relationship with food. Her mantra is ‘beautifully balanced in body and mind’ and has empowered thousands of patients including models, actresses, politicians and professional football players with the knowledge and tools to regain control of their eating, achieve a healthy weight and optimise their physical and mental wellbeing by adopting a balanced lifestyle. She combines her extensive clinical knowledge with a person-centred approach that ensures you are listened to and supported in a confidential and judgement-free environment
Some people eat when they are not hungry as a way of coping with anxiety, stress, low mood and just out of habit. Other people reward themselves with food. Aleeza’s unique skillset which combines dietetics and behavioural psychology will enable you to understand not only what you are eating but why you are eating and teach you alternative coping strategies to manage these emotions that don’t affect one’s health or weight.
 
Although she studied in London she is born and bred in sunny South Africa and hasn’t lost her South African warmth, humour (and accent). She will challenge your eating disorder head-on whilst being compassionate, empathetic and non-judgemental and will be your greatest cheerleader when you achieve your goals, regain control and find true food freedom.
 
She is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) and the British Dietetic Association (BDA). She is also a member of the BDA’s Mental Health Interest Group; the London Eating Disorders Dietetic Group and the BDA’s Maternal and Fertility specialist group. She is an honorary lecturer for several tertiary universities and colleges in the UK.

My website provides detail about how I work, what services I offer, clinic room and fees. You can find this at https://www.aleezarosenberg.co.uk

name: Hannah Cook
bio:
Hello, I am Hannah and I am a registered Dietitian (Bsc).
I have been working as an NHS Dietitian since 2017. In this time, I have worked in a variety of different areas, and specialised in cancer care in 2019. I love working within this area and I have continued to work in this speciality until the present day.
As a Dietitian, I have studied for four years at university and can provide up-to-date, evidence-based dietary advice to help you to achieve your goals.

Day to day, I support individuals:

- Undergoing cancer treatment
- Optimising themselves before surgery
- Returning to eating following surgery to their jaw/mouth/tongue/throat
As well as my daily work in the NHS, I have specialist interests and knowledge in:
- Improving general health through dietary intake
- Sports nutrition- I aim to help use nutrition to help others excel in their chosen activity.
- Building bodyweight in a healthy manner
- Diet in POTS syndrome -as I have experienced this first hand
- Vegetarian diets and sustainable eating habits -although I only talk about these if you are asking for help in these areas!

I am based in Gloucestershire and offer remote appointments at a time to suit you. Please get in touch if you feel I may be able to support you, or somebody you know.
I look forward to hearing from you, 
Hannah
clinical_expertise: Oncology, Food security & sustainability, Nutrition support, Nutrition for older people, Veganism and Vegetarianism

name: Alison Holloway
bio:
Compassionate, open minded, body positive, collaborative approach. Adults age 16 plus. Video call from anywhere in the UK.

I am a registered Dietitian with 30 years of NHS experience in a variety of roles. My main focus is on neurodivergence, disordered eating and chronic health conditions.
I take an individual, food first, approach to each client, being very much focused on building self-esteem and independent decision making around food and health. 
My practice is neuro affirming and gender affirming, feel free to always show up as your authentic self.

The following is an example of some of the areas I work with. If you are not sure if I can work with you, please get in touch.
Chronic illness - Optimizing nutrition through diet especially, m.e/cfs, PoTS (postural tachycardia syndrome), Ehlers Danlos/hypermobility, long Covid and not yet diagnosed symptoms
MCAS (Mast cell activation syndrome) and histamine intolerance
Eating differences in Autism and ADHD - binge eating, snacking, irregular eating, sensory seeking or avoidance - neuro affirming approach
Arfid (Avoidant Restrictive Food Intake Disorder) in adults - neuro affirming approach
Disordered eating - not including diagnosed, active, eating disorders where a team approach is recommended
Support to build a more positive relationship with food - past eating disorders, emotional eating, secret eating. Without concern about weight loss or gain, no matter what your starting weight
Health regardless of weight - optimizing health whatever your weight
Worries and concerns - about the way you are eating, the balance of your diet, how your diet may be impacting on your physical or mental health
Diet confusion - worries about managing multiple diets for multiple conditions, medical diets not presented in a way that makes sense to you
Pre diabetes and Type 2 diabetes - with a special interest in weight neutral approaches
industry_services: Private practice, Lecturing & teaching, Conferences, Education & Academia, Articles
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Eating disorders, Freelance Practice, Mental health, Writing

name: Sumeya Jakhura
title: BSc Hons
bio:
Sumeya Jakhura is a highly experienced Dietitian wellness professional with a passion for helping women achieve optimal health. With over 16 years of experience in the field, Sumeya has developed a deep understanding of the unique nutritional needs and challenges faced by women of all ages.
Sumeya's approach to wellness is holistic and personalised, taking into account not only dietary habits but also lifestyle factors and individual goals. She believes that true wellness is achieved through a balanced and sustainable approach to nutrition and lifestyle choices.
With a warm and empathetic demeanour, Sumeya creates a supportive environment where women can feel comfortable discussing their health concerns and goals.
She specialises in Skin Health & Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome and has helped many women navigate their way though their symptoms and concerns so they can feel better within themselves. Her expertise extends to a wide range of other related areas, including weight management, hormone balance, fertility, skin health, digestive health, and overall well-being. Through evidence-based strategies and practical advice, Sumeya empowers her clients to make positive and lasting changes to their health.
If you are a woman seeking professional guidance on your health journey, Sumeya Jakhura is here to help you achieve your goals and live your best life. Contact her today to schedule a consultation and embark on a path towards improved health and wellness.

name: Claire Fudge
contact_address: Moss Grove, Kingswinford, West Midlands United Kingdom
bio:
A highly successful and reputable High-Performance Nutritionist and Clinical Dietician with +20 years clinical experience, incorporating 12 years in high performance sports nutrition. ISAK trained and age group endurance triathlete and cyclist, leading consultations with professional and elite athletes, clinical patients and the general public to leverage knowledge and motivate behaviours to transform personal and athlete development with appropriate personal plans. Maintains a strong understanding of sports, including cycling, equestrian, and running, offering valuable transferable skills from a theoretical and practical perspective. Broadly experienced in multiple environments, including clinical, healthcare and education, ensuring the development of strong relationships and adaptability to different work cultures, including corporate and host agencies of the English Institute of Sport (EIS) including Performance Pathways.
Performance Objectives : Corporate  Programmes 
Practical Nutrition Strategies : Consultations & Group Sessions : 
Individual Performance Plans : Innovative Projects : Continuous Professional Development
Multidisciplinary Teams  : Anti-Doping Regulations
Nutrition Services :  Athletic Development
Elite and professional Competition Preparation :Database Management Staff Liaison & Collaboration (Chefs) : Contribution to Media
I work with athletes of all levels and ages to optimise their nutrition for performance and recovery. I specialise in endurance sports, engaging with dancers, triathletes, endurance triathletes, ultra-runners, cyclists, and weight-related sports including athletes with eating disorders, disordered eating and REDs (Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport). I work together with professional, elite and age group athletes and supporting them in preparation for the Summer and Winter Olympic Games including Tokyo 2021 and Paris 2024 the professional and Elite Triathlon circuit, European and World Championships. I work as part of the Talented Athlete Scholarship Scheme (TASS), Youth Talent Programme (YTP) and Diploma in Sporting Excellence programme (DiSE) in conjunction with NGBs including England Athletics, British Athletics, Hockey England, Netball England and the Motorsports UK Academy (MSA).
On a personal level, I maintain a strong interest and involvement in various sports. I have competed and represented in the GB as part of the Team at ITU , World Championships, ran several ultra marathons and participated in multiple sports and adventure activities, spanning horse riding, dancing, skiing, and scuba diving. Additionally, for consecutive years, I have been a Top 10 female Triathlete in Ironman in the world and top 5 in the UK; I have represented GB internationally.

name: Eleana Papadopoulou
title: BSc, MPH, MSc, RD
bio:
I am a Registered Clinical Dietitian with a mission: to help people develop the healthiest possible relationship between food and their body.

As far back as I can remember, I was into both medicine and food. I loved the satisfaction that comes with helping those in need… I also loved eating, experimenting with recipes, going to restaurants and trying different cuisines.

When it was time for me to choose a career, the only way forward was to combine my interest in medicine and my love for food. And this is how my journey as a Clinical Dietitian began.

About my experience

I have extensive experience working as a dietitian in a variety of sectors including the NHS, Academia, Publishing, and Policy Making.


Qualifications

BSc (Hons) Nutrition and Dietetics -King’s College London
Master of Public Health - Imperial College London
Master of Science (Specialist Area – Diabetes) - University of Oxford
Master of Science in Diabetes Care: Intensive Insulin Therapy Module - King’s College London

Professional Registrations

Health and Care Professions Council
British Dietetic Association
Diabetes UK

name: Louise Symington
bio:
Hello, I’m a Registered Dietitian with over 15 years experience in NHS, private practice and the charity sector. My background includes running GP clinics (covering child allergies through to weight management) catering and food policy work at charities such as The National Trust and product development at brands such as Cradle and Bloom. I’ve also advised at government level working on DEFRA’s Green Food Project.
How I can help you
I know that changing eating habits can sometimes be hard. This is why I ensure my advice fits in with my clients lifestyle and budget. I empower people to make positive changes for themselves – rather than ‘dictating’ what they should or shouldn’t do. Building a healthy relationship with food is also very important but sometimes overlooked. If we enjoy our food we are much more likely to sustain changes. This is something I can explore in sessions if it interests you.
Given my background in sustainability, I can also offer expert advice on the ethical side of food (welfare, fair trade, carbon footprint) as well as vegetarianism and veganism too.
I work in Brighton, Hove, Portslade and beyond.

I am an HCPC-registered dietitian and a full member of the BDA. I have experience in PRECLINICAL neuroscience, general clinical nutrition and dietetics (acute and community), clinical research, and public health initiatives. I am also a keen freediver and a language enthusiast with a multicultural background. I am fully proficient in English, Italian, and Spanish, and I can provide my services in these languages.

My colleague and I, Beth Allchin, set up Beam Dietitians in 2024 to help support children in Manchester with nutritional problems and feeding difficulties. I am anti-diet culture and believe that people can be healthy at every size, it is about helping people to find a weight, diet and lifestyle that helps them to be fit and well.

name: Anita Bowes
bio:
Over my 18 years of dietetic practice I have worked in the various areas of dietetics and have been part of the NHS and commercial clinical and research teams in developing lifestyle programs for pre-diabetes, diabetes prevention and reversal. My specialist dietetic clinical expertise are in diabetes (both Type 1 and Type 2) and digestive health. I In addition, I have a special interest in technologies like insulin pumps and glucose sensors, gestational diabetes, PCOS as well as weight management. I am certified in delivering Low FODMAP diets for people with IBS. I work privately as well as in the NHS. As freelance dietitian I work with individual patients as well as consult commercial companies on dietary content development for their digital health technologies. 

I am accredited by most health insurance companies, like AXA, Vitality, Bupa, Healix and others.

I appreciate the difficulty my clients face when trying to make permanent lifestyle and dietary changes therefore, in addition to my clinical training to achieve Masters Degree in Dietetics, I have completed additional training in behavioural sciences: I am an accredited Neuro-Linguistic Programming practitioner, a trained in hypnotherapy and have extensive training in Cognitive Behavioural Therapy.

I am a caring and non-judgmental practitioner and support my clients on each step of their treatment journey.

To contact me, please use my e-mail me on anita.bowes@acediets.com, rather than use the contact form. For more information, please visit my website www.acediets.com.

name: Nese Targen
bio: Nese is a registered dietitian specialising in weight management, complex obesity and bariatric surgery with a demonstrated history of woking in NHS and private sector. Throughout her career Nese has been working with culturally diverse populations which she loves and enjoys the most. She provides continuous support and guidance to her clients throughout their weight loss journey by using her unique person tailored approach and evidence-based practice. Nese inspires and empowers her clients to achieve their dietary goals such as demonstrating sustainable weight loss, improving health conditions such as pre-diabetes, Type 2 Diabetes, PCOS, dyslipidaemia, fatty liver disease, hypertension, underactive thyroidism etc. through dietary and life-style changes, demonstrating good knowledge and understanding about nutrition and improving their overall wellbeing and quality of life. Nese works closely with individuals who are considering having a bariatric surgery as well as with individuals who have had the bariatric surgery and needing continuous support and guidance for sustainable life-style. Living with bariatric surgery can be challenging at times and can require a long-term support to sustain a balanced life-style. Hence, Nese will assist you to overcome any challenges/obstacles and guide you through your journey. She is fluent in Turkish and English.

name: Nishti Udeh
bio:
Nishti’s Choice is your trusted clinic for family nutrition, offering expert support for children and adults managing a range of health conditions, including food allergies (CMPA, egg, wheat, soya), MCAS (Mast Cell Activation Syndrome), histamine intolerance, ARFID (Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder), eating disorders, diabetes, and weight loss.
Founded by Nishti, an international dietitian and mindful parenting advocate, Nishti’s Choice provides compassionate guidance to help families navigate the challenges of food allergies, feeding difficulties, and other medical conditions. With years of clinical experience and certification in mindfulness teaching, Nishti’s ethos offers a holistic, evidence-based approach that supports both the body and mind. Nishti is also a regular voice in the media, appearing on ITV News to discuss nutrition and health topics.
Whether you're managing allergies, dealing with feeding challenges like ARFID, or seeking support for diabetes or weight loss, Nishti’s Choice is here to guide your family with practical strategies and unwavering support. Nishti’s expertise ensures a comprehensive approach to your family’s health, helping you feel confident every step of the way.

bio:
I am a state registered dietitian, registered with the British Dietetic Association and the Health and Care Professions Council. I qualified from the University of Surrey in 2001 with a BSc (Hons) in Nutrition & Dietetics.
I am an experienced and empathetic dietitian with a specialist interest in weight management, cardiovascular disease and diabetes.
I worked in the NHS for a number of years and now work as a freelance dietitian in Canterbury, East Kent.  I can also offer telephone or online consultations. 
I offer a friendly and professional service in a non-clinical environment (a few miles from Canterbury) to individuals, giving practical and achievable advice on how you can lose weight or manage your diabetes / cardiovascular disease.
Please contact me by email or phone to discuss your particular requirements. (Please note, I just see adult clients and I do not see clients requiring allergy, eating disorder or gastro advice).

name: Megan Rossi
bio:
As a registered dietitian with a PhD in Gut Health, Dr Megan Rossi’s foremost passion is to help people through personalised guidance. She saw that people were receiving nutrition advice that was not evidence-based, leading to sub optimal results and wanted to provide the high quality, results-driven service that people deserved.

In 2019, Megan brought together leading dietitians from King’s College to establish a London-based clinic for those suffering from issues in their gut and beyond. The Gut Health Clinic now offers support for all nutritional needs using the latest scientifically proven strategies — from food intolerances to weight management, mental health, women’s health & more. We now also have a face-to-face clinic in Manchester and also offer online consultations across the UK and internationally.
Use discount code BDA10 when booking to receive a unique 10% discount off your initial consultation with one of the specialist gut dietitians at The Gut Health Clinic.

name: Anastasia Gkegka
title: RD, MSc, BSc Hons, ANutr
bio:
Hello, I am Anastasia, a registered dietitian and eating disorder specialist. With a long-standing passion for nutrition, I am dedicated to assessing, diagnosing, and treating dietary and nutritional issues using scientific evidence and personalized approaches.
Currently working as an eating disorder specialist dietitian in the NHS, I have gained extensive experience in this field. Over the years, I've had the privilege of supporting individuals with various eating disorders, from anorexia nervosa to binge eating disorder and bulimia nervosa. I believe in creating a safe and supportive environment where clients can explore their relationship with food and their bodies. I integrate mindful eating practices and tailor support to each individual’s unique journey to recovery.
I am deeply passionate about helping individuals overcome eating disorders and providing compassionate care to support them along the way.
In our consultations, I take a holistic approach, addressing not only diet but also other factors such as body image, stress levels, schedule, and lifestyle habits. This comprehensive approach allows us to work together effectively towards your goals, particularly through mindful eating practices. I pride myself on my compassion and strive to deliver the highest quality of care to promote health and well-being.

Qualifications:
BSc Food and Human Nutrition
MSc Applied Sport and Exercise Nutrition
MSc in Dietetics

name: Kirsty Wood
bio:
Book a free discovery call to see how I can help you.
My goal is to help you to feel comfortable and confident in your body right from the beginning. Send me a message to see how we can work together.

Supporting people with:
A better relationship with food: food Freedom, intuitive eating, overcoming disordered eating
Starting a family: Preconception, fertility and pregnancy nutrition
Gut symptom improvement: IBS, SIBO, reflux (GERD/GORD) food intolerances, gut health and low FODMAP diets

FOOD FREEDOM
Break up with yo-yo dieting, the scales and counting calories. Nourish your body, find balance and enjoy food without guilt.

My goal is to help you to feel comfortable and confident in your body right from the beginning. I would love to be part of your support system to help you work towards a life free from:
“food guilt”
overeating, And
stressing about being left alone with snacks in the house!

If you would like to try and experience less guilt, overeating and stress around food in 2025 and beyond, contact me to see how we can make that happen for you!


PRECONCEPTION & FERTILITY NUTRITION
No matter where you are in your fertility journey, there is evidence to suggest that optimising both the male and female diet is important.

If you’re planning a pregnancy in the future, or trying to conceive (TTC) now, whether through natural or assisted methods, there is evidence to suggest that making small changes to your diet and lifestyle can help to support both egg and sperm health. Let me support you on your journey, book a discovery call today.


GUT HEALTH AND IBS
Do you have unpleasant bowel symptoms? Intolerances? Allergies? Irritable Bowel Syndrome? Bloating? Gas? Constipation or Diarrhoea?

This can sometimes be caused or exacerbated by the foods we eat. By working together we can methodically identify food triggers that are contributing to your symptoms.

You will receive a comprehensive plan and work towards improving your symptoms, improving your gut health.


Next steps…
If you would like to know more about how I can help you with your nutrition, book a discovery call today.

name: Christian Lee
bio: I currently work as a Consultant Eating Disorders Dietitian in the NHS in the North West of England. I had the honour of serving two full terms as the Chair of the Mental Health Specialist Group up until June 2023. I have many years of experience supporting people with all forms of eating disorders; from ARFID, Binge Eating Disorder, Bulimia to Anorexia. I specialise in supporting those with Eating Disorders with complex co-morbidities such as Type 1 Diabetes, and substance misuse, and complex trauma. I also have significant experience in supporting individuals on the Autistic Spectrum with an eating disorder.

name: Vanessa McMinn
bio:
I qualified as a Dietitian in 2000 from University of Ulster. I began my  dietetic career in Greater Manchester before returning home to NI in 2002.  I have always had a keen interest in sport nutrition.  In 2003 I successfully completed my BDA Accredited Sports Dietitian course and started up my own Part-time Freelance Sports Nutrition Consultancy: Victory Nutrition. This has given me the opportunity to work within the Sports Institute of Northern Ireland  where I got experience working alongside elite athletes, County Football teams and the NI football team. I continue to support the IFA ladies development squad and other aspiring athletes through various clubs and societies.
With my varying dietetic roles over the past two decades, I have gained extensive experience in many medical conditions, health promotion, school nutrition and performance nutrition. I am also a volunteer member of the British Dietetic Association N.I. Board  and I am a nutrition spokesperson for Safefood. I have recently completed FODMAP training via King's College, London and Nutrition for Fertility via Early Life Nutrition Alliance. 

With each individual client that I meet, my aim is to brush away and dispel any dietary myths that may have been inherited by generations of conflicting and confusing dietary information.  All dietary advice is tailored to the individuals unique personal requirements with the aim of getting the individual back to enjoying their food but also achieving their desired goals.

name: Alicia du Preez
title: Bsc (Hons) Dietetics
bio:
I am Alicia, a Registered Dietitian specialising in paediatric and infant nutrition.
Registered with the Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC) & the British Dietetic Association (BDA), I completed my Honours Bachelor of Science (BSc Hons) in Dietetics at the University of Pretoria in South Africa, where I am also a part of a paediatric work group where the latest evidenced based practise in the paediatric subset is studied. Other certification that I completed are around breastfeeding and lactation.
Seeing your little one falter on their growth and development due to some concern implicating nutrition or the gastrointestinal tract may be very frustrating. As parents you may feel very helpless especially when there is so much contradicting information available online. As a dietitian specialising in paediatrics, I pride myself in my wealth of clinical knowledge and expertise and have a passion for approaching each child holistically, addressing needs and requirements individually. I aim to be your nutritional go-to for any nutrition related concerns and pledge to provide a quality personalised service which will not only give you peace of mind as a parent but most importantly leave your little one feeling their best while growing like a champion.
In our sessions, we will have a comprehensive discussion around your child’s health, medical background, and nutritional concerns at hand. We will identify any factors that may have contributed to the symptom onset and discuss evidenced based strategies on how we will address this best within the framework of your lifestyle. I enjoy empowering parents to be more vigilant and proactive when it comes to all things nutrition.
I have obtained a Bachelor of Science degree with honors at the University of pretoria and has since completed various courses in paediatric nutrition, breastfeeding and lactation. Areas that I specialise in includes: Breast feeding and lactation, introduction into solids & weaning challenges, functional gastrointestinal disorders, cow's milk protein allergies, multiple allergies, picky eating, ASD, IBS/IBD, Micronutrient deficiencies, failure to thrive and stunying, childhood obesity, oncology.

name: Carolyn Jackson
contact_address: NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE, Tyne And Wear United Kingdom
bio:
I’m Carolyn (Spooner) Jackson, a registered dietitian, and founder of Spooner Nutrition, an online dietetic practice. I have 16 years of experience as a dietitian, predominately working in the NHS and in more recent years private practice and freelance. I'm based in Newcastle upon-Tyne, North East England.
My specialised services encompass diabetes management during pregnancy, tailored nutritional guidance for type 1 or type 2 diabetes, professional recommendations for reducing blood glucose levels, nutritional counselling for heart health, cholesterol, and blood pressure, as well as recipe modifications to promote healthier eating habits.
My love for food and science ignited long before pursuing a career as a dietitian. While still in high school, I delved into the culinary world by taking on a part-time role at a quaint restaurant in North Wales, where I assisted chefs with fundamental food preparation. I then went onto work in another two restaurants, earning a NVQ in food preparation and catering along the way. This experience laid a solid groundwork for mastering culinary essentials like crafting soup from scratch using a roux, developing rich meat stocks, and flawlessly frying eggs during bustling breakfast shifts.
While thriving in the culinary world, I realised my yearning for the scientific and health aspects of food. After six years in the culinary realm, I made the decision to retire my chef whites and focus entirely on pursuing a degree in nutrition and dietetics.
In 2008, I became a registered dietitian and embarked on a diverse career within the NHS. My journey has encompassed roles in adult weight management tier 3 programmes, oral nutrition support on the wards and community setting, and my true passion diabetes. I have had the privilege of collaborating with accomplished doctors, nurses, psychologists, and esteemed dietitians.
As well as working freelance, I currently work as a Lead Primary Care Network Dietitian specialising in diabetes within the NHS.

name: Charlotte Foster
bio:
Graduating with a first class degree in Nutrition from the University of Nottingham, Charlotte went on to gain her MSc in Dietetics at King's College London before qualifying as a Registered Dietitian and Nutritionist.

Since qualifying, Charlotte has gained a wealth of experience working in an array of medical specialisms within a top London NHS trust. This invaluable experience has provided Charlotte with the knowledge to provide expert to help her clients improve their health and achieve their dietary goals.

Services available:

Online 1:1 consultations- Charlotte will spend time understanding your goals and aims as well as conducting a thorough nutritional assessment. Using evidence- based nutrition, Charlotte will provide advice and support and you  will work together to devise and set goals that are achievable and realistic to help you make steps towards fulfilling your goal/aim.

Dietary analysis- Using specialist dietary software, Charlotte can help analyse the nutritional content of your diet and has had experience of analysing the nutritional content of menus.

Nutrition Workshops & Retreats - Available online or in person at work or events, Charlotte will deliver an informative and interactive workshop tailored to your specification based on a range of topics to choose from.

Cook & Eat sessions- Charlotte loves nothing more than to join you in the kitchen and translate the theory of nutrition in practical culinary advice.

Training, qualifications & experience:
First Class Degree BSc (Hons) Nutrition, University of Nottingham
MSc Dietetics, Kings College London
Registered Dietitian – Health (HCPC)
Member of the British Dietetic Association
Member of BDA Specialist Interest Groups: Freelance Dietitians’ Group  & Food Allergy Specialist Interest Group.

name: Marianne Hayward
title: MSc
bio:
I have enjoyed over 30 years in the world of performance nutrition, advising people of all ages. Nutrition is a constantly changing science and I provide up to date, common sense advice on how to apply this science in a practical ‘food first’ approach
My previous experience spanned across Health and Social Care and Performance Nutrition. I have a decade of operational experience at senior management level while working alongside the Scottish Government as a professional advisor. My main achievement within this role was improving hospital flow and practice related to patient discharge and community resettlement.
In parallel with this, I am also a state registered dietitian, with an expertise in athletic performance nutrition, body composition, weight loss and RED -S. I have worked across elite sport, young people and sport, teams and dance

name: Katherine Kimber
bio:
Do any of these sound familiar?
“I feel addicted to food.”
“I can’t keep certain food in the house, like chocolate, as I know I will just eat it all”
“I’m confused, fed up and need advice from a qualified professional.”
“I’ve been on and off of so many different diets and nothing seems to work.”
“I binge eat, overeat and find that I just can’t stop eating.”
“I eat when I am feeling emotional, anxious or stressed.”
“My whole life feels like it’s revolved around eating or planning to eat healthily.”
“I have a long list of forbidden foods and food rules and I just want to enjoy eating healthy foods.”
“I have a medical condition which needs managing with nutrition.”
“I have been diagnosed with an Eating Disorder (or think I have one) and I need a Dietitian”
We help you find food freedom & body trust
Learn to trust yourself around food, nourish your body without the rules
Break free from bingeing & overeating to free up space to live your best life
Understand & manage emotional eating
Eliminate the confusion by receiving expert advice from qualified professionals
Receive one-to-one support from the comfort of your own home
We are a team of Online Dietitians and Intuitive Eating Counsellors offering a unique approach to finding food happiness. Our philosophy is to free you from your food obsessions. Learn how to ditch the rules so you can eat with happiness – for good!
Nude Nutrition was founded in 2017, by Registered Dietitian, Katherine Kimber. She has carefully selected a team of specialist online Registered Dietitians and professionals who have a wealth of experience in helping people heal from difficult relationships with food and their body.
We take a unique non-diet approach, specialising in helping you to cultivate body wisdom and trust through Intuitive Eating. 
We work with those who feel stuck with food, those who experience eating disorders, disordered eating, and generally challenging relationships with food and their bodies. 
We can work with you if you have a diagnosed eating disorder, disordered eating, and/or are feeling a bit muddled with other needs in the mix – like Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), (or gut issues you feel are linked to food), Diabetes, Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS), Fertility, Pregnancy, or have Sport specific needs. 
We aim to empower you to find body trust, food freedom, and happiness, to improve your overall health and well-being.

name: Tabassum Kabeer
title: BSC
company_name: Your goals your pace your Dietitian www.tabbydietitian.co.uk
bio:
I have over 35 years of continuous and rewarding service in the N HS
I qualified with a Nutrition and Dietetics degree in 1988 with further qualifications in Paediatrics tier 1, C&G Teaching stage. Before entering the dietetic profession, worked as a care nurse in a private nursing home.
I have a great deal of experience in the following:
Weight loss,
Diabetes,
Childhood obesity,
Ethnic Diets,
Weight gain and Nutrition Support,
Care of the elderly,
Bowel disorders,
Cancer care
Women's and Men's health,
Group Education
learning disabilities
Social media, some TV and radio
My Key skills and work experience include:
Group education programs: Asian Type 2 Diabetes (able to speak URDU and Hindi ASIAN DESMOND), Type 2 Diabetes education in Lincolnshire (spotlight) and in Wales (DESMOND), lipid lowering, impaired glucose tolerance, cardiac rehabilitation, hospital staff, pregnancy, mother and baby, schools, elderly, and weight loss groups.
Media work -in 2006 was a guest on the BBC Wales radio with Jamie Owen for advice on weight loss for adults, questions and answers session and salt reduction for children. Recently with Mathew Pritchard Dirty vegan 14.1.19 BBC TV Wales on children breakfast and using Tempeh and 17.1.20 on vegan meal ideas for active older person and benefit of omega 3 fats.
Clinical -I have worked in specialist posts in Paediatric, Diabetes, Nutritional support, Care of the elderly, gastroenterology, Liver, and renal disease, antenatal, health promotion and community dietetics. Current in adult weight management for the N H S and seeing private BUPA and  cancer patients  online . 
Advice for the ethnic minority- throughout 34 years as a Dietitian, able to use my bilingual skills (understands Urdu/Hindi) to address the nutritional needs of the ethnic minority in both 1:1 consultation and group setting.
Producing up-to-date nutrition resources for my clients, Creating adult weight management website
Nutrition support- Throughout my clinical experience I have seen patients requiring nutritional support in hospital, community at G.P surgeries, home visits and nursing homes. Now working with Rutherford cancer care in Wales and England seeing patients before, during and after treatment.
Learning Disability- Currently working with five private homes seeing clients supporting staff and help designing and analyse menus.
Have Continuing professional development record , Currently undergoing ACT online training .

I am known as Tabby who has a friendly approachable personality that puts patients, from varied background and cultures, at ease. My advice is Patient centred.
I am compassionate, a good listener and a registered health care professional who cares for your health.

name: Hazel Duncan
bio:
I am a registered children’s dietitian with 19years clinical experience in the NHS and with particular expertise in paediatric nutritional support, restricted diet, food allergies and gastrointestinal conditions such as IBS and IBD.  I also have experience in clinical research and worked alongside University of Glasgow around IBD research.

I have a BSc Honours degree in Human Nutrition and Dietetics.  I am registered with the British Dietetic Association and Health Care Professions Council.  I am a member of the British Society of Paediatric Gastroenterology, Hepatology and Nutrition and the British Dietetic Association Paediatric group.

I am actively involved in hosting one of the MSc modules alongside the University of Plymouth.

 I am mum of two boys and juggle home life, NHS work and private work, I thoroughly enjoy my role as a paediatric dietitian and find my role extremely rewarding.

name: Angharad Banner
bio:
I’m a Dietitian and Nutrition Consultant with over twenty years specialist paediatric experience within the NHS and private sector.  

I run face to face clinics in South Wales and virtually where I have a UK-wide client base.

Following a BSc (Hons) Nutrition degree at University of Surrey and a postgraduate diploma in Dietetics at Kings College London, I trained and began practising at Guy’s and St. Thomas’ Hospital in London. I moved to Great Ormond Street Hospital to specialise in paediatric dietetics. After eight years in London, I relocated to Wales to serve as the Paediatric Dietetic Manager at Cardiff & Vale University Health Board for five years.

In 2013 I started my own private practice, abcdietitian and took a break from the NHS to concentrate on my freelance business.
I returned to the NHS in 2019 and I currently work part-time as a specialist eating disorder's (CAMHS) dietitian and I’m a registered practitioner for both adults and children with B-eat (Beating Eating Disorders). I am also a visiting lecturer at Cardiff Metropolitan University and I work on a voluntary and consultancy basis with the Vegan Society.
I’m registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC), a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and I serve on the BDA Specialist Paediatric Group Committee.
In recent years, I’ve been in high demand as a guest speaker at healthcare professional events nationwide, presenting on a wide variety of subjects including childhood obesity, growing issues in toddler nutrition, cow’s milk protein allergy, the developing gut and eating disorders. I also teach cookery workshops to healthcare professionals to help them treat allergies. My nutrition modules and webinars are part of the curriculum for the Advanced Coaching Academy, the UK’s premier training organisation for personal fitness instructors.

I have written three recipes books to go alongside formula milk for babies with cow's milk protein allergy and I am a regular recipe contributor for BBC Tiny Happy People and I consult for BBC Education and The Vegan Society.

I serve on the BDA Paediatric Specialist Group Committee as the Public Relations Officer and enjoy this role and the opportunities it brings. 
With three young children of my own, including one with a dairy and peanut allergy, I’m very aware of the difficulties of encouraging kids to eat a healthy balanced diet. I’ve always been an enthusiastic cook and have published two dairy-free cookbooks. My recipe for Mediterranean turkey gratin won the ‘Best Dietitian Recipe’ at the 2013 British Turkey Awards.

name: Laura Malone
bio:
I've always had a passion for food as far back as I can remember; one of my earliest memories is my father and I bent over my Granny's recipe for wheaten bread trying to read her writing...still not convinced I used the correct quantity of flour!
I graduated from the University of Ulster, Ireland back in 2016 and have lived in the South East area for over 6 years. I've been a committee member for the South East BDA branch and have experience across a wide variety of specialties including Cystic Fibrosis, Gastroenterology and Intensive Care. I am registered with The British Dietetic Association and Health Care Professions Council. 
I currently work with individuals, across the UK, who are struggling to lose weight.
I believe food is highly emotive and there are a multitude of reasons why we may struggle with our weight. I began my freelance career after seeing just how people get stuck in a 'diet cycle' and the need for trustworthy advice to help with weight loss.
My aim is to provide guidance and empower you to make healthier choices to help you reach your own health and wellbeing goals. For some that may be as simple as improving their relationship with food. I will take the time to work with you and your individual needs.
I split my time between NHS and private practice but can facilitate appointments Monday to Sunday via video or phone call. Morning, afternoon, evening and weekend appointments are available.
I offer a free 10-minute introductory call so to get started either complete a new enquiry form, phone or email.
Enquiry Form: https://linktr.ee/maloneslarder
Email: dietitianlauramalone@gmail.com
Phone: 07415 298 662

name: Namita Barnes
title: BSc, MSc, PgDip
bio: Women's health has been a passion for many years. In my early 20s, I received a life-changing diagnosis of severe endometriosis, a journey that led me through multiple cycles of IUI and IVF in my 30s and early 40s. These personal experiences sparked an interest in how making changes to your diet may help to improve your symptoms and enhance fertility. This also led me to change my career and become a dietitian. I know how even small changes can make a big difference to your well-being and want to help other women to do the same.
clinical_expertise: Fertility, Freelance Practice, Menopause, Obesity, Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), Weight loss

name: Katie Westwood
bio:
I have over 10 years of experience working as a Dietitian, with a keen interest in Gastroenterology. I specialise in managing conditions including IBS/Functional Bowel Disorders, IBD, Pancreatic Disease, Coeliac Disease, Liver Disease and optimising the gut microbiome and more.
I founded KP Nutrition in February 2021 and since 2023, have had another dietitian, Katherine Meek, also offer clinic appointments at KP Nutrition. In addition to Gastro experience, Katherine also has experience in complex surgery. 
We offer individual video or telephone consultations for those in the UK & Worldwide, allowing you to have your appointment in the comfort of your own home. Taking into account your history and dietary & lifestyle preferences, we will work together to form a realistic & bespoke plan to help you achieve your goals. Care, compassion and evidence based advice is at the forefront of my practice.
I have 7 Gastroenterology Consultants & 2 Colorectal Surgeons who regularly refer to me and I also accept self-referrals. I am a registered provider with all the main UK health insurance companies.
Alongside KP Nutrition, I also work part time as a lead gastroenterology dietitian in an NHS trust.
*Please note: As often initial replies go to junk, please also check your junk box as well as your inbox if you are expecting a reply from me *

name: Joe Alvarez
bio:
I am Joe Alvarez, a Registered Dietitian offering a range of services, but specialising in gut health & IBS management. With a proven track record using evidence based methods to treat 100’s of people just like you.

IBS and other digestive issues can get in the way of your life and prevent you from being the best you can be. As I understand what it is like to live with IBS, I take an empathetic approach with my clients, treating everyone as an individual. I always tailor advice, which is so important when it comes to diet and lifestyle.

I will provide tailored plans to suit each individuals needs, helping you achieve your goals to a happier and healthier you. I am committed to exceeding the expectations of patients, using scientifically proven methods that deliver results. I will provide you with the personalised care and the clear plan you deserve. My goal is for clients to achieve symptom control so you can ultimately improve your quality of life.

I offer consultations online so I am not limited by borders. Please contact me to arrange a FREE 15 minute consultation. This will give you the chance to tell me what the issue is and to find out how I can help you.
Qualifications and Training
PgDip Nutrition and Dietetics (2015-2017)

BSc (Hons) Nutrition (2012-2015)
BDA FODMAP Course (2017)
BDA Enteral Feeding Course (2017)
The Advanced Development Programme for Clinicians (2018)
Registered with the Health care professionals council (HCPC No. DT29663)
Member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA)
Fluent in Spanish language

name: Emma Jones
bio:
Emma is a specialist dietitian registered with the HCPC and is a member of both the diabetes and freelance specialist interest groups of the BDA.
Emma has years of experience of working with individuals and groups, including families, to meet their health and nutrition goals. Emma has successfully worked with people looking to manage their weight, eating behaviours and habits in a variety of settings and enjoys building relationships with people.
Emma currently works in a large teaching hospital in London in the diabetes and endocrine centre and can support you to get your glycaemic control towards where you’d like it be, including before and during pregnancy. Similarly this may be input regarding your diabetes technology including continuous and flash glucose monitoring reviews and review of insulin pump settings. Within her current roll she also works with  people diagnosed with PCOS, fatty liver and elevated blood cholesterol and can support you to nutritionally manage these conditions.
Emma can be consulted for a single or group of appointments and this time is used to discuss and focus on your nutritional aim and make a plan of how to get you there. Appointments can be face-to-face or via whatsapp call/facetime at a time convenient to you.

name: Yusuf Hammad
bio:
Hi I’m Yusuf, your local registered dietitian. Since gaining my honours degree in nutrition and dietetics in London, I have gained extensive experience in diabetes, weight management, behaviour change, liver disease, coeliac disease and gut issues. While I love my current role as a diabetes specialist dietitian in a hospital, I am also very passionate about helping those who need more than what their healthcare system can offer. 
My special interests include: 
Diabetes - Type 1, 2 and 3c (pancreatogenic diabetes)
Weight management 
Fatty liver disease 
Pancreatitis 
My approach is holistic, practical and effective. I consider all factors including time constraints, sleep, psychology e.g motivators/barriers, stress, anxiety and physical activity to name a few, and personalise our plan to work for you. I translate complex science into practical and specific advice that you can easily implement. 
What you'll get: 
A thorough assessment of your current diet and all the factors affecting it 
A clear, detailed, tailored plan to reach your goals 
Resources, recipe ideas and product recommendations 
A compassionate, patient, non-judgemental and supportive approach 
A unique focus on habit building and behaviour change 

Over the years I have helped thousands of people become a healthier version of themselves, don’t wait for tomorrow to start your journey.

Click on my website link above to learn more and book your free consultation in just a few clicks.

name: Brenda Smith
bio:
Mrs Brenda Smith is a Registered Dietitian, who qualified from Kings College London with a Bachelor in Science in Nutrition and Dietetics in 2009.  She was awarded a Post Graduate Diploma in Allergy from Southampton University in November 2018 qualified as a Mindful Based Eating Instructor from MB-EAT in 2020.  Previous to dietetics she worked in finance.

Brenda has practiced as specialist gastroenterology and lead specialist weight management dietitian for NHS services.  She has worked privately with adult and adolescent mental health disorders, including experience with eating disorders.  She began full-time private practice from May 2018 seeing infants, children, young persons and adults.  She further developed her practice to include optimisation of diet, exercise and sleep based on DNA, long covid and Mast Cell Activation (MCAS).

Whilst working for NHS services, Brenda was recognised for her evidence based and effective practice; twice nominated for patient excellence and showcased on effectiveness to other health professionals including the Clinical Care and Quality Commission on their visit.

Brenda provides a range of dietary treatments and welcomes working alongside new or existing health professionals to provide holistic care.
Related to the gut:  irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) which can be caused by lactose intolerance, fructose, some or all FODMAPs or other intolerances caused by natural food chemicals (that can mimic allergy), small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), multiple allergies including Cow’s Milk Allergy (both IgE and Non-IgE), coeliac and other disease such as Crohn’s, Ulcerative Colitis, Liver Disease, Pancreatitis and post-surgery ileostomy/colostomy, high out-put and short bowel syndrome.
Related to Eating disorders including, Anorexia Nervosa (AN), Bulimia Nervosa (BN), Non Other Specified (NOS), Binge Eating (BED) and differentiating between Avoidance Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) and fussy eating:  dietary assessment (including refeeding risk) a appropriate support for weight.
Related to other health and weight management:  menopausal, acne, weight loss, cholesterol, pre-diabetes, type 2 diabetes, polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) and high blood pressure.
Brenda is registered with the Health and Care Professional Council and the British Dietetic Association, including their Allergy and Intolerance Group, Gastroenterology, Mental Health and Obesity Groups.  She is also registered with a number of private health insurance companies, including  (including  Allianz Worldwide Care, Aviva, Axa PPP Healthcare, BUPA, Cigna, WPA and Vitality Health).
Apart from clinical work, Brenda is a wife and mum of two, who enjoys learning about other cultures and keeping active.

IBS
Emer is fully trained in the low FODMAP approach and will help you ease your painful symptoms. Her recent cook book ‘IBS? Recipes For Success’ is full of delicious simple meals designed to ease the pain and discomfort of IBS.
Weight loss - In your 40s & you’ve noticed a change in body shape & weight? 
Despite eating less & exercising more, you're still not achieving your goals?  Do you want to feel better, have more energy & still eat the foods you enjoy? Turn up for your children, family, friends & be the best version of you? I'll help you achieve your goals by developing bespoke meal plans for weight loss. 
If you’re looking to lose fat & gain muscle, I’m here to help. As we get older, our bodies change & what we need changes too. As a health coach for weight loss & muscle gain, I will ensure you have the knowledge and skills you need to feed your body with the best nutrition for a healthy, energetic lifestyle.

name: Mei Wan
bio:
Mei Wan – FdSc, BSc (Hons), RD, MBDA
I specialise in:
healthy + sustainable weight loss
how to improve your blood glucose with pre-diabetes or type 2 diabetes
improving your relationship with food + how to break the cycle of emotional eating
increasing energy levels
improving sleep quality
practical and time-saving techniques to help manage stress
how to eat well with PCOS 
simple changes to lowering cholesterol + blood pressure
Book your 20-minute, complimentary call to explore how we can work together by clicking here (this will open a booking link). Alternatively, please email meiwandietitian@outlook.com or text 07595189158.
Check out my client reviews via Google here or by copying and pasting the following link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/nseb9qUASqqCGQ1p7
Services
1:1 + group consultations
customised meal plans
all services available online (+ face to face depending on availability)
Read my article on An Update on Cardiovascular Disease for the BDA
Mei is a dedicated and caring Dietitian. A graduate of The University of Surrey, Mei has worked as a Specialist Project Lead Dietitian for both adult and childhood obesity management in private healthcare. Mei has also worked as a Senior Dietitian and Diabetes Specialist Dietitian in digital health care where she helped patients to prevent type 2 diabetes and supported individuals with type 2 diabetes. Mei’s passion is to help empower people to go above and beyond their health goals. Mei provides consultancy work alongside her private dietetic services. Mei was promoted to co-lead on NHS England’s Low Calorie Diet pilot programme (now called Path to Diabetes Remission) to help patients to achieve diabetes remission. She has an established background in creating practical and sustainable solutions for healthier and happier lives.
Mei is registered with the HCPC, WPA health insurance, and, a Full Member of BDA.

name: Alex Lickley
bio:
Hi! My name is Alex I am a gut specialist dietitian with a wealth of dietetic experience. I currently work as a dietitian in the NHS (with inpatient and outpatient caseloads) and my interests and clinical expertise include IBS, gut related disorders, liver disease, weight management and frailty.

I am the current lead for the dietetic led IBS service at Bradford Royal Infirmary. I am a fully trained low FODMAP dietitian and can safely and effectively support patients in following the diet to manage their IBS symptoms.

I offer evidence-based nutritional and lifestyle advice to help my clients make well- informed decisions when it comes to their diet and health.

I am a proud member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and the Gastroenterology Specialist Group. Additionally, I am fully registered with the Health and Care Professional Council (HCPC), ensuring that my clients receive the highest quality of care.
I look forward to getting to know you, and using my expertise and experience to help you to Eat Well and Be Well !
Face to face appointment options are available at STEM Physiotherapy & Healthcare, Farsley (Leeds).

Individual appointments can also be undertaken virtually, via video link or as a telephone call.
Click the link to my website below to find out more information about my services.

name: Angela Ntiero
bio:
Angela Ntiero
Registered Specialist Dietitian
I’ve been a registered Dietitian for the past 18 years. Over this time I have worked in a number of different clinical and industry roles. From starting out as diabetes and hyperlipidaemia specialist dietitian to working for an award leading pub company to  support them with calorie and allergen labelling information. My most recent roles to date include working as the professional lead dietitian for one of UK’s leading private mental healthcare companies alongside a clinical dietetic role specialising in lung defence and cystic fibrosis. I have been extremely fortunate in having gained a range of clinical skills throughout my career. Current specialisms include, mental health and eating disorders, weight loss, diabetes, nutrition support, home enteral feeding, cystic fibrosis, public health promotion, calories and allergen labelling support.

name: Liane Reeves
title: BSc (Hons) Nutrition & Dietetics, GradCertClinHyp, MSc Allergy
bio:
I specialise in helping teenagers and adults with Irritable Bowel Syndrome and other gastro-intestinal conditions and diagnosing and managing food allergies and intolerances e.g. FODMAPs, gluten, lactose, histamine, salicylates and sulphites. I have over 20 years’ experience working in the NHS where I continue to work part-time as Adult Allergy Specialist Dietitian as well as run my private practice in Wantage, Oxfordshire. I can also provide advice to clients further afield via Zoom. I use an holistic approach to help my clients improve their quality of life through personalised dietary and lifestyle advice and am now also offering gut-directed hypnotherapy to complement the dietary advice for those with chronic gut symptoms.
I have co-written resources on IBS, food allergies and intolerances which are used by dietitians nationally and am co-author of the Professional Guidelines for the Dietary Management of IBS for Dietitians. I am a member of the British Society for Allergy and Clinical Immunology, the BDA Gastroenterology Specialist and Food Allergy Specialist Groups and the British Society of Clinical & Academic Hypnosis.  
Please see www.reevesdiets.co.uk for more information on fees, location and services and www.thecontentedgut.com for gut directed hypnotherapy.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Food allergy, Gastroenterology, IBS, Low FODMAP, Menopause, IBD

name: Bethany Wilshaw
bio:
As registered dietitians at ABCDietitians specialising in gut health, Angela and Beth will help you to achieve your nutritional goals. Using a holistic approach, they will provide personalised advice.


Our focus is to support those with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), functional gastrointestinal disorders, coeliac disease and inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn’s and Colitis).

We are both HCPC registered. We are both fully FODMAP trained with several years experience.   


We have a wide range of experience, can offer tailored packages to support those with other nutritional needs.

We offer the following:
- 1-1 hour online appointments
- Weekly support between appointments
- Short wait times
- 3 month package, single appointment options are available.

name: Dahlia Kulkarni
title: BSc
bio:
Dahlia is a registered Dietitian with over 20 years of experience in both the NHS and Private sector. She has worked at the Chelsea and Westminster Hospital, Harley Street (UCLH), the London Bridge Hospital and Ealing Hospital where she has treated many patients with a variety of clinical conditions including Cancer, Bone marrow transplant, Gastrointestinal diseases, Diabetes and Cardiovascular disease. She was the senior specialist Dietitian on the Intensive care unit at Ealing Hospital for many years where she dealt with complex medical and nutritional  issues and has extensive experience in tube feeding and Parenteral nutrition.
She currently works for the private sector and independently. Dahlia is the founder of The Dietitian’s Room London a consultancy which provides dietetic support to clients with a wide range of health and medical issues.  She is committed to providing clear, evidence based information to the public.
Dahlia can also help if you require a more holistic approach to changing your diet and lifestyle habits and she provides a unique supportive service.
Services include one to one consultations, telephone and Skype/Face Time consultations are also  available

name: Rachel White
bio:
Hello, I’m Rachel, a registered clinical and sports dietitian. I am registered with the Sports and Exercise Nutrition Register (SENr), I am able to support clients improve their sporting performance (from amateurs to professionals). I also have over 6 years experience working in the NHS, primarily in oncology, but I have worked in a number of other settings including intensive care, surgery, diabetes, malnutrition and weight management.
  I have always been keen on participating in sports. I can often be found running, from participating in the local weekly parkrun to ultramarathons. I am also a keen cyclist, skier and surfer.  I have wealth of experience and understanding about the balance of nutrition and hydration for health, well-being and sports performance. I can help you to achieve your goals whether it is providing practical evidence based dietary advice for medical conditions or to help you maximise your sporting potential.
  I have over 4 years experience as a specialist oncology dietitian, working across the treatment pathway from optimising clients pre-treatment, to living well after cancer, to end of life support. I am on the Medical Advisory Board for Ovacome, ovarian cancer charity. I have the skills and knowledge to support clients and offer 1:1 sessions to provide personalised advice.

name: Soraya David-Pineda
contact_address: The Vale of Glamorgan United Kingdom
bio:
Soraya is a NHS Specialist Weight Management Dietitian with over 10 years experience in helping clients lose weight for good, ditch faddy diets and make long lasting enjoyable lifestyle changes. 
Soraya has a holistic approach to well-being and weight loss and incorporates advice on mindful and emotional eating, stress management, sleep and movement. This enables clients to develop healthy habits for life and not just a short-term quick fix. 
Soraya specialises in Plant-Based nutrition however her clients have a mixture of dietary preferences so it DOES NOT matter if you are not vegetarian or vegan. Her work focuses on: 
1) Meeting the clients goals 2) Meeting the clients food likes and dislikes 3) Providing evidence based nutrition to improve the clients overall health
The results you can expect from her 12 weeks weight loss plans are: 
* 10lbs - 22lbs weight loss in the first 12 weeks
* Increase in energy and concentration.
* Improved gut health such as less bloating and healthier bowel habits. 
* Increased feeling of fullness for those following a plant predominant diet due to the favourable effect fibre has on the appetite regulation hormones. 
* Improved relationship with food and mindset around dieting. 
* Improvement in symptoms such as migraines, menstrual cycle pain, arthritic pain. 
Soraya offers: 
* Bespoke 12 week 1-1 packages. 
* Bespoke 4 weeks meal plans
Specialist areas of interest:
Weight loss, fat loss, IBS gut health, plant-based diets (Vegan, Mediterranean, Vegetarian)
Qualifications:
Msc Human Nutrition and Dietetics
PgCert Applied Sports Nutrition
IBS and Low Fodmap dietary advice
More information about your Dietitian: 
Soraya is a mother to a young child, business owner and educational speaker. She has frequently hosted accredited educational talks at Universities, events and within NHS Weight Management Services. 
In person appointments available at Station House Wellbeing CF5 6SH. 
Virtual appointments accessible from anywhere. 
Email to book a free 15 minute no obligation call: soraya@pnws.co.uk
Find Soraya on Instagram: soraya.pineda_rd

name: Zahra Sajad mohamed
bio:
Welcome! I'm Zahra, a dedicated HCPC (Health & Care Professions Council) Registered Dietitian with a deep commitment to empowering Middle Eastern women on their path to optimal health.
As an Arab woman myself, I intimately understand the cultural nuances, dietary preferences, and unique health challenges prevalent in our community. With over 3 years of experience across diverse clinical and public health settings, I offer tailored nutritional interventions rooted in evidence-based practices. From assessing and diagnosing health conditions to crafting personalized treatment plans, I prioritize your well-being with a holistic and individualized approach.
I'm here to guide you towards sustainable changes that align with your cultural traditions and personal goals. And I extend a warm welcome to individuals of all ethnic backgrounds, drawing from my experience of working with diverse populations in the NHS.
Ready to embark on your wellness journey? Let's connect and start the journey with me.

name: Ghazala Yousuf
title: MSc
bio:
Harley Dietitians is and established Paediatric and Women’s Health Dietetic Consultancy service established to provide evidence based dietary advice to families. We believe nutrition is the cornerstone to maternal and infant health during pregnancy and onwards into your child’s early years of life. With food and health continually in the media spot light, it can often feel a challenge to know what is best for you and your family. It can also be incredibly stressful to be met with a medical challenge that requires dietary modification in either a parent or child’s diet.
We at Harley Dietitians are committed to ensuring that all of our clients receive the dietary advice required to empower you to make informed food and lifestyle choices for you and your family. Our consultation are designed to provide a safe and reassuring environment to voice all your concerns and we are devoted to ensuring we go above and beyond to make things easier for you.

name: Ai Izumitani
bio:
I'm Ai and I am a Diabetes, Cardiovascular Disease and Weight Management Specialist Dietitian.  I have 10 years of experience in managing people with diabetes, diabetes prevention and remission, as well as weight management, and all areas of cardiovascular disease having been a Cardiovascular Lead Dietitian in London.  My experience has involved providing education and delivering treatment programmes across London.  

I have worked in the NHS, private companies, charity organisations and now freelance work.  

The way I work is to let the client lead the way, putting the person at the centre of their care.  I am passionate about helping people and offer my close support along the way. I am trained in behaviour change techniques to help support eating behaviours should one need this support.  

I'm also passionate about exercise and have trained as a fitness professional and personal trainer which goes hand in hand with your dietary treatment to help maximise your ability to achieve your goals.  

I offer packages and individual consultations and a free 10 minute discovery call prior to your journey with me.

name: Jacqueline Wilson
bio:
Hi, I'm Jackie, a specialist dietitian available for online and telephone support (evenings and weekends). 

I have extensive experience and post graduate training in coaching people with pre diabetes, type 2 diabetes and Type 1 diabetes. I also have a specific interest in supporting people with IBS and over 7 years experience in using the low FODMAP diet (Kings college London trained).

I am passionate about cooking and providing practical information on meals to suit individual needs as well as catering for the whole family. Having worked as a dietitian for 30 years I remain positive about inspiring others in diet and health coaching.

I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Lucy Kerrison
bio:
Lucy is a specialist consultant dietitian in gut health and women's health. She has spent a number of years working in world leading NHS teaching hospitals and has now moved over to the private sector in order to dedicate more time and attention to each client.

Lucy has significant experience working with complex functional gut conditions & intolerances, in particular: small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO) & intestinal methanogenic overgrowth (IMO). Lucy previously led and developed the hydrogen breath testing service within the largest private hospital group in London. Lucy guided clients through all parts of their journey, from recommending if a breath test would be beneficial, to updating the recommended preparation diet and designing a treatment pathway and protocols for the entire team to follow.

Lucy has gained vast experience across a range of complex gastrointestinal conditions and can help with the following: autoimmune conditions such as: inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Coeliac disease and hashimotos. Gut related conditions including: Eosinophillic oesophagitis (EoE), gastroparesis, achalasia, bile acid malabsorption (BAM), gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD), pancreatitis, pancreatic exocrine insufficiency, diverticular disease, liver disease and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). Women's health including: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), endometriosis, the menopause and peri-menopause. 

Lucy now leads a team of 7 gut health dietitians at the gut health clinic, as well as running her own business: www.lucykerrison.com

Lucy has appointments available face to face in London and also via zoom.

Hello and welcome!
I am an award-winning, London-based Dietitian with a decade of experience working in the NHS , private practice and commercial sector. I offer personalised nutrition plans for a range of clinical conditions.

Women's health - including menopause, fertility, PCOS, endometriosis, pregnancy and IBS
