name: Lisa Jack
bio:
I am a very experienced Registered Dietitian and have practised for approximately 20 years working in a variety of settings. 
I am passionate about working with clients to help them achieve their dietary and lifestyle goals by providing the latest professional expert scientific evidence-based nutrition and lifestyle advice.
  I help clients to be empowered to manage their medical conditions as best as possible and to optimise their health. I work in a holistic way and take into account the whole person by putting the client's needs first and aiming to listen, provide support and understanding with a non-judgemental approach.

My main areas of interest and experience are: weight management, chronic health conditions (i.e. diabetes, PCOS, Heart health, metabolic syndrome, high cholesterol and blood pressure), Irritable Bowel Syndrome & gut health, menopause, mindful eating and creating a healthy relationship with food (for those who have disordered eating or emotional eating).

I have completed further training and courses to enhance helping people to change and increase their chances of successfully managing their health condition (behaviour change training and cognitive behaviour therapy). I ensure I am always up to date with the latest evidence in my specialist areas.

name: Anna Kallianteri
title: BSc, MSc
bio:
Hello,

I am Anna, a HCPC (Health & Care Professions Council) Registered Dietitian with working experience inside and outside the NHS. I started as a freelance dietitian with an interest to explore the role of nutrition for our medical and mental health, and overall quality of life. Also, how our nutrition education and behaviours shape our eating choices for future health and environmental preservation.

I moved on and continue to practice dietetics within the NHS with a special focus on weight management interventions, weight loss/Bariatric surgery, Type 2 Diabetes, Hypertension, Sleep Apnoea, Cardiovascular diseases, gut dysfunction, and mental health conditions. I have worked with special needs patients and my aim is to work using personalised approaches and behavioural change techniques to guide individuals through a healthier way of living.

I have worked in different hospitals in London to support the nutrition of adults and the elderly. I am constantly looking to expand my knowledge and practice in other clinical areas with main interests around gut health, women and early life health, and nutrigenetics. To achieve the best patient care, I believe one needs to combine clinical practice and strive for ongoing learning and development. I have participated in a few clinical research projects and small education roles and try to maintain up-to-date with nutrition research.

I currently offer remote telephonic or video consultations around:

• Weight loss
• Weight gain
• Metabolic / Bariatric Surgery
• Type 2 Diabetes
• Dyslipidaemia (lipid-lowering)
• Management of blood pressure
• Vegetarian and vegan diets
• Disordered eating

This list is not exhaustive, and should you wish to receive a get-to-know-me free consultation to discuss your personal case further, do not hesitate to contact me.

name: Jennifer Credicott
bio:
Hello, I’m Jen, a Registered Dietitian with a wealth of experience in both NHS and Private Practice. Whether you are looking to optimise your health, make specific dietary changes or reduce symptoms, I offer an individualised approach and can help you adopt a mindful and fresh attitude to good nutrition and health.

I will listen to you, taking the time to understand your lifestyle and the barriers you have faced in achieving your goals. Using my knowledge of nutrition and clinical experience, I will enable you to become more aware of what may be impacting your health, and empower you to make changes desired to improve your overall wellbeing.
My areas of expertise are: weight management and bariatric surgery, chronic health conditions (e.g PCOS, Diabetes and Cardiovascular health), IBS and gut health. I am also trained in advising on the FODMAP diet. A full list of services can be found on my website.
Please get in touch via my website or on the phone number above. 

I hope to hear from you soon.

Jen

name: Ravinder Sagoo
title: Master of Nutrition MNutr
bio:
Hi I’m Ravinder and I’ve been a renal dietitian in the NHS for 6 years and the founder of Kidney Nutrition Matters LLP. I’m incredibly passionate about the importance of nutrition in kidney disease and bringing up to date research and evidence to the kitchen table. 
I am very keen to ensure that diet advice is culturally appropriate. As a multilingual dietitian I aim to ensure that the general population including the South Asian population are aware about the impact of diet and kidney health. I have an extensive insight into all the areas of kidney disease from early diagnosis, dialysis and transplantation. I’m eager to share my expertise and dietary recommendation and support lifestyle changes.
To find out more or book a free 10 minute discovery call contact me via Instagram @kidneynutritionmatters or ring 07340 662230

name: Lynda Rigley
bio:
I am Dr Lynda Rigley, a very experienced dietitian.  I have worked in dietetics, nutrition, food education and health promotion for the entirety of my working life.  I have over 21 years of dietetic experience in both the NHS and private practice, where I have set up Sunlight Nutrition Limited with my colleague Mrs Samantha Howard. 

I am passionate about working with individuals to improve their health through nutrition and dietetics.  Private practice allows me to provide a high quality, client-centred service, seeing clients either virtually or in person, in either our clinic rooms or their own homes.

I have considerable clinical experience in all areas of dietetics from premature infants through to adolescents and adults.  I specialised in paediatric nutrition for 15 years while working in the NHS, managing complex cases/conditions, food allergy and intolerance, nutritional support, gastroenterology, and neonates.  I have undertaken additional training with Monash University for irritable bowel syndrome and the low FODMAP diet.  I also have additional qualifications in food allergy and the Sequential Oral Sensory (S.O.S) Approach to Feeding.

As well my clinical work, Sunlight Nutrition works closely with many Universities to deliver student dietetic training, through both placement provision and lecturing. 

Recently I have acted as an expert witness for several large legal firms.  I am registered with Premex and undertaking the Cardiff University Bond Solon (CUBS) expert witness accreditation course.

bio:
I am both a registered dietitian and also a registered Psychotherapist. I am particularly suited to helping those with psychological/emotional issues around food. I see people with disordered eating and with eating disorders which are not at an acute or extreme stage.
I also see people for other dietary advice as well, please enquire for details as to whether I can be of help.

name: Hannah Whittaker
bio:
I am a Registered UK Dietitian specialising in Pregnancy & Paediatric Nutrition. I have nearly 20 years of experience in providing nutritional education and you can definitely trust that the advice I give is evidence based.
The ethos of my business bump2baby nutrition is to provide specific advice for your needs.
My specialist areas of support are;
Milk Allergy
Plant Based Pregnancy 
I offer one to one assessments and run an online course specifically for parents of babies with cow milk protein allergy. 

Alongside one-to-one assessments I also work with companies to support recipe development, lead discussion and education groups (delivering training), and support and collaborate with some familiar companies. 
You may have seen me in the media as I support the British Dietitian Association as a media spokesperson and have contributed to articles in the Daily Mail, BBC online and appeared on Channel 5's Secrets of Your Supermarket food!

You can contact me for more information at https://www.bump2babynutrition.com 
I look forward to hearing from you
Hannah x

name: Kaitlin Colucci
bio:
Kaitlin Colucci is a UK Registered Dietitian specialising in gut health and gastroenterology. She is considered one of the leading gut health experts in her field and is the founder of the KC Nutrition Online Gut Health Clinic and The Mission Dietitian Instagram, a gut health hub to feed you all the latest evidence-based information on gut health and nutrition. Kaitlin is also the lead dietitian for the private healthcare service in The Shard, London. 
Kaitlin founded The Mission Dietitian Instagram in 2017 as the culmination of her passions to have meaningful conversations about the science behind diet and nutrition, spread the message that improving health isn't about excluding foods, but inclusion, and to highlight the power mental health can have over gut health. 
In addition to her degree from The University of Nottingham, Kaitlin is also a British Dietetic Association (BDA) media spokesperson and over the past 5 years has appeared on shows such as BBC Countryfile, BBC Food Truth or Scare and Channel 4s Food Unwrapped and written for publications such as Women's Health, The Daily Mail and Food Matters Live. She also has experience working with companies developing new nutritional products, writing PR materials, and talking at and providing cooking demos at events and conferences. She has worked with brands such as New Balance, Schar and Holland and Barrett offering expert consultancy for online content, brand awareness and product development. 
Kaitlin's favourite part of having built her online business is being able to connect with people from all over the globe. She is a big believer that everyone needs to pause and take a deep breath from the crazy world we live in, and those who work with Kaitlin in her clinic can do just that. 
To connect with Kaitlin, you can follow her on all social media channels @themissiondietitian or visit her website www.kaitlincolucci.com

name: Roberta McAdam
company_name: McAdam Dietetic Services, Isle of Man
bio:
I believe everyone should have access to fresh, healthy produce, the closer to home the better. Using what can be grown locally as a foundation to a balanced diet can help improve general wellbeing, symptom management of many conditions and support your mental health. I can provide expert dietary advice on many different medical conditions and on general health and wellbeing.
I have 16 years experience working a a registered Dietitian in the UK and on the Isle of Man.  My specialisms include women's health, nutrition and aging, and a broad range hospital based specialisms. 
I am currently available for webinars, group workshops, cookery demonstrations, menu and dietary analysis. I am not currently taking on any more individual clients for 1-2-1 work.

name: Emily Jackson
company_name: Nutrition and Dietetics by Emily Jackson
bio:
Emily is a UK advanced specialist dietitian registered with the Health and Care Professions Council and member of the British Dietetic Association.
In 2001 Emily graduated with a first class honours degree in Physical Education and Sports Science BSc from Loughborough University. Emily enjoyed the sports nutrition aspects of her first degree and chose to further her studies with a post graduate diploma in Nutrition and Dietetics at Leeds Metropolitan University. Emily graduated and began working as a NHS dietitian in 2005.
Emily has 19 years experience working in the NHS. Currently Emily leads the diabetes specialist dietetic service within her current NHS role, and has worked at this service since 2012. Within this role Emily specialises in providing diabetes advice and education to patients with type 1, type 2 and type 3c diabetes. Emily also provides care to women during pregnancy with pre-existing diabetes and gestational diabetes. She is the diabetes technology lead for the dietetic team, specialising in glucose sensor technology and insulin pump therapy.
Emily provides diabetes education both to individuals and in group settings. She supports and empowers her patients to reach their health goals. Emily is trained in behaviour change strategies and helps her patients make positive steps to overcome any barriers to change.
Prior to her current role Emily worked in community based dietetics for 7 years. This employment encompassed a wide variety of specialist areas of dietetics including obesity and weight management, gastrointestinal disorders, cardiovascular health, nutrition support, and elderly medicine.
Expertise:
Diabetes; including support for type 1, type 2, type 3c, pre diabetes, gestational diabetes, and preconception and pregnancy care for pre-existing diabetes.  
Obesity
Cardioprotective diets; including cholesterol lowering advice, blood pressure reducing advice, support post cardiac events.
Gastrointestinal conditions; including irritable bowel syndrome, coeliac disease, pancreatic exocrine insufficiency, gastroparesis, diverticular disease, constipation and acid reflux
Nutrition support; including  food fortification strategies , advice on nutritional support products , texture modification
Emily offers online or telephone consultations. 
To book a consultation send an email to emilyjacksonnutrition@gmail.com

name: Julie Walker
bio:
Based in the heart of Bishops Stortford we offer face to face, virtual sessions and phone sessions.
We allow ample time to get to know your needs and find a practical plan to help support you with your diet and symptoms.

I see people who need support with Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Heart conditions, Weight management, Diverticular Disease, Constipation, Inflammatory Bowel Disease, Nutritional deficiencies, Unintentional weight loss, neurological conditions such as Motor Neurone Disease, Stroke.

Having practiced in the NHS for over 25 years I have experience in many clinical specialities and am happy to discuss your needs to see if I can help. I work with adults but will see 16-18 year olds with a parent or guardian present.  

I am a Registered Dietitian combining a busy NHS work load with private practice. I am registered with the Health Care Professionals Council and am a member of the British Dietetic Associate and the Freelance Dietitians Group.


Find out more at www.bramblenutrition.org.uk

name: Lucy Pritchard
bio:
Lucy is a Specialist Dietitian in Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), other gut disorders and weight management.  She trained in Cardiff and qualified as a registered dietitian in 2004. Lucy has many years of experience working in the NHS and in private practice. She founded her freelance business in 2016 working alongside Nuffield Health to make evidence-based nutrition and dietary advice accessible to people with IBS and other gut conditions.
Lucy’s passion for improving healthcare led her in 2017 to apply for and secure a prestigious Health Education England (HEE)/ National Institute of Health Research (NIHR) studentship completing a Master’s in Clinical Research (MClinRes) at the University of Plymouth (First-class degree). In 2019 she was awarded a research internship and worked as a research dietitian at University Hospitals Plymouth until 2021, and as Specialist Dietitian in IBD/Gastroenterology until 2022.
After a rewarding 18 years in NHS service, Lucy now works full-time in her freelance consultancy business. She is recognised as a specialist in the management of IBS and other gut conditions. Lucy has completed the King’s College London low FODMAP and using this advanced dietetic approach has successfully advised numerous clients with IBS.  Lucy is also passionate about weight management and provides bespoke nutritional advice and food planning to help achieve realistic weight loss goals.
When faced with illness or a specific health concern, or simply looking to improve overall well-being, interpreting complex information and advice about diet can require specialist help and support which Lucy provides in a non-judgemental, supportive and empathetic way.
industry_services: Business consulting, Charitable sector, Conferences, Corporate Health, Education & Academia, Events, Food, Health screening, Media / PR, Marketing / Advertising, Private practice, Recipe & menu analysis, Research & Development, Speaking, Workplace nutrition, Writing and editing, Expert Witness

name: Anna Daniels
bio:
Anna Daniels is an award-winning Registered Dietitian with a strong presence in both media and clinical practice. She is a regular contributor to high-profile outlets like the BBC, The Times and Women's Health, where she shares her expert insights on nutrition trends and healthy living. Anna has also appeared on popular TV shows such as Food Unwrapped and Super Shoppers further solidifying her reputation as a trusted voice in dietetics.
Holding two degrees, one in Food Science and Nutrition and a further in Dietetics, Anna combines scientific knowledge with clinical experience. She has worked extensively within the NHS and in private practice, successfully helping individuals facing challenges like chronic anorexia and bulimia nervosa. Her compassionate, person-centred approach integrates dietetics with behaviour change, empowering clients to understand their eating habits while offering alternative coping strategies for emotional eating.
Passionate about skin health and longevity, Anna tailors evidence-based nutrition plans to promote both physical and mental well-being. Her mantra, "To eat intelligently is an art," reflects her commitment to balanced, mindful eating. 
Anna also has experience in Work Place Health and consulting to food companies, writing blogs and articles on food and nutrition.
Specialising in Eating Disorders, Women's Health, Gut Health, Heart Health and Weight Management. 
Anna offers virtual appointments in a confidential and supportive environment.

name: Aisling Pigott
title: BsC, MsC, doctoral researcher
bio:
My name is Aisling (Ash) Pigott and I am a Registered Dietitan, PgCert Sports and Exercise Nutrition, MsC Advanced Practice. I have an active interest in ongoing research, and I'm currently studying for my PhD alongside clinical and freelance work. Over the past decade I have worked across a variety of healthcare, private healthcare and academic settings.

As an award winning media spokesperson (BDA media spokesperson of the year 2020) I am often seen on TV, print or social media debunking nutrition myths and supporting the delivery of evidence based nutrition messages. I am passionate about promoting positive relationships with food and have both a professional and personal interest in sports nutrition, diabetes, early years and women health nutrition.

name: Marcelle Glantz
bio:
My name is Marcelle Glantz and I have over 20 years experience working as a Specialised Paediatric Dietitian. I  have worked for over 10 years at specialist children’s hospital helping babies, toddlers, children and teenagers with special diets, tailored to their individual needs.
I have expertise in the management of :
Complementary feeding for babies 
Toddler diets
Healthy eating for children and adolescents
Vegetarian/Vegan diets
Allergies
Children with Cancer
Underweight
Overweight
Constipation
Neurological conditions
I am also particularly interested in helping children who are picky eaters or have more severe feeding problems such as ARFID.
As a mum of 3 children I understand the practical problems of incorporating healthy meals into a busy family life.
clinical_expertise: Paediatrics

name: Emily Porter
bio:
Use discount code BDA10 when booking to receive a unique 10% discount off your initial consultation with me.
Dr Emily Porter is a registered dietitian with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC), specialising in the management of gastrointestinal conditions, such as IBS, coeliac disease, bacterial overgrowth and constipation. She is also able to support with metabolic health conditions, such as type 2 diabetes and high cholesterol.
Emily offers comprehensive support, including guidance on the full and modified low FODMAP diet where appropriate, and takes a holistic approach, including targeting the gut:brain axis, to help clients achieve their nutritional goals.
Her career began in research, where she completed a Ph.D. in virology and worked on various research projects examining the connections between immune responses, viral infections, and microbiomes, including those in the gut and respiratory system.
She works both with private patients and for an NHS trust, previously holding dietetic lead roles for the Coeliac disease and Type 2 Diabetes services, and is a member of the healthcare panel for The IBS Network.
Offering a personalised approach to care allows Emily to work with patients to come up with a plan tailored to each individual's needs that is realistic, effective and practical to implement — whether related to managing a medical condition, alleviating specific symptoms, or improving overall health and wellbeing.
Emily offers face-to-face appointments in London and Manchester, as well as online consultations.

name: Jill Whitehall
title: MSc
bio:
Jill Whitehall MSc RD MBDA is a Registered Dietitian and Nutrition Consultant who combines her freelance career with a part time role as a Primary Care dietitian, based in a GP practice. With over 30 years’ experience in the fields of nutrition, health and wellbeing, Jill works with a range of national organisations within the statutory, private and voluntary sectors in the design and delivery of training programmes, webinars and resource development, including interactive e-learning topics. Her particular area of interest and expertise is healthy weight management and lifestyle behaviour change throughout the lifespan.
She is also a Programme Manager for Health Development Consultancy (HDC), a specialist training organisation that delivers nationally accredited and evidenced based health improvement courses. HDC is a Royal Society of Public Health  Accredited Centre https://www.healthdc.co.uk/.
In addition, she is a Public Health Champion for the British Dietetic Association, accredited WorkReady! Dietitian, and a Mindful Self-Compassion and a Mindful Based Eating Awareness Teacher. She completed a Master’s Degree in Professional Development in 2019.

name: Gillian Farren
bio:
Professional portfolio:

MBDA, MA, BSc, Hons Dip;
Professional Lead for Dietetics (SCS) at NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde;
Consultant Dietitian, Specialist Eating Disorder Services, Priory Hospital Group;
Vice-Chairperson and Director of the British Dietetic Association (BDA);
Graduate and Ambassador for the BDA’s Future Leaders Programme;
Co-founder and Director of Nutricomms Consultancy Ltd


About Gillian:

Now in her third decade of professional dietetic practice, Gillian is absolutely passionate about all things food-related. Sustainability of impact is a key driver that Gillian upholds at all stage of the client journey; all clients can expect Gillian to underpin treatment goals with long-term sustainable change at the core of any care plan.

Specialisation:

Qualifying with a BSc (Hum. Nut. & Diet.) from the University of Dublin, Trinity College, in 1998, Gillian has chalked up a comprehensive range of experience in over two decades as a practising dietitian. Her current specialisations and research interests extend across the specialisms of neurology, acquired brain injury, complex eating disorders, and mental health and wellbeing. Gillian has also enjoyed extended specialist roles in the specialisms of inherited metabolic disorders, endocrinology, weight management and sports performance, and maternal and early years nutrition earlier in her career.

Expertise in Dietetics:

Throughout her career, Gillian has enjoyed opportunities to share her work and achievements at events hosted within and outside the field of Dietetics, both nationally and internationally. Gillian is registered with the Health Care Professionals Council (HCPC) and with the British Dietetic Association (BDA), for whom she also currently serves as Vice Chairperson. Both of these professional bodies actively support all registered health professionals to follow best practice, to engage in continuing professional development, and to safeguard clients in their care. Dietitians are the only nutrition professionals currently permitted to join the HCPC register, and by choosing a registered dietitian to support your care pathway, you are assured of the highest level of quality assurance and protection on your journey to better nutritional health.

What to
expect from Gillian:

Gillian is committed to the highest standards of care and assures absolute confidentiality and commitment in meeting client needs, at all stages of their journey with her.
Testimonials from established clients can be made available on request.

name: Sophie Lennon
bio:
Specialist children’s dietitian who graduated from Cardiff Metropolitan University in 2016. Completed BDA and Plymouth University Masters module – Nutrition and Dietetics in Common Paediatric Disorders. A member of the North West Allergy Network which involves attending regular meetings and educational update sessions in order to ensure all advice is in line with the current evidence base.
In just 7 years, Sophie has secured the post of Paediatric Dietetic Team Lead for North East Wales and is the lead for IgE Allergy in North East Wales.
Sophie is registered with the HCPC (www.hcpc-uk.org ) and the BDA (www.bda.uk.com)
industry_services: Lecturing & teaching, Private practice, Recipe & menu analysis, Social media, Workplace Education Sessions, Charitable sector

name: Emma Ferris
bio:
I graduated from the University of Surrey in 2009 with a first degree honours and since have been privileged to gain over 10 years experience working in acute hospitals covering medical wards and outpatient clinics. I’ve specialised in HIV, gastroenterology and oncology and have an extensive knowledge of nutrition support and treating malnutrition.
 A core value of my practice is knowledge of the latest evidence and emerging practices. More than being a job to myself dietetics is a passion and through listening to accredited webinars, professional podcasts and undertaking courses I remain up to date and dedicated to evidence based practice.
I can confidently help you navigate and improve nutritional related issues in a variety of conditions and disease states including IBS, Inflammatory bowel disease and Oncology. I specialise in nutrition support especially post hospital stay nutrition and can be a guiding hand on your journey surrounding healthy eating and relationship with your body.
I believe passionately that together we can make a difference to your life and work on achieving the changes you want to make to any aspect of your nutrition. I want to look to see what truly matters to you, what are the goals in your life that include and extend beyond food and how we can work together to achieve them, be that be able to walk every day comfortably with your dog or feel more confident in choosing healthy choices for your family.
When it comes to your nutrition and Diet there is absolutely no one size that fits all and every day can be different but importantly it’s you that is the expert. Food choices are impacted daily by emotions, stressors and sleep to name a few and at the core of my work with you will be to equip you with the tools you need to make the choices you want every day.

name: Lisa Halbert
title: BSc
bio:
I’m an HCPC Registered Dietitian with 16 years clinical experience in the NHS, in a number of areas including Community dietetics, Surgical and Critical Care, Gastroenterology, Neuro and Cardiac and respiratory rehab. I have completed specialist training in Low FODMAP diet at Kings College, London. I am able to offer dietetic advice in a number of areas, including:
Nutrition support, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, food intolerance, low FODMAP diet, weight management, Diabetes, Coeliac Disease, PCOS and fertility, Women’s Health, IBD.
I offer face to face consultations in my Clinic in Kilmarnock, and am also able to offer video consultations to those further afield. 
Please get in touch if you would like to book a consultation!

name: Gemma Ransome
bio:
I am Gemma Ransome, a HCPC registered Paediatric Dietitian, SOS trained feeding specialist with 14 years clinical experience in both the NHS and private sector.
As a mother of three young children, I know only too well the difficulties of providing children with a healthy diet whilst juggling the pressures of a busy family life. My aim is to compassionately help my clients foster a positive relationship with food to improve their growth, development and general health and wellbeing.
I support families by offering virtual or in person appointments in the following areas:
• Growth faltering
• Weight management and healthy eating
• Picky/ Selective eating and Avoidant Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID)
• Allergy and intolerance
• Coeliac Disease
• Gastrointestinal conditions including constipation and loose bowel motions
• Iron deficiency anaemia
• Vegetarian and vegan diets
Whether you're dealing with picky eating, food allergies, or other specific dietary concerns, my evidence-based approach ensures your child receives the best care. Serving families across Buckinghamshire, Berkshire, and surrounding areas, I am here to help your child thrive with nutrition guidance tailored to your child’s unique needs.
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Early years nutrition, Food allergy, Freelance Practice, Paediatric - Nutrition Support, Paediatrics, Nutrition support, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Weight loss

name: Rebecca Stacey
bio:
I’m Rebecca, BA (Hons), BSc (Hons), RD, a specialist paediatric and adult Dietitian with over 10 years experience of working in a clinical (NHS) environment and founder of Family Nutrition Clinic.
I provide specialist, evidence based dietary advice for problems ranging from: cow’s milk protein allergy, fussy eating, constipation, diarrhoea, faltering growth, irritable bowel syndrome, coeliac disease, type 2 diabetes and weight management.
I’m a firm believer that no food is a ‘bad’ food and that it should be enjoyed as well as being nourishing. I don’t believe that one size fits all, and strive to tailor advice to individual children, parents and adults.
As a registered member of the Health and Care Professions Council and British Dietetics Association, with continuous training providing knowledge of the latest scientific advice, your consultation with me will be informed by the most up-to-date evidence.
I can support you and your child in the following conditions:
Allergies and intolerances including cow’s milk protein allergy
Reflux
Diarrhoea and constipation
Faltering growth and nutrition support
Fussy eating
Weight management
Coeliac disease
I also provide dietary advice for adults on the following:
Fertility, pregnancy and breast-feeding
Weight management
PCOS
Nutrition support
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Low FODMAP diet
Type 2 Diabetes
Coeliac Disease
Skin health
Training, Qualifications and Experience
BSc (Honours) in Nutrition and Dietetics at University of Surrey (1st class degree)
BA (Honours) in Social & Cultural Studies at University of Nottingham (1st class degree)
Registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC)
BDA endorsed module in Nutrition & Dietetics in Infancy and Childhood

name: Lisa Louise McDonagh
bio:
Lisa qualified from the University of Nottingham in 2015 with Masters degree in Nutrition and Dietetics, she is a neonatal, paediatric and mental health specialist.
Lisa currently works both in private practice and for the NHS working across tier 4 mental health  inpatient units for children and adolescents.
She has worked in acute care across three major university teaching hospitals which has given her an excellent grounding and knowledge base within the speciality of paediatrics. She has spent time working in public health in paediatric and maternal healthcare. Lisa now spends her NHS time working with young people with ARFID, eating disorders and feeding difficulties associated with ADHA and autism.

Prior to training as a dietitian Lisa worked across East Amber Valley providing breastfeeding support to families, it is her love for good nutrition and supporting the family unit that lead her to train in the field of dietetics. She is passionate about breastfeeding, she has 20 years experience supporting breastfeeding families and is dual trained as an international board certified lactation consultant (IBCLC).
Lisa prefers to dedicate the majority of her time to neonatal and paediatric care and is able to treat patients with a wide range of clinical conditions such as poor growth, breastfeeding issues,  chronic lung disease, cardiac conditions, genetic conditions, coeliac disease, cancer, reflux, cow's milk protein allergy, neuro-disability, poor feed tolerance and complex feeding issues, ARFID, eating disorders and mental health conditions.
Providing good nutrition to support growth and development is very important to Lisa, she has a keen interest in ARFID, blended diet via gastrostomy, caring for ex preterm babies, supporting breastfeeding families and children with complex feeding issues.
Lisa is also qualified as an advanced SOS feeding therapist.
If you would like to speak about how Lisa can help support your family please do get in touch.
industry_services: Catering

name: Dawn Goudge
bio: Dawn is a highly professional dietitian having worked in both the private sector and NHS for over 25 years. Based in Oxfordshire, she is able to provide evidence based up to date dietary advice, ensuring that clients are confident to achieve their dietary requirements and goals in one-to-one personalised consultations.  Dawn’s key specialist area is gastroenterology including; coeliac disease, Crohn’s disease, ulcerative colitis, IBS (first line and FODMAP advice), food intolerance and allergy and liver disease as well as pre and post surgical dietary advice, nutritional support, weight management and bariatrics. I practise from my own consulting rooms both digitally and face to face and can provide domiciliary visits as required. Dawn is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) – the independent UK wide health regulatory body for allied health professions and is a member of the British Dietetic Association. Dawn has worked in the NHS in the clinical specialist areas of gastroenterology, nutritional support and weight management as well as being head of the nutrition and dietetic service. Private sector experience includes dietetic consultancy to various private hospitals including the development of nutritional policies, services and training, occupational health nutrition and menu development. Please do not hesitate to contact Dawn to discuss your requirements.

name: Rachel Smith
contact_address: Weston super Mare, North Somerset United Kingdom
bio:
I am a Registered Dietitian and a full member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and hold degrees in both BSc (Hons) Sport and Exercise Science and BSc (Hons) Human Nutrition and Dietetics.
With several years experience working within the NHS in a range of specialities, I have gained a wealth of knowledge and skills to be able to offer a holistic and personalised approach to your health goals.
I continue to hold a position within the NHS as a Specialist Weight Management Dietitian, which helps to bolster my expertise and supports my continued development.
My interest in fertility and menopause isn't just a professional one, it is also deeply personal. And this means I delve deep into the research to bring you the most up-to-date, factual and practical advice and support out there.
I regularly complete CPD (continued professional development) and research to further my knowledge and skills and to bring you the most up to date, evidence based practice.

name: Sarah Curry
title: MSc, RD, cPT
bio:
I am a trauma-informed Registered Dietitian Nutritionist specialising in eating disorders, body image, and IBS. My philosophy of nutrition is built on a framework of intuitive eating and that body shape is an unreliable indicator of health. I am science-driven and realistic, and will approach your care with compassion and non-judgement.
My connection to my work in eating difficulties stems from the massive role food plays in our lives. By removing obstacles of fear and misconceptions around food, it clears the path for more presence in our relationships, the roles we play, and even in the actual pleasure that comes from food. My passion is to empower you to see you truly can take off the burden of fear of food and warring with your body to live a whole life beyond.
I have extensive training in eating disorders, body image work, Intuitive Eating, MONASH FODMAP training, trauma-informed care as well as sports nutrition. I am also DBT, RO-DBT, ACT, and CBT-ED informed and can easily jump into a care team who uses the same models.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Eating disorders, Freelance Practice, IBS, Sports nutrition, Working with the media, Writing

name: Victoria Holmes
bio:
I am a Highly Specialised Paediatric Dietitian, with over 16 years experience within the NHS and private sector,currently working at the largest children’s hospital in the UK.  My private practice clinic is based in Bramhall, Cheshire.
The Specialities I cover include:
-Cows Milk and/or Soya Protein Intolerance/Allergy
-Behavioural eating issues
-Feeding difficulties in Autism
-Fussy Eating/Food Refusal
-Lactose Intolerance
-Constipation/Diarrhoea
-Toddler Diarrhoea
-Fructose Intolerance
-Coeliac Disease
-Weaning advice
-Restrictive/unvaried diet
-Faltering growth/Failure to thrive
-Poor appetite and/or weight loss
-Overweight
-Nutritional Deficiencies such as iron deficiency
-Healthy Eating and General Nutrition
-Computerised Nutritional Dietary Assessment of your Child’s diet
-Advice for nurseries/schools
I provide an individualised approach. My appointments are held within a child friendly comfortable environment and I also offer video and phonecall consultations. However, if you feel a home visit would be helpful then this is no problem at all. I feel home visits are extremely useful especially at mealtimes to evaluate a ‘true’ reflection of mealtimes and advise regarding your child’s dietary intake and behaviour around mealtimes.
I also work closely with Dr Heidi Mason, Consultant Clinical Psychologist, who has specialist experience of working with children with additional needs and behavioural feeding difficulties. If it is felt that your child would benefit from a joint consultation with myself and Dr Heidi Mason then this can be arranged.
I also work closely with a private Paediatric Gastroenterologist of whom I provide a private dietetic service for.
industry_services: Articles, Food, Private practice, Recipe & menu analysis, Writing and editing
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Advanced clinical practice, Early years nutrition, Food allergy, Paediatric - Nutrition Support, Paediatrics, Parenteral & Enteral Nutrition

name: Elizabeth Smith
company_name: Liz Smith Diabetes Dietitian Nutrition Analysis United Kingdom
bio:
I qualified as a dietitan in 2005 and have specialised in diabetes and weight management for the past 17 years within the NHS and also privately, assisting people with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes better understand and manage their conditions.
Please get in touch if you have type 2 diabetes on diet or medications and are looking to:
• put it into remission through diet,
• better understand how food affects your diabetes,
• achieve weight loss,
• move towards a low carbohydrate diet
• gain specific to you, non-generalised advice.
If you have type 1 diabetes or type 2 diabetes on insulin and would like support to:
• improve your time in range by ensuring your basal insulin dose is right,
• start to carbohydrate count or fine tune you carbohydrate:insulin ratios,
• reduce blood glucose peaks by timing your insulin or altering food choices,
• exercise safely whilst maintaining blood glucose control
• achieve weight loss.
(Note: I do not work with pumps as I feel these are best supported by your pump team).
As I specialise in diabetes, I truly understand that it can be an overwhelming, ever-changing condition. I will support you to develop an approach that will help you achieve your goals, whilst fitting with you and your lifestyle.
All my appointments are online.
Please review my website for further information about myself, my fees and to book a free, no obligation 15minute call if you wish to further find out how I can support you. Alternatively, please reach out through the contact form on this page.
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Freelance Practice, Obesity, Weight loss

name: Mabel Blades
bio:
Dr Mabel Blades RD, MPhil, MBA is an experienced dietitian registered with the HCPC and member of the British Dietetic Association. I have provided advice and expertise is provided to various individuals on diet plus to the care sector, industry and legal clients.
I aim  to simplify complex nutritional issues into everyday language and thus enhance understanding of foods and nutrition.
I have written a number of books including “Nutrition and Health”, “Diabetes foods meds and more”,  “Everyday eating”, the GI counter and been involved in writing the GI diet.
I have provided training for various organisations including Age UK, HM Prison service, hospital and care caterers, environmental health officers and others
I often provide expertise in recipe development for clients as well as nutritional calculations
Expert reports have been provided for a number of  clients for legal purposes
I have provided support  to  charities such as IDDT and Age UK as well as the local food bank
Local radio has often asked me to assist them and also I have judged a number of competitions at both local and national levels

name: Nicole Croft-O'Halloran
bio:
I have worked as a Registered Dietitian since 1986, combining NHS work with a busy private practice. As well as having a wide range of experience in most areas of dietetic care. I tailor all advice to each individual and take account of your lifestyle, dietary intake and references to make changes to your diet. 
I offer a service in 2 private hospitals across Essex, Hartswood Hospital in Brentwood and Springfield Hospital in Chelmsford. I have regular clinics at Springfield Hospital.
I also offer virtual appointments.
I specialise in Gastroenterology (IBS, functional bowel disorders, reflux, diverticular disease, constipation, coeliac disease, and inflammatory bowel disease). I am FODMAP trained by Kings College (2012-2021) and attend many of their courses over this time.
I also specialise in bariatric surgery and have worked with an Upper GI & bariatric surgeon at Springfield Hospital since 2012.  I have a passion for helping people achieve realistic and lasting weight loss.
I have considerable experience in nutrition support for those who have unintentional weight loss and whose dietary intake is compromised and are struggling to gain weight or have an optimal dietary intake.
I can be contacted by email or mobile number as outlined below and on my website accessnutrition.co.uk

name: Deborah David
bio:
Deborah David  BSc, PGCE, MSc, RD is a graduate of Surrey University (Nutrition & Dietetics) and a registered dietitian. Having worked in nutrition and dietetics for over 20 years, she has a breadth of experience in many aspects of nutrition research, clinical and community dietetics. Deborah has also been a university lecturer, acted as a consultant to the food industry, and assisted with rapid reviews/literature searches for research projects within UK public health and various charity organisations.
Prior to dietetics, Deborah’s professional background included: data management for the pharmaceutical healthcare industry, research within microbiology/virology, and teaching biomedical sciences to secondary school level.
She is currently working on providing group educational sessions on a wide variety of food, nutrition and public health projects within the local community. In addition she  volunteers her services for various charities involving school food educational programmes, cookery sessions for local food bank centres. Her specialist research interests include: musculoskeletal disease; workplace nutrition, changing food systems, sustainable diets, public health and nutrition education.

name: Eloise Garbutt
bio:
Eloise is an experienced Registered Dietitian with over 5 years of experience across the NHS and top London private hospitals. She prides herself with providing holistic and individualised care to her clients, with a friendly and non-judgemental approach.
Eloise is passionate about dietetics and enjoys building a rapport with her clients and working collaboratively to ensure that her dietary advice is sustainable. She aims to empower her clients to be able to take control of their dietary decisions and their overall health.
Eloise's special interests include complex gastroenterology disorders, nutrition after gastroenterology surgery, supporting people with stomas, IBS, weight management, weight loss surgery, diabetes and women’s health.

name: Shavina Patel
bio:
Looking for reliable nutritional advice to improve your health, prevent illnesses or manage symptoms associated to a medical condition?    If so, I would love to help! 

I am an experienced Dietitian. Registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) and a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA). I have a degree in Dietetics and Human Nutrition and a postgraduate diploma in Dietetics. 

I have worked as a Registered Dietitian since year 2000, in both hospital and community settings, gaining extensive experience in helping people with a number of health conditions. Just over 10 years, working in the NHS has provided me with a wide range of skills and experiences that are proving valuable to all my clients."

Please feel free to make contact so we can briefly discussion your nutritional requirements.

name: Caroline Laidlaw
bio:
Caroline has extensive experience as a freelance dietitian and has worked in Private Practice for 16 years. She has weekly clinics at the Nuffield in Brighton and Haywards Heath and at the Montefoire Hospital in Hove. She is passionate about the important role food and nutrition plays in health and wellbeing and offers practical and realistic individualised nutrition care  and ongoing support. Her experience over the last 30 years within the NHS both in physical and mental health services, in a wide variety of clinical specialities brings a wealth of dietetic knowledge into her consultations.
Caroline was one of the first dietitians in the UK to be fully trained in the low FODMAP approach (low fermentable carbohydrate diet) for irritable bowel and she has great success and extensive experience in this field. Helping hundreds of patients manage their symptoms and forming individualised nutrition and lifestyle plans.
She works closely with the hospital consultants and GPs to provide a comprehensive dietetic service and is an integral and core member of the multidisciplinary team clinics at the Montefiore: The Sussex IBS clinic and Brighton Bariatric Service
Main areas of interest include Irritable bowel, Gastroenterology, Bariatrics, Cancer, Mental Health and Nutritional Support
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, Mental health, Nutrition for older people, Oncology, Women's health

name: Sascha Landskron
title: BSc, MSc
bio:
Sascha is a Specialist Dietitian with over 20 years of clinical experience working with children, teenagers and adults in the NHS and private practice. She has treated over 20,000 patients in the UK and abroad and is registered with the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC). She provides training and education on nutrition for a variety of health professionals.
Sascha uses a personalised approach to nutrition, because nutritional requirements and eating styles vary from person to person. 
She specialises in weight management, food allergies and intolerances, nutritional genomics and ketogenic metabolic therapy for mental and physical health issues.
Sascha competed her Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition and Food Sciences in 2001 at the University of Alberta, Canada, and hospital dietetic training in 2002 in Vancouver and Victoria, Canada. In 2012, she earned a Master’s degree with Distinction, in Advanced Dietetic Practice at the University of Nottingham, UK. She has also completed postgraduate clinical accreditation in food and nutrition and genetics (Food and our Genome) in 2021 at Monash University, Melbourne.
Most consultations are provided remotely on Zoom, but home visits can be arranged. 
Sascha holds international professional indemnity insurance, allowing her to consult with patients in every country, including North America.

name: Sophie Medlin
bio:
Sophie Medlin is a well-recognised consultant dietitian, director of CityDietitians and is the Chair for the British Dietetic Association for London. Sophie has expertise in gastrointestinal and colorectal health. She worked in acute hospitals specialising in gastrointestinal diseases before moving into academia, where she worked as a lecturer at King’s College London. Sophie is a go-to spokesperson for media when it comes to evidence-based nutrition, regularly featuring in print, broadcast and social media.

Sophie has specialist knowledge and skills in the management of medical conditions such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), colorectal dysfunction, diverticular disease and polycystic ovarian syndrome. Sophie also specialises in disordered eating and weight inclusive fertility optimisation.  

Sophie works as a consultant in product development for the manufacture of vitamins and probiotics and enjoys applying her academic research skills in the commercial sector.

name: Daniel Webb
title: BSc (hons), PgDip, MSc
bio:
I first took an interest in dietetics after seeing first-hand the impact that diet and lifestyle factors have on an individuals health. I'm passionate about offering people the tools, knowledge and guidance to optimise their own health and performance. 

At university, I studied human nutrition, exercise physiology & health, with additional credits in biochemistry, human physiology, genetics, & cellular biology at an undergraduate level. I went on to study a post-graduate diploma in dietetics achieving a first-class honours. Whilst working full-time as a dietitian within the NHS, I undertook a masters degree in dietetics, also achieving a first-class honours.

I'm currently working as the Acute Team Lead & Lead Dietitian for Surgery at Morriston hospital. I provide inpatient care for patients admitted to ICU, surgical & medical wards, and run a weekly medical & surgical gastroenterology outpatient clinic. 
Consultations undertaken for a range of concerns including:
IBS
IBD (UC & Crohns)
Diabetes (Type 2)
Constipation
Coeliac disease
Low BMI & weight gain
Weight management support
Hyperlipidaemia 
Non-cirrhotic liver disease
Metabolic liver disease 
Eosinophilic Oesophagitis (Including Lymphocytic)
Pancreatic disorders
Bile acid malabsorption
Lactose intolerance
Diverticula disease
Function gut disorders
Stoma management (colostomy & ileostomy)
  Services include free exploration call to establish client needs.
Following successful exploration call, 45 minute face-to-face or virtual consultation that includes:
Anthropometric measurements (height, weight, BMI, body fat % if required)
Assessment of condition & symptoms
Exploration of dietary intake & lifestyle factors
Recommended changes to diet, lifestyle & supplementation
Full summary and directed plan will be sent via PDF following consultation, with follow up consultations available. 

Sports Nutrition consultations available. Services include initial consultation to discuss goals and objectives, followed by a personalised nutrition plan in a PDF format. Follow up consultations bookable to track & discuss progress. 
Sports nutrition consultations undertaken for a range of goals and objectives.
If you think I can help you or have any questions about the services I offer, please don't hesitate to get in touch via the contact form.

name: Olivia Wall
title: BSC
bio:
Freelance Registered Dietitian, specialising in Fertility, Maternity and Post-natal care. 
Based in North Devon, working in person and virtually.

name: Karine Patel
bio:
I am Karine Patel, director of Dietitian Fit member of the Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC) and the British Dietetic Association (BDA).

I hold a Bachelor of Science in Nutrition & Dietetics from McGill University in Montreal, Canada, and a Master of Science in Nutrition & Dietetics. My Master’s thesis has allowed me to be an expert in weight loss through sustainable and healthy solutions.

I am passionate about my work, and I devote my time to improving the services we offer you. Our team of dietitians is fully qualified and trained by our reputable partner Team Nutrition to provide you with an outstanding, personalised service.  We are devoted to making you fall in love with healthy living. Whether you are a fussy eater or a big eater, we will make you discover the joys of tasty healthy eating and you will finally reach your goal for good! No more dieting, feeling tired and restricted!

In my free time, I enjoy travelling, cooking and discovering everything there is to know about nutrition. 
  We offer online consultations and face to face consultations at one of our offices:
Birmingham
Harley Street, London Dietitian
Harlesden, London Nutritionist
Staines, Surrey Dietitian 
Maidenhead

name: Andreea Nitescu
title: MSc
bio:
As a Registered Dietitian with advanced expertise in precision nutrition, the microbiome, and genomics, I specialise in helping individuals achieve metabolic health and manage chronic diseases through personalised dietary strategies. My academic background includes a Master’s Degree in Molecular Biology (Staffordshire University), which underpins my evidence-based approach to nutrition and health and supports my research into the gut microbiome.
In my practice, I have developed a holistic approach to helping those with:
1. Digestive disorders (such as IBS, SIBO, Ulcerative Colitis, Crohn’s Disease, GERD, Acid Reflux, Histamine Intolerance, Chronic Idiopathic Constipation, etc.)
2. Autoimmune conditions (including Celiac disease, Inflammatory bowel disease, Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, Graves’ disease, SLE, Multiple Sclerosis, Type 1 Diabetes, Sjögren’s syndrome, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Myasthenia gravis, Scleroderma, etc.)
3. Metabolic disorders (ASCVD – atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease, CAD – coronary artery disease, Type 2 Diabetes, NAFLD, Obesity, Hemochromatosis, Gout, Wilson’s Disease, Hyperlipidemia, etc.)
4. Hormonal disorders (polycystic ovary syndrome, endometriosis, adenomyosis, hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, perimenopause/menopause)

name: Susanna Wilson
bio:
Susanna Wilson, Advanced Dietetic practitioner | HCPC, BDA, CORU
Hello, I'm Susanna Wilson—a Registered Dietitian with over a decade of experience in eating disorders and mental health. I’m registered with the Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC), the British Dietetic Association (BDA), and CORU, and I offer specialised support to individuals and families worldwide.
Over twelve years ago, I relocated to Scotland to pursue a degree in Dietetics at Queen Margaret University in Edinburgh. Since then, I’ve worked across England, Scotland, and Ireland in both inpatient and outpatient settings, supporting adolescents, adults, and families through recovery. My clinical background includes roles in Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services (CAMHS) and adult eating disorder services in Edinburgh. I’ve also served in an advisory capacity on national policy development for eating disorders in Scotland.
With advanced training in non-medical prescribing at the master’s level, I bring an in-depth understanding of how medications can influence recovery. Beyond clinical work, I’m committed to supporting fellow professionals through workshops, clinical supervision, guest lectures, and media contributions focused on eating disorders.
My approach is always personalised and compassionate. I work with clients to explore more than just diet—we focus on routines, lifestyle, and body image to build a recovery plan that truly fits. 
I specialise in the treatment of anorexia nervosa, bulimia, binge eating disorder, eating disorder fertility and pregnancy, disordered eating, and co-occurring mental health concerns like anxiety.
I provide online services to clients aged 12 and over, including support for carers. I’m proud to connect globally with individuals, health professionals, and students, helping to make expert care accessible—wherever you are.

name: Bethany Hallam
bio:
I am a Senior Specialist Dietitian in the UK, registered with the Health and Care Professions Council, British Dietetic Association and affiliate member to other specialist groups including British Obesity and Metabolic Surgery Society.

I have over 20 years’ experience working within the NHS since graduating with an honours degree in Dietetics from Leeds Beckett University, in 2000. I subsequently completed my Msc Nutrition with distinction in 2019 and remain committed to continued professional development.

I am highly skilled, knowledgeable and experienced and provide evidenced based, practical and personalised advice. I continue to lead a team of surgical dietitians, as an upper gastro intestinal specialist Dietitian within Leeds Teaching Hospitals Trust and have dietetic experience in all areas of surgery (thoracic, colorectal, urology, pancreatic). I have also held specialist positions in weight loss (bariatric) surgery both within the NHS and private sector and continue to manage the complications of weight loss surgery, as part of my NHS role. I have extensive experience in gastroenterology, nutrition support, oncology and a special interest in gastroparesis.

I am trained in both behaviour change skills and advanced communication and will support you to identify barriers and strategies to overcome these, with empathy and understanding.

Expertise:
Weight management: medical, surgical
Upper gastrointestinal issues: Acid reflux or GORD, Dyspepsia, Dietary advice pre and post Oesophagectomy and Gastrectomy, Oncology support
Pancreatic disease: acute, chronic, idiopathic, gallstone related and associated diabetes
Nutrition Support/Frailty: Food fortification strategies, Advice on nutritional support products
Texture modification, enteral tube feeding
Gastrointestinal conditions: Gastroparesis, Crohn’s disease, Ulcerative Colitis, Diverticular Disease, Constipation, General improvement of gut health and microbiome, Plant based eating

To book a consultation or free 20 minute discovery send an email to highpeakdietitian@outlook.com
industry_services: Private practice, Writing and editing
clinical_expertise: Advanced clinical practice, Critical care, Diabetes, Diverticulosis, Gastroenterology, IBD, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Obesity, Oncology, Veganism and Vegetarianism

name: Philip Robinson
bio:
Phil is a highly experienced dietitian who specialises in the treatment of obesity. He is skilled in the use of methods including lifestyle change, medication and bariatric surgery.
Clients can expect bespoke, holistic support with a wide range of factors which may be contributing to weight gain that is tailored to each client’s specific needs and circumstances. This can include individualised nutrition plans, exercise plans, or advice on reducing sleep or stress to help improve health and manage weight.
Phil has extensive experience working with clients on behaviour change and habit formation. He is dedicated to providing kind and understanding support to help his clients to improve their health. He is also a fully qualified level 3 personal trainer and firmly believes that exercise and keeping active plays an important role in maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
Phil currently works for the NHS as a lead bariatric surgery and complex obesity dietitian and his role involves supporting patients to lose weight, improve their health and minimise the risk of complications from their preferred treatment.
Phil’s time working in the NHS has given him experience working with a range of conditions including (but not limited to) complex gastroenterological conditions, diabetes, cardiovascular disease and endocrine disorders.
As a bariatric dietitian Phil has been invited to sit as an expert on panels and has presented at international surgical conferences.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, Obesity, Weight loss, Coaching/ mentoring, Communicating careers in dietetics, Sports nutrition

name: Christina Evwierhoma
bio:
I am an experienced specialist dietitian with a strong background in acute clinical settings in both inpatient and outpatient environments. I have worked in large NHS teaching hospitals as well as smaller units.
I have expertise in a variety of specialist areas including general dietetics, chronic kidney disease, eating disorders, nutrition support (malnutrition), enteral tube feeding, gastroenterology including coeliac disease, IBS, liver disease, pancreatic disease, neurology, CVD, oncology and orthopaediatics.
Being a strong communicator and educator are key strengths of mine.  I have provided education sessions to patients to help improve their health and well-being and to staff to improve patient care and increase nutrition knowledge.  I am able to develop and deliver innovative education learnt through previous experience, training and  my role as a senior lecturer.
My main clinical specialities are broad but include CVD, pre diabetes, stroke and kidney health and I can work with you to manage your condition and symptoms whilst enjoying a well-balanced diet.  I am passionate about helping people to develop a positive relationship with food to better their health and well being. I have undergraduate and postgraduate qualifications in psychology which support my practice. 
From my broad clinical experience I am able to take a holistic approach to your care. I offer bespoke and evidence-based nutrition advice to help clients make informed decisions for your health and well-being so that you can achieve your health goals.

name: Gillian Galway
title: MSc Dietetics
bio:
Hi, I'm Gillian, a Registered Dietitian with 15 years experience working across a range of areas including bariatric surgery and eating disorders. I'm based in Belfast and I offer face to face and online appointments.
I help clients optimise their nutritional intake and improve their relationship with food. We identify and work on thoughts, feelings and behaviours around food and how these are connected. I provide advice and support with changing habits and behaviours.
I work with clients with disordered eating behaviours such as dietary restriction, chronic dieting, binge eating and compensatory behaviours. I work with clients pre and post bariatric surgery and those diagnosed with eating disorders.
I understand how distressing disordered eating and eating disorders can be. There can be so much guilt and shame associated with food choices and eating behaviours. My approach is non-judgemental and compassionate. I provide a safe space and work in collaboration with you to set realistic and achievable goals.
I help clients to
- Progress from disordered eating to normal eating
- Restore nutritional balance
- Increase the variety and quality of food in the diet
- Work on mindset around food and eating
- Move away from rigid food rules
- Tackle feared foods
- Be curious, set goals and problem solve
- Feel empowered to take action with changing behaviours
I also
- Provide psychoeducation on nutrition
- Dispel nutrition myths
- Optimise nutritional deficiencies (if identified as a problem)
- Provide practical advice and support with implementing dietary changes
- Tailor advice to the clients' individual needs
I am passionate about helping clients to make changes that improve their quality of life and overall health and wellbeing.
I have a non weight focused approach and am passionate about ending weight stigma for all.
I offer a free 15 minute discovery call for an initial chat.
Get in touch in you would like to learn more.
Qualifications
MSc Dietetics (Ulster University)- 2009
BSc Neuroscience (University of Glasgow) - 2007
Advanced Dietetics in Eating Disorders (BDA) - 2023
Cognitive Behaviour Therapy for Eating Disorders (CREDO) - 2023
Eating Disorders Short Course for Dietitians (Leeds Beckett University)- 2020
Other training courses attended - Behaviour Change, Motivational Interviewing, Binge Eating and Diabetes.
industry_services: Business consulting, Private practice
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Eating disorders, Freelance Practice, Obesity, Women's health

name: Jen Grant
bio:
I am a registered Dietitian with 10+ years of experience providing evidenced based nutritional advice and helping clients make positive lasting changes to their diet.
 
I have worked in a variety of settings across Scotland and currently offer bespoke 1:1 nutrition counselling sessions with the aim of working with clients to empower them to take control of their diets and reach their goals.
 
I can provide support in a variety of areas and offer a 20-minute free no obligation consultations are available to all new clients. All sessions are held online and are therefore available to all UK residents.
 
I also have extensive experience in developing and delivering nutritional training for groups and organisations and I am available for both in-person and online training sessions.

name: Isis de Carvalho Stelmo
title: MA
bio:
My name is Isis, an Integrative Dietitian with vast experience in public health, health education, and support work in higher education and charities. I am also a Dance Movement Pychotherapist.
I have lived in four different countries, which enhanced my ability to adapt to new environments as well as to solve problems. Additionally, I had to work on my communication skills in three different languages. These experiences gave me a broadened knowledge about other cultures, as well as the emotional resilience to endure the challenges of living far from home.
Welcoming the patients in the consultation room (whether in person or online) and leading the consultation in an empathetic way has always been a must-do in my practice. It is where the human connection is established.
I am driven by building a career as a holistic and integrative health professional, evidence based, especially in the areas of prevention and promotion of health, wellbeing and mental health.
industry_services: Events

name: Sophie Savva
bio:
I am a HCPC registered dietitian with a passion for empowering people and families to better their health through nutrition. I can support individuals, young people and families with nutrition goals and areas including but not exclusive to:
- Weight Loss support
- Children and adolescent nutrition
- Childhood obesity
- Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
- Vegetarian and vegan diets
- Behavioural change
- Meal planning 
I offer online video consultations therefore appointments are available to anyone in the UK. Please see my website (link below) for contact details and ways to book an appointment to start working on your nutrition and wellness goals
About me and my focus:
Born in Ireland, I embarked on my journey to become a dietitian, finding my new home in the city of Edinburgh.
Now, proudly contributing to the NHS Lothian team, I've immersed myself in diverse experiences, working with a multitude of clients and health conditions. My passion lies in empowering individuals, including young people and families, to achieve optimal health through improved nutrition.
Navigating the complexities of children's diets can be challenging for parents and guardians. Drawing from my experience, I specialise in guiding families through these hurdles, assisting with food preferences, and fostering a positive relationship with food from a young age. I find joy in teaching children about the nourishing power of foods that can help keep us healthy and strong.
In my role, I've witnessed the transformative impact of tailored dietary interventions, aiding individuals in achieving weight loss and overall well-being. My mission is not just about improving diets but also about instilling a lifelong appreciation for nutritious choices.
Check out my website for more information and to book an appointment or discovery call:
Website: www.mydietitian.uk

name: Christopher Chan
bio:
Hi, I am Chris, an HCPC registered dietitian passionate about improving health through nutrition. I provide tailored advice and support through telephone and video calls.
I have experience and training in various specialist areas, including:
• Weight management
• Type 2 Diabetes
• Gut health (including IBS and the low FODMAP diet)
• Inflammatory Bowel Disease (Crohn's disease and Ulcerative colitis).
This list is not exhaustive, so if you want to find out whether I can help, please email me to schedule a free 30-minute discovery call. There is no obligation to book; we can discuss whether working together is the right next step for you.
My goal is to provide you with the resources and knowledge to help you make the right decisions and stay on track to achieve your dietary goals.
Email: Eat_right_with_Chris@outlook.com
Website: https://eatrightwithchris.com/
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/EatRightwithChris
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Diverticulosis, IBD, Low FODMAP, IBS, Weight loss, Nutrition support

name: Reema Pillai
title: MSc
bio:
My name is Reema and I am a Registered Dietitian.

I hold a Bachelor of Science in Nutrition & Dietetics from the University of Surrey, and a Master of Science in Sports and Exercise Nutrition from Loughborough University.

I have extensive experience working for a Health Tech company, focusing on weight management and Type 2 diabetes prevention.

I currently work within a team of private dietitians, specialising in weight management, IBS & low FODMAP, PCOS, Type 2 Diabetes, kidney disease & chronic health issues, as well as vegan and plant based diets.

I love working with people to help better their relationship with food, as well as providing support and guidance around different areas of their health and wellbeing.

This may be through using behavioural change techniques or motivational interviewing, as well as regular guided support. I am an empathetic and non-judgemental person, and will always work to set realistic and measurable goals with clients that they feel happy with. My approach is to educate and empower people to make the most informed choices to help better themselves in whatever area that may be. I believe that everyone is unique in their own way, so tailored advice is important for long-term consistency and happiness.

Please get in touch via email: dietitianfit@gmail.com
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, IBS, Low FODMAP, Obesity, Renal nutrition, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Weight loss, Women's health

name: Daniela Galea
bio:
I’m Daniela, I am a Registered Dietitian and irritable bowel syndrome expert.
Even the simple task of eating can cause uncomfortable gut symptoms when you have IBS and not knowing whether something is ‘safe’ can be scary at best and painful at worst.
I get it because I’ve been there too! I’m an IBS sufferer and understand first hand the impact it can have on our daily lives; from having to call in sick to work, to cancelling plans, to not being able to wear the clothes you love to feeling anxious about travelling.
I have helped thousands of clients with my tried and tested science backed strategies that actually work and I’m here to show you how to get relief from bloating, pain and unpredictable bowel movements, so you can live your life again. 

I will promise to listen to your concerns and provide personalised advice tailored to your needs, lifestyle, cultural and religious beliefs.

I cannot wait to support you on your journey. Do get in touch via info@thenourishedclinic.com or book a free 15 minute discovery call to find out how I could help you.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Gastroenterology, IBS, Low FODMAP, Nutrition for older people

name: Leah Seamark
title: BSc (hons), PgD
bio:
I am a registered dietitian, with over 15 years’ experience working in the NHS, and I am currently the clinical lead for the community dietetic gastroenterology service in Somerset. Alongside my NHS work, I offer private dietetic consultations, either remotely, or in-person at Glencarin House Clinic, in Sherborne, Dorset.
I specialise in a range of gut conditions, including irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory bowel disease, diverticular disease, bile acid malabsorption, dietary intolerances and coeliac disease. I also offer dietary advice for other conditions, including metabolic syndrome, malnutrition and menopause.
To find out more about my services, visit my website www.leahseamarkdiet.co.uk
clinical_expertise: Gastroenterology, IBS, Low FODMAP, IBD, Diverticulosis, Menopause, Metabolic disease, Nutrition support, Freelance Practice, Digital healthcare

name: Rachael Masters
bio:
Rachael Masters, Consultant Dietitian, is the founder and developer of Focus on Undernutrition. Awarded a first class honours in Dietetics and a MSc distinction in clinical leadership and research; throughout her 27 dietetic career she has specialised in the nutritional needs of the elderly.

She has more than 25 years of experience of delivering nutrition training and advising care homes, catering staff and health & social care organisations. Her passion is tackling undernutrition and enhancing dining experience with swallowing problems (dysphagia). 

Focus on Undernutrition provide dedicated programmes for both care and catering staff, which are endorsed by the British Dietetic Association (BDA). Each programme uses a blended learning approach, equipping students with the tools and motivation to engage and learn at their own pace.

The Catering Course covers a range of specialist topics, including menu planning; nutrition & hydration; specialist diets for diabetes, weight loss and undernutrition, swallowing problems, dementia and constipation. This unique six-module programme provides around 40 hours of training.

The Care Staff programme provides practical skills in identifying and treating undernutrition with an emphasis on food-based treatments to help weight gain for residents with a reduced appetite or at risk of undernutrition. This five-module programme provides six hours of training.

Focus on Undernutrition also offer a wide range of services including delivery of nutrition training and consultancy to health and social care organisations; company consultancy on product development and marketing; franchising services and resources to NHS and social care organisations; resource development, as well as public speaking and recipe analysis.

Rachael is a full member of the British Dietetic Association. She has been awarded sixteen national and local awards, and represented dietitians on national organisations, including the NICE quality standards.

Outside work Rachael enjoys volunteering in church and community initiatives and in her spare time, she loves baking and reading.
industry_services: Business consulting, Conferences, Catering, Education & Academia, Health screening, Nutrition technical expertise, Recipe development, Recipe & menu analysis, Speaking, Lecturing & teaching, Workplace Education Sessions, Workplace Cooking demo

name: Catherine Rabess
bio:
Catherine Rabess is an enthusiastic and experienced Registered Dietitian specialising in gastroenterology and complex nutrition support. With over 10 years clinical experience.

With a focus in functional gut disorders including reflux, hiatus hernia, gastritis, SIBO, IBS and trained low FODMAP advanced practitioner, neurogastroenterology conditions such as hEDS, gut dysmotility conditions gastroparesis and delayed gastric emptying. Bowel disease with speciality in lower GI – colorectal surgery and Inflammatory Bowel Disease. As well as, undernutrition and enteral nutrition (tube feeding) in the areas of intestinal failure, bowel disease, neurological disabilities and conditions including cerebal palsy, stroke, Huntington’s disease and Parkinson’s.

She also has expertise in women’s health including PCOS, endometrosis and menopause.

Catherine splits her time between NHS and private practice. Previous roles include gastroenterology Dietitian and part of IBD team a East Surrey Hospital, acute lead of service at Epsom General Hospital and most recently clinical lead of community Nutrition and Dietetic service in South West London.

Catherine also works as a Consultant Dietitian at leading private hospital St John’s and St Elizabeth. Where she works closely with Consultants at GI Unit and part of a small team of specialist Dietitians for ward based medical and surgical care. 

As a media spokesperson she has worked with a number of online platforms, publishers and newspapers. Catherine has been featured in Women's Health, The Times, Telegraph, Stylist, BBC Food, BBC News. She has also wrote scientific articles and factsheets for large industry brands including Abbott Nutrition and Quorn Nutrition.

Catherine has been working on public health partnerships with local authority focusing on resource development, nutrition advice, cookalongs, talks and open events for African and Caribbean community.

name: Aminder Sagoo
bio:
Aminder is a HCPC registered Dietitian with over 12 years of experience in the NHS and currently practices at Kettering General Hospital (Northamptonshire Healthcare Foundation Trust) in Critical Care and Gastroenterology.
Prior to this she practiced at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Birmingham (Neurology, Neurosurgery, Trauma, Burns and Plastics) and Luton and Dunstable Hospital NHS Foundation Trust (Bariatrics, Gastrointestinal surgery, Bariatric surgery, Respiratory medicine).
More fondly known as Mindy, her passion for holistic living has led her to explore ways of incorporating dietetic advice for people on a journey to wellness.
Her vision is "Eat Well, Live Well" - empowering individuals to maximise their enjoyment of food, whether they are modifying their diet to lose weight, gain weight, manage gastrointestinal symptoms or to overall improve their eating habits. With her extensive medical knowledge, assessments and interventions are reliable and evidence-based.
Mental health and wellbeing will always be the core of her structured dietetic assessment, together with exploring what physical activity works for the specific individual.
A form of physical activity she will always encourage (if keen!) is via Bollywood Dance as something that brings joy. In her spare time she also provides choreography for events.
Assessments are always person-centred in order to develop and negotiate realistic and achievable goals.
To find out more or to book a consultation please contact via email (MindyRD.23@gmail.com) or Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/mindy_dietitian)
