name: Hazel Clarke
contact_address: Covent Garden, London, Greater London United Kingdom
bio:
Evidence based and tailored nutritional advice to help you reach your goals
Cheshire & Manchester based Dietitian specialising in plant based diets and gastrointestinal conditions.

I have a passion for plant-based diets. I relish guiding people when they adopt a plant-based or supporting them on their plant-based journey. I help people make informed choices about their health, nutrition, and sustainable choices, using the latest evidence based practice. 

Additionally, I am very passionate about gastrointestinal health, especially irritable bowel syndrome and inflammatory bowel disease. I support people with the following conditions:
- Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD),
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS),
- stoma guidance,
- diverticular disease,
- pancreatic enzyme insufficiency.

I have experience working in the NHS as a clinical dietitian in 2 trusts. I have worked with public health organisations and as a research dietitian at King's College London, researching IBD. I am published in 3 papers currently.

I am registered with the Health & Care Professions Council and hold full membership with the British Dietetic Association

name: Hazel Elliott
bio:
I am a fully committed and highly experienced Registered Dietitian with over 25 years of post-graduate experience working in NHS and private hospitals in both Edinburgh and Glasgow.

My particular area of interest is the treatment of Eating Disorders and disordered eating. I have worked in specialist in-patient units for the treatment of Eating Disorders for the past 15 years. I have worked with both adult and adolescent clients with Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, OSFED (other specified feeding or eating disorder), Binge Eating Disorder and ARFID (Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder). 

I believe that education and behavioural change can improve the lives of those with an eating disorder and can ultimately lead to recovery. My compassion, skills and enthusiasm are key to working alongside clients to achieve their own goals.

Additionally, I have enjoyed working alongside clients to treat a wide range of complex difficulties such as weight management, diabetes, oncology, cardiology, renal, general surgery, respiratory and stroke. I am committed to providing a professional and patient centred service for all clients.

I am a full member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA), the Mental Health Group of the BDA, Accreditation Committee at the Royal College of Psychiatrists and registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC).
industry_services: Private practice, Articles, Writing and editing
clinical_expertise: Advanced clinical practice, Eating disorders, IBS, Low FODMAP, Mental health, Nutrition support, Obesity, Veganism and Vegetarianism

name: Evangelos Tsatiris, RD, BSc, MSc (Dietetics), EHPS, BSc, MSc (Psychology)
bio:
Evangelos is a qualified, HCPC Registered Dietitian and a full member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and the Freelance Dietitians group, currently working in the area of Liverpool. He is also a member of the European Health Psychology Society (EHPS). He is committed to forming relationships with people looking to lose or manage their weight and deal with mental health and other chronic conditions. He is passionate about helping people understand how the food they eat affects their health and well-being. He uses behavioural change approaches to support people in making good dietary choices, tailored to their individual lifestyles. He specialises in weight management and mental health nutrition, providing nutritional counselling to people with depression, anxiety, binge eating, or disordered eating.

Evangelos holds a BSc (Hons) in Dietetics from Coventry University and an MSc in Nutrition, Physical Activity & Public Health from the University of Bristol. As part of his dietetic training, he gained valuable NHS experience in several hospitals, including the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham, New Cross Hospital, Solihull, Good Hope and Heartlands Hospitals. Prior to qualifying as a dietitian, Evangelos was awarded a first-class BSc (Hons) in Psychology and subsequently specialised and practised in Health Psychology. He also earned an MSc in Health Psychology from the University of Hertfordshire. Having worked in various psychological and nutritional settings, Evangelos has developed expertise in applying evidence-based, behavioural change techniques to his everyday dietetic practice using a person-centred, holistic, psychological approach. Nutrition Therapy Practice is here to improve their clients' quality of life, so get in touch to learn more and start building a healthier relationship with food.

name: Christine Phelan
bio:
I'm a registered dietitian and member of the Health & Care Professionals Council (HCPC) & the British Dietetic Association (BDA). 
I am a specialist eating disorder dietitian with a deep passion for supporting young people and adults in their recovery from eating disorders and disordered eating. I have worked in a variety of settings including a mental health inpatient unit, a CAMHS inpatient unit and a specialist eating disorder service for adults. I have vast experience working with neurodivergent individuals including ADHD and autism spectrum disorder and helping them navigate their own dietary needs. 
I can support adults, families, children & adolescents in the following areas:
- Eating disorder support (Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, Binge Eating Disorder, ARFID and OSFED)
In our sessions together, I will provide a non-judgemental and tailored approach to your own individual needs. I am truly passionate about helping my clients heal their relationship with food and live a life free from restrictions.  I encompass a compassionate approach to educate my clients about their own dietary needs and to help you navigate through all the confusing diet talk in the world. 
I offer video or telephone consultations, therefore, I can see anyone within the UK. Please get in touch with any questions you may have and I look forward to working with you in the future!
clinical_expertise: Eating disorders, Adolescence, IBS, Mental health, Nutrition support, Obesity, Weight loss, Veganism and Vegetarianism

name: Nichola Williams
title: MNutr
bio:
I'm Nichola Williams and I specialise in helping people manage histamine intolerance (HIT) and other food chemical sensitivities (FODMAPs, salicylates, glutamates, oxalates, and additives). My passion lies in making a difference in the lives of those dealing with food intolerance, especially those with Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS), Perimenopause and Long Covid. I believe that the right nutrition can play a crucial role in managing symptoms and significantly improving your quality of life.
I understand these challenges, not just professionally but also personally, as I have lived experience with MCAS and histamine intolerance. This personal insight gives me a unique empathy and understanding for those navigating these complex conditions.
Histamine intolerance and MCAS can show up in many ways, including:
Gastrointestinal issues: bloating, diarrhoea, stomach pain, and nausea
Skin reactions: hives, itching, and flushing
Respiratory problems: nasal congestion, sneezing, and difficulty breathing
Neurological symptoms: headaches, dizziness, and fatigue
Cardiovascular symptoms: rapid heart rate and low blood pressure
I’m here to help you understand these symptoms and manage them effectively through nutrition. I offer personalised consultations online and in Nottingham, where we can work together to create a nutrition plan tailored specifically to your needs. You can find more information on my website, The Dietary Edit.
My approach is holistic. Alongside nutrition, I incorporate lifestyle changes, stress management, and other complementary therapies to support your overall well-being. I’m dedicated to creating customised nutrition plans that fit your unique needs and preferences. To tell you a bit more about my background,
My training includes the low FODMAP diet at Monash University and food chemical sensitivities at The Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in Australia. I stay actively involved in professional organisations and continuous professional development to keep up-to-date with the latest research and best practices.
Feel free to reach out to discuss how I can help you manage your symptoms and enhance your quality of life with a free 20-minute discovery call. I’m looking forward to working with you!

name: Aglaia Sabrina Chorafa
title: MSc
bio:
Highly Specialised Dietitian & Trainee Psychotherapist
Hi, I’m Sabrina. I’m a Registered Dietitian and a Trainee Psychotherapist, and I specialise in Mental Health and Eating Disorders therapy. My approach is all about helping you re-explore your relationship with food and your body with compassionate curiosity.
I’ve worked extensively in both the NHS and private practice, and I currently lead a team at North London NHS Foundation Trust, overseeing one of the largest Eating Disorder services in the UK. My work is rooted in delivering high-quality, person-centred care.
Beyond dietetics, I’ve always been fascinated by the human experience. I completed a 200-hour yoga teacher training in India, which deepened my understanding of the mind-body connection, and I’m also training in Integrative Psychotherapy at Metanoia Institute. I hold an MSc in Eating Disorders & Clinical Nutrition from UCL, which has further shaped my specialist approach to working with eating disorders. These experiences allow me to bring a more holistic approach to my work, integrating both psychological and nutritional perspectives
For me, it’s really about meeting you where you are, honouring your whole self, and supporting you on your journey of self-discovery.
industry_services: Private practice, Health screening, Corporate Health, Workplace Education Sessions, Apps, Digital Health
clinical_expertise: Eating disorders, Mental health, Coaching/ mentoring, IBS, Low FODMAP, Women's health, Menopause, Freelance Practice

name: Tara Bruni
bio:
I'm Tara, I’m a Diabetes Specialist Dietitian (BSc, MSc, RD) with nearly a decade of experience supporting people living with prediabetes & type 2 diabetes.
I’ve worked in some of the UK’s leading healthcare settings, including Bupa, Xyla, and King’s Health Partners at Guy’s and St Thomas’-Europe’s leading hospital for diabetes care.
I’ve shaped national initiatives like the NHS Diabetes Prevention Programme and the NHS Diabetes Remission Programme, and my work has been recognised with multiple awards and presentations at the Diabetes UK Professional Conference.
I’ve delivered lectures and facilitated courses for MSc Diabetes and MSc Dietetics students at King’s College London, helping to bridge the gap between science and real-world practice.
Here’s how I can help you:
Type 2 Diabetes & Prediabetes: I'll help you lower your blood sugars, improving insulin sensitivity, and explore diabetes remission, if you’ve been diagnosed within the past 6 years.
Heart Health: Whether it’s cholesterol or blood pressure concerns, I’ll help you create a plan that supports your heart health.
Sustainable Weight Loss: I can support you to lose weight in a way that’s realistic, personalised, and rooted in long-term health - without restriction.
You don’t have to do this alone. 
I provide an online service - so you can access my support from anywhere in the world. 
If you’re ready to take the next step, I’d love to hear your story. You can email me at hello@tarabruni.com.
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Weight loss

name: Heather Daniels
title: BSc Nutrition and Dietetics
bio:
Heather Daniels is a registered dietitian and a member of the British Dietetic Association and Health Professions Council. 
She completed her Nutrition and Dietetics degree at Kings College London in 2005 and has since worked in both hospitals and outpatient clinic settings. 
Between 2006 and 2008, she worked as a Community Dietitian in South West Essex, responsible for setting up a successful Weight Management Programme across the borough. 
Between 2008 and 2024, she worked in the borough of Barnet as a Specialist Dietitian with a focus on Type 2 Diabetes and Weight Management. 
She now works privately with clinics in Radlett, Mill Hill, Temple Fortune and Stamford Hill, as well as online.
Heather provides a completely personalised nutritional assessment and will tailor all advice and support to your needs.
industry_services: Private practice, Corporate Health
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Freelance Practice, Metabolic disease, Obesity, Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), Weight loss

name: Clara Carr
bio: Clara Carr is a HCPC (Health & Care Professions Council) registered Dietitian with 19 years working experience in the NHS. She also has a degree in Biochemistry from Imperial College and an MPhil in Food Science. She has a passion to help people practically, so she trained to be a dietitian obtaining a Diploma in Nutrition and Dietetics, so she could translate medical and scientific knowledge into helping live better through ‘do-able’ diet and lifestyle changes that will help feel and be better. She has worked in various settings including the largest hospital in Europe and several district general hospitals across West and South Yorkshire. She has worked in Hospital, Community and GP clinics since 2008. She has a special interest in Gastroenterology dietetic – including IBS, IBD, Food intolerances and Coeliac disease. She was also a specialist Care Home Dietitian for many years and can offer advice on modified texture diets and for people with Learning Disabilities. She runs groups for gluten free diets and the Low FODMAP diet for patients who need this. She is currently working at Sheffield Children’s Hospital and does some clinics and groups at Huddersfield. She also has much experience working in weight management – either to lose or gain weight, diabetes and dietary advice for cancer and dementia. A keen sports person, she runs and exercises regularly, and therefore knows from experience about diets for active people. She has run a marathon and did the Aspire Channel Swim but also just walks for fitness with her family. She also has experience working with children and families and is keen to help people get healthier and feel better by improving their diets to fit into their lifestyles. As a mother of two boys, she has personal and professional knowledge and experience of working with children, families, carers and schools to improve their diets with limited time and budgets available. As a keen cook and gourmet (lover of food and eating) she has the practical skills and knowledge to help people with menu planning and can offer easy to prepare food solutions. She offers a unique ‘cook and eat’ service in client’s own homes and will do ‘supermarket tours’ too.

name: Alka Pandey
title: PG Diploma in Dietetics and Applied Nutrition.
bio:
Hi, I'm Alka Pandey a Specialist Dietitian within the NHS and a private consultant.
I combine best of both worlds as I bring in, over 11 years’ experience in the NHS alongside experience from my South Asian background. Over the years I have worked with different specialities like medicine for the elderly, oncology, weight management (both weight loss and weight gain), respiratory diseases. Currently I am working as a Diabetes (Type 1, Type 2, Gestational Diabetes) and Critical Care Specialist Dietitian.
My ability to understand and speak fluent Hindi, Gujarati, Marathi, and Punjabi, helps me understand my patients better and connect at a level where they can comfortably engage with me and help me support them. My friends and patients call me a good listener and a problem solver.
My special interests are taking the proactive approach to prevent Diabetes going from prediabetes to Type 2 Diabetes stage and bringing Type 2 diabetes into remission.
I have been a recipient of NHS Parliamentary awards in 2019; have written an article in a leading Dietetic magazine. Done a UK TV show and online radio show in 2023 covering varied topics e.g. Healthy eating, Weight Management, Diabetes etc.

name: Katie Barton
title: MSc
bio:
I am registered with the Health and Care Professions Council with over 15 years experience working in the National Health Service (NHS) across a wide variety of clinical areas in leading teaching hospitals in Liverpool and London.
I have worked as a Highly Specialist Dietitian in Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) since 2010 with responsibility for the dietary management of the inpatient and outpatient dietetic service for adolescents and adults with IBD in a large London Teaching Hospital. I conduct regular outpatient clinics for patients with Coeliac Disease.

I completed specialist training at King’s College on delivering the low FODMAP diet which is an evidence based treatment for functional gut disorders. I have over 11 years experience delivering the low FODMAP diet in functional GI disorders in both the NHS and private practice setting. I set up a new dietetic service for patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome to deliver the low FODMAP diet at a large teaching hospital in Liverpool.
I have experience as an Honorary Lecturer at London Metropolitan University and University College London on the dietary management of Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Irritable Bowel Syndrome
I am the BDA representative for IBD UK and contributed to the updated IBD standards published in Frontline Gastroenterology. I have experience contributing to book chapters and dietetic magazines. I am lead author for two papers published in peer reviewed journals.
I am available for individual appointments virtually, via video link or via telephone throughout the UK. On request in person appointments can be arranged in central and south East London. 
Please use the "contact" tab on this page to arrange an appointment 
For more information about the services I can provide see the link to my website.

name: Susan Summers
bio:
Hi
I’m Sue Summers, a highly experienced paediatric dietitian with over 20 years of service in the NHS. As a parent I know all too well how difficult it is to get the right support for your child.
The Dietitian Online has been developed to offer personalised support and advice tailored to meet the unique needs of children and families facing nutritional challenges.
My approach combines the latest scientific evidence with practical, family-centred strategies to support infants, children and adolescent in a flexible setting that accommodates your family schedule.
I offer flexible appointment times and in-depth consultations to empower families with the knowledge and skills to support your child.

name: Rebecca Taylor
contact_address: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear United Kingdom
bio:
I am an HCPC registered dietitian with more than 10 years clinical experience working in both the NHS and private sector.
I specialise in gastroenterology, with a focus on Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD).
My goal is to help individuals regain control of their diet through practical, personalised support.
My approach focuses on reducing unnecessary dietary restrictions and empowering clients to heal their relationship with food.
I believe a balanced, flexible diet is key to managing disease-related symptoms, helping clients feel confident in their food choices and living a life free from restriction or discomfort.
Whether you are at the beginning of your IBD journey, or tired of navigating the challenges of IBD, I provide compassionate, evidence-based guidance to help you meet your goals and support your body’s needs.

name: Talia Cecchele
bio:
Talia Cecchele is a registered dietitian specialising in eating disorders and disordered eating. She has over 12 years of clinical experience and is the principal dietitian and founder of Talia Cecchele Nutrition, a virtual clinic with a team of registered dietitians specialising in eating disorders and disordered eating.
At TCN, the team supports people from 16+ years through 1:1 consultations and group programs to bring balance back to nutrition, break free from food rules and find food freedom. Talia and her team work by incorporating a compassion-led, non-diet approach and Health At Every Size (HAES) framework. Check out our website for more details about consultations and free resources. We look forward to supporting you!
industry_services: Private practice, Corporate Health, Content Creation, Lecturing & teaching

name: Bethany Allchin
bio: I currently work as a highly specialist paediatric dietitian in the largest children's hospital in the UK, alongside my freelance work for Beam Dietitians. I set up Beam Dietitians with my colleague Molly Lovell in 2024 to help children who require support with their nutrition. I have a broad range of experience within many speciality areas in paediatrics and have a passion for my work. We are able to support with poor weight gain, food allergies (including cow's milk allergy), reflux, coeliac disease, weight management,  nutritional deficiencies and plant-based diets at our clinic rooms in South Manchester or virtually using Google Meet or the telephone. Visit our website for more information: beamdietitians.com

name: Gabrielle Morse
bio:
Gabrielle Morse is a specialist neurogastroenterology dietitian with a breadth of experience across gastroenterology conditions like IBS, SIBO, IBD and Coeliac disease, as well as having an interest in women’s health, lipid and metabolic health. Neurogastroenterology dietitians are specialists in digestive issues arising from a change in the communication between the gut and the brain (often referred to as the gut-brain axis). Digestive problems can include bloating, abdominal pain, reflux, constipation and diarrhoea.
She is frequently praised for her compassionate and holistic approach to client care and is skilled at tailoring bespoke nutritional plans for each client’s circumstances and needs. As a passionate advocate for improving nutritional health for all individuals she supports, Gabrielle’s goal is always to help the client achieve symptom relief, a better quality of life, and food freedom.
Gabrielle is an accredited BDA Work Place Ready dietitian and enjoys delivering workplace wellbeing workshops to provide evidence-based nutritional advice to the broader public and improve employees’ health, morale and performance. She has also been featured in leading newspapers, like the Sunday Telegraph, advising on balancing social eating with health goals.
Gabrielle has worked at a world-leading hospital in London, in addition to the prestigious The Gut Health Clinic where she remains highly skilled and current on the latest evidence. She is a guest lecturer at King’s College London and frequently provides nutritional training to doctors, GPs, nurses, and other allied healthcare professionals.
Use discount code BDA10 when booking to receive a unique 10% discount on your initial consultation with me. For more information or to book in, please contact bookings@theguthealthclinic.com.

name: Tanya Thomas
bio: I have been working as a dietitian for 30 years (in the NHS and privately), specialising in paediatrics, coeliac disease and food intolerance and allergy.  I have worked in all areas of paediatrics, having worked at a leading London Children’s Hospital for 8 years.  I was diagnosed with coeliac disease as an infant and have been following a gluten-free diet since.  Much of my work involves seeing children, but I also see people of any age with coeliac disease, food intolerance/allergy and IBS.  I offer a very flexible service for appointments - please contact me via email in the first instance. I am an accomplished nutrition writer, have worked on a consultancy basis for a number of nutrition companies and I am a visiting lecturer at the University of Hertfordshire on the Nutrition and Dietetics and Physician Associate courses. I currently run a weekly online virtual dietetic clinic for a GP practice in north London, where I see a range of patients including those with IBS, Type 2 diabetes and food intolerances.

name: Mala Watts
bio:
info@mydietrecovery.com
I have over 20 years’ experience as a Specialist Paediatric Eating Disorder
dietitian, working with children and young people with eating disorders and
disordered eating/ eating difficulties. My strengths include my extensive skills
working with young people individually, as well as parents to support their
child with weight restoration and normalising eating. I have more than 6 years’
experience offering Family Based Treatment (FBT). FBT has the strongest
evidence for the management of eating disorders. I have experience working
with young people who have ASD, ADHD and anxiety, which are often
associated with eating disorders. I have some personal experience as a
parent negotiating the Special Education System (SEN) system over many
years. This experience has been invaluable in truly understanding the parent
perspective and challenges when one child has particular needs. I am
therefore able to tailor my advice and support parents through challenging
times.
I am also very familiar with vegetarian and vegan diets. I have a keen interest
in sports nutrition which compliments my work with eating
disorders/disordered eating patients and those with eating difficulties, as
exercise can be a key feature.
I can see individuals with ARFID or suspected ARFID when working closely
alongside other clinician(s) such as a psychiatrist, psychologist, occupational
therapist and speech and language therapist.
I have attended ARFID (avoidant restrictive food intake disorder) training
during 2021 with internationally renowned Dr Rachel Bryant-Waugh and also
British Dietetic Association (BDA) endorsed training from Winchester University.
I am a committee member of the informal ARFID sub-group of the British
Dietetic Association
Please contact me by e-mailing info@mydietrecovery.com
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Eating disorders, Mental health, Veganism and Vegetarianism
geographical_areas_served: UK, East Anglia, East Midlands, Europe, Greater London, Home Counties, Ireland, Isle of Wight, North East, North Wales, North West, Northern Ireland, South Wales, South West, South East

name: Rania Salman
bio:
If you are looking to improve your fertility, better manage your PCOS, improve your blood sugars or just need healthy eating advice require expert nutritional advice, I can help you. My name is Rania and I am a qualified and experienced registered dietitian and nutritionist based in London and online. Misinformation and contradictory information online and on social media is rife which makes knowing which foods to eat more difficult than it should be! As a registered dietitian, I use an evidence-based approach to support you in reaching your goals.  So if you are looking to saying goodbye to confusion, feeling overwhelmed and a lack of direction, then do not hesitate to reach out for a FREE discovery call.
I graduated from university with an honours degree in Biomedical Sciences. Fascinated by our relationship with food and how we can improve our behaviours and lifestyle with changes in our diet, I decided to study nutrition and dietetics and completed my postgraduate diploma with a merit in the field. I soon moved into working for the NHS where I spent multiple years working in some of the largest university teaching hospitals in the country.  This gave me exposure to a range of conditions that can be managed better with diet and fuelled my passion to improving people's lives with practical dietary solutions.
industry_services: Corporate Health, Media / PR, Workplace nutrition, Workplace Education Sessions

name: Dael Hartley
bio:
Hello, I am Dael. I am a Specialist Gastroenterology Dietitian with more than 10 years of experience in this field and over 15 years of experience working within the NHS as a Dietitian. Having specialised in the area of gastroenterology, I have a depth of knowledge and skills to help empower you to manage your condition with diet and lifestyle changes using the latest up-to-date evidence.

Areas of Expertise:

Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS): Including the low FODMAP diet
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD): Including Crohn’s Disease and Ulcerative Colitis
Pancreatic Exocrine Insufficiency
Coeliac Disease
Bile Acid Malabsorption

Services Offered:
Individual Counseling: Personalised nutrition plans tailored to your specific needs.
Diet and Lifestyle Management: Evidence-based strategies to manage and improve gastrointestinal health.
Education and Support: Guidance on understanding your condition and how to make sustainable changes.

Telephone Consultations also offered.

Contact Me:
Contact me to discuss your requirements with no obligation to arrange an appointment.

name: Aimee McEvilly
bio:
Hello, my name is Aimee and I am a Paediatric Dietitian, with over 11 years experience working as a registered Dietitian for the NHS and private practice. My current role is as a Highly Specialist Gastrointestinal and Nutrition Support Dietitian at Birmingham Children’s Hospital. 
One of my main areas of expertise and one I feel passionately about, is helping to manage children with food allergies. It can be really tough getting to the bottom of your child's unexplained symptoms, especially when different healthcare professionals can give conflicting advice. I can provide prompt support and advice on how to reduce symptoms and build confidence with feeding your child. 
 
I am also a Mum of one, with firsthand experience managing reflux, weaning and feeding a fussy toddler. This means my advice will always be practical and tailored to your family. 

I offer expert advice in the following areas; 

Food intolerances/allergies. This includes single allergies such as cow’s milk protein allergy, multiple food allergies and oral allergy syndrome
Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Weaning, including delayed weaning
Reflux and colic
Diarrhoea
Constipation
Faltering growth
Tube feeding and tube weaning, this includes blended diet
Vegan and vegetarian diets
Selective eating
Autism and selective eating

If you would like more information please contact me via email: aimee.mcevilly@gmail.com
or mobile: 07772106107

name: Annabel Alder
title: BSc Hons
bio:
Hello. I'm Annabel.
Are chronic kidney disease (CKD), diabetes or IBS affecting your life?
Have you recently had a diagnosis of early stage chronic kidney disease and been told 'not to worry about it' or perhaps your CKD is progressing? Either way, diet and lifestyle play a major role in managing this condition. That includes tightening up blood glucose levels if you have diabetes.
Perhaps you're finding yourself down internet rabbit holes and need a helping hand out?
Is it finally time to get that IBS under control? Or, are you simply in a rut with your diet and lifestyle? Have you spent years looking after everyone else but yourself and would like some gentle guidance and coaching, to put the focus back on you and your quality of life?
I would be delighted to support you.
My goal is for you to feel better informed and in control of your diet and health?
I qualified in 2005 and have supported clients as an NHS dietitian in leading teaching hospitals in London and Brighton, including within specialist diabetes units and over 10 years in specialist kidney units.
I also have a private practice and facilitate workshops with medical students.
Let’s discuss your goals via a free 15 minute discovery call.
Do contact me on 07970 183270 or at enquiries@annabelalder.com
For more information about my services, please take a look at my website. https://annabelalder.com/
I look forward to hearing from you.
industry_services: Private practice, Workplace Education Sessions, Writing
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, IBS, Menopause, Renal nutrition, Weight loss

name: Olly Howard
title: BSc. (Hons).
bio:
Olly is a qualified dietitian with over five years of experience working in the NHS and is currently a senior dietitian working in eating disorders. He worked in two of the largest hospital trusts in Kent where he developed extensive skills in the nutritional management of a wide range of conditions, whilst also managing internal teams of specialty dietitians in his role as senior team lead. Recently, he has started practicing at the Kent Family Medical Clinic - where the heart of all treatment is a strongly patient-centered, holistic and collaborative approach.
Olly specialises in gastroenterology including irritable bowel disease, liver disease, gastrointestinal oncology and surgery, and functional GI disorders, as well as general surgery, weight management, eating disorders and geriatric nutrition.
"How can I help?"
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Eating disorders, Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, Heart health & thoracic, IBD, IBS, Low FODMAP, Mental health, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Obesity, Oncology, Stroke, Weight loss, Menopause

name: Helen Hume
bio:
Helen has worked in all specialties of dietetics throughout her years as a private dietitian and in the NHS. Having led the dietetic service in a large foundation trust she fully understands the importance of nutrition in both health and illness.  Combined with a degree in sport science she has a very good understanding of how the body works, its requirements for function, how it interacts with the brain and the practicalities of our everyday lives and choices. She is passionate about educating on nutrition for health and function across all conditions and always with a focus on building a healthy relationship with food. More recently she has co-established Kent Family Medical, a medical clinic dedicated to collaborative and holistic care. Working with General Practitioners and other AHP’s to provide tailored and seamless healthcare and what is best for the individual.

Helen is also part of My Weight Clinic, having experienced the importance of varying strategies to success, she is working with a health coach.  This provides a dedicated weight management service across multiple platforms to ensure access and accountability for all clients.  Emphasising the importance of techniques that work for each individual.

To enable her to reach a wider audience and provide information on nutrition and health she delivers educational workshops and events to businesses keen on improving their wellbeing.

As a mum of 2 very active boys and 2 crazy dogs, Helen continues to work part time in the NHS, as well as privately, and fully understands the difficulties in managing our nutrition and health in a world full of mixed messages and with very limited time to focus on ourselves.

name: Dr Lina Johansson
bio:
Hello, I'm Lina and I am a co-founder of KidneyWise.
I am a clinical academic renal dietitian with over 20 years of experience, currently working at Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust. Seeing that “penny drop” moment when people with a kidney condition finally understand how to balance lifestyle with their health and watching their confidence grow is what I strive for.
I work with all people, in particular those who have stage 3 and stage 4 chronic kidney disease and want to do everything they can to help their health. I also work with people who are further along on their kidney journey on dialysis or who have a transplant.
I am passionate about research and was awarded my PhD (doctorate) from Imperial College London 12 years ago. I continue to do research alongside seeing clients privately and in the NHS.  
If you are interested to know more, please do visit our website www.kidneywise.co.uk
You can also book a free 15min enquiry call where we can discuss what you are looking for and how I might be able to help: https://l.bttr.to/vCDvM  
Alternatively, drop me a line at lina@kidneywise.co.uk
I look forward to discussing your needs.
Lina
clinical_expertise: Renal nutrition

name: Angela Coupe
bio:
Angela is a UK Senior Specialist Dietitian registered with the Health and Care Professions Council and member of the British Dietetic Association.

In 2002 Angela graduated with an honours degree in Biochemistry from The University of Leeds. Angela loved the health and nutrition aspects of her BSc and chose to further her studies with a post graduate diploma in Nutrition and Dietetics at Leeds Metropolitan University. Angela graduated and began working as a Dietitian in 2005. Her love of learning led her to complete a MSc in Nutrition and Dietetics with Distinction in 2008.

Angela is a passionate, highly skilled and knowledgeable Dietitian. She strives to provide evidenced based, practical and personalised advice. She loves to empower her clients to set and achieve sustainable goals to improve their overall long term health and well-being. Her clients would say this is provided in a professional yet friendly and supportive way.

Up until 2022 Angela led the service at Leeds teaching hospitals Trust in oesophagogastric dietetics for 10 years and prior to this held senior positions in head and neck oncology, colorectal surgery and gastroenterology. She has also worked in cardiology, neurology and elderly medicine.

Expertise:

Oesophageal and Gastric issues
Acid reflux or GERD
Dyspepsia
Dietary advice pre and post Oesophagectomy and Gastrectomy
Oncology support

Nutrition Support/Frailty
Food fortification strategies
Advice on nutritional support products
Texture modification

Gastrointestinal complaints
Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Crohn’s disease
Ulcerative Colitis
Diverticular Disease
Constipation
General improvement of gut health and microbiome.
Plant based eating

Cardioprotective diets
High Cholesterol
General improvement of heart health
Post cardiac events support
High Blood Pressure

Angela is also trained in behaviour change and can help to support you to make positive steps to overcome any barriers to change or negative relationships you may have with food.

As well as being a Dietitian Angela is also Mum to five wonderful children hence has a wealth of personal experience and professional advice around pre and post natal nutrition, breastfeeding, strategies for faddy eating and can help with generally improving healthy eating habits for the whole family. Angela is also interested in women's health issues particularly supporting women through the menopause.

Angela works locally at https://puretreatmentrooms.co.uk/ in Wetherby, West Yorkshire. She also offers online or telephone consultations.

To book a consultation or free 20 minute discovery call send an email to angelacoupenutrition@gmail.com

name: Emily Cooper
bio:
I am Emily Cooper, a registered dietitian and the founder of PowerThru Nutrition. 
I have experience working in the NHS, supporting the elderly population who are at risk of malnutrition and well as working with people who have suffered a stroke. I continue to work part time in the NHS. 
Outside of work, I compete in strongman/strongwomen competitions with my husband. This has lead me to starting PowerThru nutrition in able to support other strength sports athletes to fuel their training and elevate their performance through evidence based advice. I am currently undertaking a postgraduate course in Sports and Exercise nutrition.
clinical_expertise: Sports nutrition, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Cookery/ recipe development & analysis

name: Lydia Leighton
title: BSc (Hons)
bio:
I am passionate about food and improving lives through good nutrition and supporting a sensible and healthy relationship with what we eat. As a Dietitian I provide a balanced, expert approach to food and nutrition and I work creatively to provide practical dietary advice for real people to enjoy everyday life.

I have over 17 years’ experience, working within the NHS, in hospitals and in the local community, working alongside other health professionals to support adults and children as individuals and in groups.

I specialise in using behavioural change approaches to support people to manage their weight by guiding them to make the right dietary choices, correctly tailored to their individual lifestyle, nutrition and wellbeing.  I also support people with irritable bowel syndrome (Low FODMAP trained), women’s health (including pre-conception, pregnancy, polycystic ovarian syndrome, menopause), cholesterol lowering and heart health, weaning and fussy eating, plant-based diets and nutritional assessments.  Additionally, I enjoy delivering presentations and workshops on a range of healthy eating and lifestyle topics to suit the requirements of a particular group.

I am committed to helping people understand how the food they eat affects health and wellbeing.  Put simply, I help you to understand how your body responds to the food you eat by making nutritional science easy to understand.

name: Isabel Anderson
title: BSc, PGCert
bio:
Hi I'm Izzy,

I have been a Registered Dietitian since 2014. I work in the NHS as a Diabetes Dietitian and was previously a Renal Dietitian working with patients with kidney disease. I also have experience of treating IBS including using the low FODMAP diet.

I now also work as a freelance dietitian seeing patients with diabetes and chronic kidney disease but also focusing on my passion which is sports nutrition.  I have worked with clients looking at doing their first 10k right up to those training for an Ironman. I tailor the advice I give and how I provide it to the individual. I can provide a breakdown of the macros required on each of your training days or provide more general advice on when and what type of carbohydrates and protein should be eaten and if they need to be increased.

I am a keen runner and have also taken part in several triathlons. I have recently moved to Yorkshire, and I am very excited about getting out on the hills and trails. I also have experience of team sports as I used to regularly play netball and basketball.

I don't believe in quick fix diets and want to provide my clients with evidence-based knowledge and understanding so they can make long term lasting changes to their diet and get the best from their performance.
industry_services: Charitable sector, Event Management, Private practice, Apps, Writing, Writing and editing
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, Menopause, Renal nutrition, Sports nutrition, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Writing

name: Laura Hill
bio:
I’m Laura, a registered dietitian based near Winchester in Hampshire. I currently work in the NHS as a senior dietitian based at Winchester hospital, seeing both inpatients and outpatients with a wide variety of clinical conditions.
I also offer one-off sessions, or ongoing coaching if required, to help you achieve your nutrition goals, specifically in the following areas:
- Weight loss - helping you to cut through some of the social media noise to focus on evidenced-based strategies that can enable you to manage your weight healthily
- Weight gain - helping those with a low body weight to put on weight in a sustainable way and to maintain that in the longer term.
- Metabolic health - such as lipid lowering, high cholesterol, fatty liver disease and diabetes.
- Gut health - Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), diverticular disease, inflammatory bowel disease (such as Crohn’s and Ulcerative colitis) as well as supporting you with managing your diet if you have been diagnosed with coeliac disease.
- Cancer - I can advise on helping you to protect your muscle mass and maintain your weight as you go through treatment.
I don’t believe in fad diets or silver bullets; when it comes to nutrition, it's about building sustainable habits for the long term. This means I will talk to you about lots of different parts of your life that you might think aren’t connected with nutrition (but really are!) to help you make changes that you can adopt for good.
I love talking about food and helping people to improve their relationship with it, I also love supporting people to improve their health and by extension, their quality of life.
If you would like to find out more, please get in touch.
industry_services: Food, Private practice
clinical_expertise: Coaching/ mentoring, Gastroenterology, IBD, IBS, Heart health & thoracic, Low FODMAP, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Obesity, Oncology, Rehabilitation, Weight loss, Diabetes

name: Sarah Brown
title: BSc (Hons), Pg Dip
bio:
I'm Sarah Lindsay Brown a passionate registered dietitian and nutritionist, specialising in early years nutrition, specifically weaning and fussy eating. I have 18 years of varied experience covering NHS, industry, non-profit organisations and private practice. I'm also mummy to 2 girls. 
Getting little ones off to a good start is so important for shaping future eating habits and health in later life. I enjoy helping parents and carers teach their little ones to not only have a positive relationship with food but also to learn to love a balanced and varied diet and enjoy happy mealtimes.
I provide evidence-based, trustworthy, clear and balanced advice on nutrition to groups, individuals and companies in addition to writing articles and educational resources.
I offer webinars, workshops and 1 2 1 packages to parents, carers and nursery staff and all are accessible online.

name: Caroline Sonet
bio:
About me
Hello, my name is Caroline and I am a HCPC registered Dietitian. I trained in France, in Bordeaux University and worked in Ste Anne Hospital – Paris before moving to the UK and working both in community settings and mental health hospitals. I have over 15 year experience in the NHS and 4 year experience in private practice, working with adults and adolescents.
I specialize in eating disorders and disordered eating, supporting clients (and their families) with anorexia, bulimia, binge eating, ARFID, orthorexia, but also individuals with difficult relationships with food and their bodies. I am experienced working with neurodivergence and other comorbidities.
I promote a non diet, weight inclusive approach and believe in the ‘Health At Every Size’ ethos. I use CBT and mindfulness techniques and I am also trained in motivational interviewing and intuitive eating. I believe that food is just food, it should not be feared and I am passionate about helping my clients reaching their goals.
Email or call me to arrange a free 15-minute discovery call. It will give us an opportunity to discuss your goals and see how we can work together.
clinical_expertise: Eating disorders, Mental health, Coaching/ mentoring

name: Carole Sandhu
title: BSc(Hons) MSc
bio:
Specialist in women's health with over 25 years expertise. I help women with IBS and gut issues like bloating and urgency, manage their symptoms without having to avoid work, social events or exercise due to unpredictable flare-up's.
How can I help you:
I provide expert, evidence-based support in:
Gut and Digestive Health: Supporting conditions such as IBS, bloating and gut discomfort with tailored dietary strategies.
Weight Management: Achieve sustainable healthy weight goals with an approach that respects your body's unique needs.
Hormonal Health and Vitality: Address the challenges of midlife changes with tailored advice to support your overall vitality.
Sports Nutrition: Whether you a masters athlete or rediscovering your love for fitness, I'll help you fuel your body for peak performance.
Training, qualifications & experience
Registered Dietitian
Masters Degree in Sports Science
Mindful Eating Practitioner
Over 20 years of experience in Nutrition & Dietetics
clinical_expertise: IBS, Menopause, Nutrition for older people, Sports nutrition, Weight loss, Women's health

name: Cordula Henggeler
bio:
Specialist Dietitian in Women’s Health, Fertility, Gut Health, Thyroid Conditions and Complex Chronic Conditions
As a Registered Dietitian with 10 years of experience and a deeply compassionate approach, I support people of all genders to improve their health and feel better in their bodies.
My work centres on helping clients with conditions like PCOS, endometriosis, adenomyosis, Hypothalamic Amenorrhea, thyroid conditions (Graves' Disease and Hashimoto's), and a wide range of complex fertility challenges - including recurrent miscarriage, unexplained infertility, and male-factor infertility. I support individuals and couples at every stage of the fertility journey, whether you're trying to conceive naturally, going through IVF, or managing hormone-related conditions alongside fertility concerns.
I also work extensively with people experiencing gut issues, including IBS, bloating, food sensitivities, and other functional gastrointestinal disorders. I offer a non-restrictive, practical approach that focuses on improving symptoms while helping you build a nourishing, enjoyable relationship with food.
In addition, I work with clients navigating complex, long-term health conditions such as MCAS (Mast Cell Activation Syndrome) and long COVID. I understand how fluctuating energy, food sensitivities, and medical complexity impact everyday life. My approach is always empathetic, flexible, and led by you.
I bring additional lived experience to supporting clients with PCOS, IBS, Graves’ disease, and long COVID. Having personally navigated these conditions, I know how physically and emotionally exhausting they can be. This insight allows me to offer compassionate, realistic support that’s adaptable to the ups and downs of chronic health issues.
While weight loss may be part of your goals, it’s never the only focus—often not the primary one. My aim is to help you feel better in your body, improve symptoms, and build habits that last. I work collaboratively to create tailored, evidence-based plans that honour your lived experience, values, and long-term health.
I’m inclusive of all identities and work with people of all genders, including trans, non-binary, and cisgender clients. Together, we create personalised, evidence-based plans that support your goals, values, and lifestyle—because lasting change comes from working with your body, not against it.
If you wish to discuss this further, I offer free discovery calls which you can book here https://p.bttr.to/3mXWmas (feel free to contact me for additional availability).

For more information, visit my website, call me or send me an email to get in touch.

bio:
UK Private Dietitian & Gut Health Specialist. Personalised Nutrition for IBS, IBD, and other Digestive and Gastrointestinal Problems. Free Discovery Calls Available. Click here to book.
As a Specialist Gastroenterology Dietitian, I have extensive experience in digestive health, both in the NHS and private practice. I offer online video consultations for adults with digestive issues, and am fully trained in the low FODMAP diet and experienced in Crohn's disease dietary therapies.
I provide tailored plans for digestive conditions, with a particular focus on functional gastrointestinal disorders (gut-brain interactions) like Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), and Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) including Crohn's Disease and Ulcerative Colitis. You can find out more about the services I offer here or alternatively, you can find more information on my blog.
Whether you’re managing a digestive disorder or want to boost your overall health with a gut-focused approach, I will provide clear, supportive, and expert dietary guidance. My aim is to empower you to reach your nutrition and health goals with individualised support. Ready to start? Book a FREE Discovery Call with me today.

name: Symone Genovezos
bio:
Symone is an accomplished Registered Dietitian with 15 years’ experience within the private and public sector. Specialising in bespoke dietary treatment for a range of conditions including diabetes and blood sugar disorders, cardiovascular disease, thyroid health, irritable bowel syndrome, sustainable weight loss solutions and mental health and mood disorders.

Supported by a committed focus on gut health and the role of the microbiome in the prevention and management of chronic conditions, the foundational cornerstone of Symone’s practice is a compassionate, holistic and user-friendly methodology which gives clients the requisite self- confidence to make sustainable improvements to their everyday and long-term health.

Symone works on the philosophy that food and health is universal, yet what works for any one of us can be unique to every one of us. She is truly passionate about supporting individuals in navigating their relationship with food and their journey towards optimal health. Her broad client base includes high profile celebrities and disadvantaged clients alike, and in goes spanning the UK, Europe and the Middle East.



“Health is the physical and mental relationship we have with ourselves, and food as a source of nutrition as well as pleasure is a vital part of it” – Symone



Symone is registered with the British Dietetic Association and the HCPC

name: Rebecca Hastings
bio:
Looking to break away from shame and fear with food and body, transform compulsive eating, or find relief from digestive discomfort?
Hi,
I'm Rebecca, a dietitian specialising in intuitive eating, body image, mindfulness and gut health (IBS).
I offer an, embodied, compassionate and trauma sensitive approach to finding peace with food and self. Here are some ways I can help:
Intuitive Eating: This is a holistic and evidence based framework that helps people to break free of diet culture, of bouncing between restrictive and binge eating, of viewing body weight as a dominant marker of health and happiness.
Instead I help to empower people to cultivate body appreciation, develop self- awareness, compassion and maybe even self-love. I work with people to better navigate their emotional landscape, build trust in themselves and their body and to recognise internal signals such as hunger and fullness. We work not just to repair their relationship with food but also with self and others too.
Gut Health (IBS): I help people who have 'functional gut disorders' such as Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) to find relief from symptoms. My approach involves recognising the possible root causes of the condition and symptoms, and addressing these to find long lasting peace.
While it is possible to find some relief through short-term elimination diets, they are often not appropriate and may ultimately worsen a person's condition or relationship with food. Instead I spend most of my time supporting people through a multi-dimensional approach that covers:
- Gentle Nutrition
- Mind
- Embodiment
- Rest
A little more about me:
I am LGBTQIA+ and neurodiversity affirmative in my work and aim to support inclusivity. I aim to work both with cognitive (mind) and somatic (body) based therapeutic models targeting the root cause of problems and supporting long lasting change.
You can find more detailed information on my website www.harmonisehealth.com

BDA registered dietitian and Psychology degree. Completed my dietetic degree in South Africa. 4 + years of experience in clinical and private settings.

I am a mom to two happy energetic boys who keep me on my toes constantly. On weekends, I enjoy spending time with my husband, boys and dog- doing anything outside on our bikes/walking or playing board games.

name: Saira Khan
bio:
I am a registered dietitian with over 10 years of experience in a senior position within the NHS.
I’m passionate about nutrition and the science behind it and could talk about it all day! There are many mixed messages about nutrition, more so in recent years causing much confusion. As a dietitian, I am well placed to help you decipher the media information into factual evidence based advice. This is in a practical and tailored way to suit you.
I consider myself to be a friendly, empathetic and non-judgmental. I’m fascinated by the psychology of behaviour and believe we can all make positive changes that will ultimately help us live longer healthier lives.
I see a range of clients who may all have different needs. What may be considered ‘healthy’ for one person, may vary for the next depending on symptoms. My areas of particular interest is Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) which may include abdominal pain, wind, bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.

Below is a more comprehensive list and I am happy to discuss anything else.

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Low FODMAP diet
Diabetes
Heart health
High cholesterol
Coeliac disease (gluten intolerance)
Weight loss or gain
Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
Food intolerance’s
General healthy eating advice
Feel free to look at my website for further information.

name: Fiona Hamlin
contact_address: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear United Kingdom
bio:
Hello. My name is Fiona.
I am a qualified HCPC Registered Advanced Dietitian and have worked in clinical settings for over 13 years now. I currently hold a position as an Advanced Dietitian within a North East NHS Mental Health Trust.  I have taken a role in setting up eating disorder services in the North East. I work with with a range of conditions including eating disorders (disordered eating, food phobias, anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge eating disorder, ARFID, diabulimia), ASD related dietary needs, ADHD, weight management, malnutrition related conditions, digestive issues including irritable bowel syndrome, type 2 diabetes and menopause.  
My passion is to support clients in achieving a more peaceful, free relationship with food. You are the expert in you. I see myself as a dolphin, swimming alongside, supporting and guiding you through your journey to health. As an advocate of evidence-based science, I will serve as an important resource of nutrition knowledge and will be working collaboratively with the yourself (and family/partner if preferred).
My philosophy is to provide nutritional advice that is based on sound science, practical and realistic to help clients meet their own health goals.
I offer a ten minute discovery call as an opportunity for you to explore what support could be offered and any questions you might have before proceeding.
Do contact me on 07743546990 or at fionahamlin.dietitian@gmail.com
For more information about my services, please take a look at my website. https://www.fionahamlin.co.uk. I look forward to hearing from you.
For further details on my qualifications...
• HCPC Registered Advanced Dietitian with2:1 BSc Nutrition and Dietetics at Kings College London
• Masters Module in Eating Disorders at Leeds Beckett University
• Trained in National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) recommended Maudsley Anorexia Nervosa Treatment for Adults (MANTRA) and Specialist Supportive Clinical Management (SSCM).
• ARFID trained through Winchester University.
• Trained in Motivational Interviewing and Behaviour Change.

name: Angeliki Tarsani
title: BSc, PGCert, RD
bio:
My name is Angeliki Tarsani, and I am a Dietitian (RD) – Nutritionist specializing in Eating Disorders and Obesity, as well as Mental Health and Clinical Nutrition. I mainly provide my services online, via e-conferencing platforms.
My working ethos and approach are to always keep your physical and mental health front of mind. Through a journey of consultation, nutritional counselling, and encouragement of dietary changes, my goal is to ‘teach’ you how to feed and nourish yourself well, so that both your physical health and mental wellbeing are elevated.
My mantra is ‘nourish your body and soul well for a better life’! I do believe that as we feed, nourish, and take good care of ourselves, our day-to-day life turns into something amazing, full of good health and vigour. So, focus on what you consume today so that tomorrow gets you the best you deserve!
I am passionate about what I do, about my job. But above all I am passionate about watching you progress and succeed.
Please visit my website for more information about me or to arrange a free discovery call.

name: Fay Kaina
bio:
I have been a HCPC registered dietitian since 2012 and have worked in several clinical roles, providing me with a breadth of knowledge and experience in delivering nutritional care.

I endeavour to continuously learn and develop as a dietitian and have completed several courses and Masters's modules to support my practice. My areas of interest & expertise include management of IBS and gut related disorders and I have completed both the British Dietetic Association and King’s College London low FODMAP diet and IBS management courses. I also specialise inwomen's health and sports nutrition.
Sport has always been a significant part of my life and I am fortunate enough to also incorporate this into my professional work. Having completed the post graduate certification in sports and exercise nutrition, I am able to offer tailored nutritional support to athletes in a range of sports. My particular area of interest being endurance sport, additionally for those who may experience health conditions or gut issues alongside.

I believe in practicing with passion, care and empathy and seek to gain a deep understanding of the factors which underpin health, illness and nutrition. I seek to work collaboratively and with specialist knowledge and skills to help and empower people to achieve their goals and manage their conditions.
The areas I can help with include:
- Irritable Bowel Syndrome
- Gut related disorders including gastro-oesophageal reflux disease, functional dyspepsia, dysmotility and constipation
- Gut and bowel surgery
- Women’s health through the lifespan – including polycystic ovary syndrome, endometriosis and menopause
- Optimisation of nutrition for sports performance 
In addition to individual consultations, I also deliver group sessions and have a keen interest in nutrition related health writing.

name: Sarah Morton
title: BSc. MSc. PgDIP
bio:
I am a HCPC registered Dietitian with almost 14 years experience of various specialisms.  I primarily see clients with eating disorders having worked within specialist teams supporting both young people and adults.  I also have a huge amount of experience working with clients experiencing binge eating disorder.
From personal experience I have a strong interest in female life-stage nutrition including fertility nutrition, management of PCOS, peri and menopausal nutrition.  
I have received additional training in the implementation of a low FODMAP diet for IBS from King's college London and use this extensively in my practice. 
I have advanced training in motivational interviewing, behaviour change techniques, FT-AN for adolescent ED young people, CRT and introductions to CBT / DBT and CFT.  
I also offer manualised guided self help input (which is first line recommended for binge eating disorder and bulimia nervosa [NICE]).   
I enjoy teaching and I am a facilitator on the Two Day BDA Advanced Dietetics Course for Eating Disorders training - designed to upskill dietitians new to the area of eating disorders.
********************************
There is a lot to digest (pun intended) so free discovery calls are available at no cost or obligation.

name: Emily Reilly
title: MNutr
bio:
About me
Hi, I’m Emily! I am an experienced Registered Dietitian, passionate about supporting my clients in improving their health through the power of nutrition. I founded a leading private practice based in central London where I work with my patients to translate cutting-edge nutritional research into tailored, practical, and inspiring personalised coaching.
I am qualified and experienced in working with clients seeking to understand how to eat for optimal health, including if you need help with a health condition. I am privileged to have had over 10 years of clinical experience within both the NHS and private healthcare settings and love to bring this knowledge to my coaching sessions.
Training, qualifications & experience
I completed my Master's in Nutrition and Dietetics at The University of Nottingham. Later, I pursued further studies in digestive health at King's College London and received training in the Low FODMAPs Diet, a gold standard treatment for IBS and other gut conditions. Over my career, I have also been privileged to support thousands of patients with sports and performance, as well as weight loss and weight gain goals.
Currently, I am the Nutrition Lead at a prestigious private hospital, which is a Centre for Excellence in Women's Health, Fertility, IVF and Digestive Health.
I work within a network of world-leading consultants and surgeons in gynaecology, gastroenterology, and fertility treatment, supporting my patients in accessing an expert medical team for tests and treatments.

name: Sophie Corbett
bio:
Sophie is an experienced Eating Disorder and Mental Health Dietitian. She currently sees teen and adult clients with eating disorders or disordered eating. Her areas of special interest within this area are vegan diets in recovery and body image concerns. She has experience working in the NHS and private practice.
Sophie takes a modern, non-diet and weight-inclusive approach and has gained additional training in therapy methods, ARFID and body image work. She continues to stay up to date with the latest scientific evidence and gain additional qualifications and loves to form great therapeutic relationships with her clients.
Sophie is the founder of Mental Health Dietitians, a specialised team of Eating Disorder and Mental Health dietitians. On the website you can find regular blogs on relevant topics and sign up to a weekly newsletter.
Sophie creates content on social media to combat nutrition misinformation. You can find her on Instagram and Tiktok @cornonthecorb.

I’ve had valuable experience supporting clients with IBS, cancer, weight management, and building healthier lifestyles. Being fluent in English, French, and Arabic allows me to connect with a diverse range of people and offer more personalised care.
I’m committed to evidence-based advice, and want to help people make sustainable, lasting changes to their health. Feel free to get in touch with any queries.

name: Katie Digby

Katie is a Registered Dietitian, keen to support you to feel your best through optimal nutrition. Katie promotes evidence based advice with a realistic and personalised approach to help you to reach your health goals.
Katie has a vast range of experience supporting clients with digestive issues, coeliac disease, IBS, food allergies, diabetes, weight (struggling to lose or gain weight), nutritional deficiencies and paediatrics (faltering growth, allergies, selective/fussy eating).

Katie is a full member of the British Dietetic Association and Freelance Dietitians Specialist Group and is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council. Katie also has specialist low FODMAP diet training.

name: Joanna Tsintaris
title: MSc, RD HCPC, BMedSc Hons
bio:
Joanna is a HCPC registered Dietitian and a Biomedical Science graduate with a first-class MSc in Nutrition and Dietetics. She has a strong scientific background and a passion for evidence-based research and practice. She has experience working as a Dietitian for the weight management and Type 2 diabetes prevention service at the NHS and private sector in digital health.
Joanna inspires and empowers her clients to make positive lifestyle changes to manage their weight and health conditions such as pre-diabetes, Type 2 Diabetes, PCOS, dyslipidaemia, fatty liver disease, hypertension, underactive thyroidism etc. She also has clinical experience supporting clients to build a healthier relationship with food to manage emotional eating & disordered eating. She offers compassionate and person-centred care which challenges weight stigma and rejects diet culture.

Joanna takes pride in practising with a holistic outlook, focusing on nutrition as well as movement, sleep cycles and stress management to support her clients in living their healthiest and happiest lives.

She is half Scottish half Greek, and before she moved to Scotland she was raised on a Greek island called Crete which makes her familiar with the Cretan Mediterranean diet which has been shown to be probably the most representative of all Mediterranean diets for heart health. So if this is an eating pattern you would like to adopt she can also help!
Qualifications:
BSc Biomedical Sciences
MSc in Nutrition and Dietetics
Certificate in Health Behaviour Change

Registrations:
The Health and Care Professions Council
Member of the British Dietetic Association
Member of the BDA Specialist Interest Groups: Freelance Dietitians

This list is not exhaustive so if you want to explore whether I can help, contact me by email to book in for a free 15 minute discovery call. There are no expectations or pressure to book, we can have a chat and see if working together is the right next step for you.

I help give clarity, to people with diabetes (Type1 ,Type 2, Gestational), about what they can eat, in order to achieve their target blood sugar levels and live life to the fullest.

name: Anna Pettit
bio:
Anna Pettit is a registered dietitian for both adults and kids with 16 years of clinical expertise spanning a wide range of conditions, including food allergies and intolerances, IBS, Coeliac disease and other digestive disorders. She is a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA) and the British Society for Allergy and Clinical Immunology (BSACI) and works in a highly successful NHS allergy department in London as well as the private sector and Allergy UK.
Anna is known for her empathetic and client-centered care and combines evidence-based practice with a holistic approach, tailoring her recommendations to meet the unique needs of each child and the wider family.
Apart from her work directly with clients, Anna is also an avid educator on the topics of gut health and food allergy, runs support groups and enjoys writing for blogs and magazines.

name: Siobhan O'Brien
bio:
Hello, my name is Siobhan O’Brien and I have 27 years’ experience working across the NHS and freelance dietetics (part of the SunlightNutrition team). I am passionate about food and nutrition and its effect on our health, our wellbeing, and its role in sports performance. I aim to support individuals achieve and maintain good relationships with food.
 
I am experienced working in many settings, including wardwork, outpatients, home visits and as part of multidisciplinary teams. My areas of expertise include diabetes (clinical lead diabetes specialist in a large teaching hospital and DAFNE trained), women’s health and menopause (group and individual work, webinars for workplaces), weight management, nutrition support (published in medical journals) and I am a qualified sports nutritionist. I believe in keeping active and want to support others in achieving these goals, whether your goal is to walk for 30 mins without getting out of breath or to complete an ultramarathon or full Ironman (personally completed in 2018 and 2017 respectively). I provide nutrition support for people incorporating resistance training, whether that is to help combat the effect of menopause, aging, or to compete in strongman competitions.

Alongside my clinical work, I facilitate on behaviour change training for health care professionals. I always put the person at the centre of any dietetic intervention and would be happy to help you to set clear, achievable goals and support you working towards them.

name: Claudia Ehrlicher
bio:
Claudia is a dedicated Dietitian with a passion for food and teaching and motivating people to lead a healthy life, always taking into account their individual needs and circumstances. She has many years of experience in helping people with the challenges confronted when changing lifestyle and eating behaviour and adapting to new dietary requirements. Claudia is registered with the HCPC, BDA, the Freelance Dietitians Group and Coeliac UK. 
After relocating to London in 2010, she started her own private dietetic practice and had clinics in different locations in London (Wood Green, Harley Street, Crouch End). However, with the start of the pandemic in 2020, Claudia moved her practice mostly online and it has turned out to be a wise decision. Instead of only working with clients in the London area, she is now able to serve clients all over the UK. Face-to-face appointments or home visits are also available in the Eastbourne / East Sussex area.
Originally from Germany and a trained Chef, Claudia graduated as a Dietitian from Marienhospital Stuttgart and the University of Tuebingen in Germany. Claudia worked for nearly 10 years as a Dietitian and Head of Department Nutrition and Dietetics at Klinik Schloss Mammern in Switzerland, a private hospital and one of the Swiss Leading Hospitals. She constantly keeps up to date with the developments in Nutrition and Dietetics to offer her clients the latest evidence-based knowledge. Claudia has been contributing to TV shows and magazines and was honored with an award as a distinguished Dietitian in conjunction with the World Health Day 2013.

name: Jacqueline Galanty
bio:
I'm Jackie, an HCPC Registered Advanced Specialist Dietitian and founder of Nutritional, a private nutrition clinic.
I gained experience in acute London hospitals before moving into Mental Health and Eating Disorders Services. I have experience in working with clients of all ages, within NHS and private mental health services.
I have worked in several inpatient CAMHS and Eating Disorder Units in South West London and also with adult outpatient services. I now predominantly work with private clients of all ages supporting a range of eating challenges.
At Nutritional we use a collaborative approach, taking time to understand your individual needs and lifestyle, encouraging a place for all foods without stigma and using behaviour change approaches to create lasting habits that support physical and mental health.
When working with children and adolescents we take a whole family approach, working with parents as well as children and adolescents. If necessary we will liaise with private, state schools and Universities to tackle food-related issues with positive, practical and achievable plans that promote both physical and mental health.
I offer predominantly online sessions and some in person appointments in Surrey and Central London.
I have a first class degree in Nutrition and Dietetics from King's College, London and a previous degree in Psychology, guiding the development of supportive relationship with clients to form new long-lasting nutrition habits.

Specialist areas include:

Experience working with children, adolescents and adults
Recovery focussed individual sessions for Disordered Eating, Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, Binge Eating Disorder, ARFID.
Online programmes and tailored services for nutrition in ADHD
Experience in supporting complex food challenges associated with neurodiversity (ADHD, Autism, Sensory Processing Differences) and additional mental health conditions such as OCD, depression and anxiety.
Support for parents
General advice nutrition to support physical & mental health
Gastrointestinal issues such as reflux, constipation, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Weight and dieting concerns
Maternal mental health

name: Laura Vincent
bio:
I’m Laura, a UK Registered Dietitian, and founder of Nurture for Life Nutrition, an online dietetic practice specialising in endometriosis, PCOS and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
Over the past 15 years I have helped hundreds of women, like you, to optimise their health through personalised, evidence-based nutrition and lifestyle coaching.
As a combined women's health and FODMAP-trained dietitian, and having endometriosis and IBS myself, I've been there and I know how challenging it can be to manage a chronic condition. Finding the best approach to alleviate your symptoms can be overwhelming, especially when there's so much misinformation available.
Whether you've just been diagnosed or have been struggling to manage either endo, PCOS, and/or IBS for a while, you've come to the right place. While all three conditions share some common symptoms, they all require a personalised treatment approach.
I believe that everyone is unique, with their own needs and challenges. I take the time to listen to you, get to know your health history, and your symptoms, and understand your specific needs. From here we can work together on a personalised program which is built on evidence-based nutrition advice that you can trust and will make you feel your best.
My goal is to support you on your journey, and help you to make sense of your symptoms so that you can regain control of your body. My passion lies in focusing on encouraging a place for all foods and using sustainable and flexible approaches. I help you to manage your endo, PCOS, and/or IBS without the need for strict, unbalanced, restrictive diets.
My services are provided via secure telehealth online.
Not sure where to start? - Book your FREE virtual 20-minute Discovery Consultation. This gives us a chance to meet and get to know each other, for you to tell me a bit about what is going on in your life, and to decide if I'm the right person to help you on your journey. This can be booked here and you can also contact me via my website, so please take a look and drop me a message, I'd love to chat!
I look forward to supporting you on your nourishing health journey.
Best wishes,
Laura

name: Annina Roseby
bio:
Annina is a senior specialist paediatric dietitian, working both in private practice and within the NHS. Having worked at a London tertiary hospital, she has extensive clinical experience across multiple paediatric specialties including neonatal nutrition, gastrointestinal disorders and diabetes.
Annina is driven by translating nutritional science to support patients and their families optimise nutritional intake for age-appropriate growth, alongside management of clinical conditions. In addition to her NHS work, Annina is a freelance health writer and has written for various platforms including evidence-based articles for trade publications, website content and patient literature. 
Annina holds a clinic at a location in Aylsham, Norfolk. Please do get in touch if you would benefit from further support.

name: Maria Kolotourou
bio:
Hi there,
I’m Maria Kolotourou, a registered dietitian with over 20 years of experience. Based in the UK, I offer online nutrition services for anyone looking to take their nutrition to the next level, optimise their intake, and support their overall wellbeing.
My approach is holistic, rooted in the deep connection between body and mind. I believe that truly caring for ourselves begins with reconnecting to our bodies -carefully listening and understanding its real needs. Nutrition plays a vital role in this process, not just as a source of energy, but as a powerful tool for self-care, balance, and overall wellbeing.
My philosophy is based on the principles of Intuitive Eating and the Mediterranean Diet. I have a special interest in women’s nutrition across life stages, and through my many years of experience, I’ve developed expertise in supporting people struggling with chronic dieting and emotional eating.
Together, we will work on this journey of reconnection, helping you meet your nutritional needs, enjoy food without guilt, and find the weight that’s right for your body.
If you’re ready to shift your mindset around food and reconnect with your body in a kinder, more compassionate way… welcome aboard!
