name: Marialice Albertini
bio:
I am a HCPC and BDA registered dietitian, with over 10 years clinical dietetic experience in the NHS (both in the community and hospital setting) and in the private sector.
Alongside my NHS work as a primary care dietitian in Kingston Upon Thames , I offer private dietetic consultations, either remotely, or in-person at the Health Village Esher, Surrey.
I specialise in a range of gut conditions including irritable bowel syndrome, diverticular disease, bile acid malabsorption, liver disease, lactose intolerance and coeliac disease. Other areas of expertise include diabetes, weight managament, malnutrition and women's health.
Please contact me to arrange a free, no-obligation, 15 minute consultation. This will give us the chance to identify your health needs and discuss how I can support you. My approach is holistic, compassionate and always tailored to the individual I work with. 
To find out more about my services, visit my website www.alicedietitian.com
Qualifications and Training
BSc (Hons) Dietetics and Nutrition (first class honours). London Metropolitan University, London, UK.
DESMOND Educator - Leicester Diabetes Centre - Leicester, UK.
Dietary Management & the Low FODMAP Diet in IBS – Advanced course Kings College Hospital – London, UK.
IBD Training - Kings College – London, UK.
Registered with the Health Care Professionals Council (registration number DT28653).
Member of The British Dietetic Association (BDA).
Member of the Gastroenterology, First Contact, Freelance and Autism Subgroups.

title: BSc (Hons)
bio:
I am a qualified dietitian and registered with HCPC (Health and Care Professionals Council) and BDA (The Association of UK Dietitians). As a mother of three I have over 20 years of personal experience of feeding a family from weaning with allergies to teenage anxiety induced IBS. I have also received additional BDA training in Nutritional Management in Pregnancy.
I particularly enjoy working together with families, helping them to meet everyone’s different needs in a very practical way. I am available to help in any way you would find helpful, from observing family mealtimes (your very own “Super Nanny”!) to taking you on a supermarket shop.
Outside of my private work I work with Active Surrey on their “Be Your Best” course for families who have weight management issues, I also go into local schools to speak to parents on picky eating.
I offer FREE discovery calls if you would like to find out more and if I am able to help you.

name: Makheale Mabindisa
bio:
Profile
My name is Shirley Mabindisa I am your Dietitian and founder of MSM Nutrition Consultancy LTD.
My passion is to improve your quality of life through diet. I am friendly, compassionate and I believe in a person-centred approach when it comes to dietary counselling. I am confident that I can empower you to take charge of your diet and health despite of your health condition and life stage.
I am registered with the Health and Care Professions Council and am also a full member of the British dietetic association.
I graduated from the University of Limpopo, South Africa in 2006 with a Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition. I spent two years working in Cape Town as a registered Dietitian and moved to the UK in 2009 and have since been working in the NHS in a variety of clinical roles including, diabetes, care of the elderly, cardiac rehabilitation, HIV, nutrition support, critical care and mental health. I spent the last ten years working in both the NHS and private hospitals across London. I am trained in the dietary management of just about every avenue of nutrition including food allergies and intolerances, renal disease, Gastrointestinal disorders such as Crohn’s, colitis and Irritable Bowel Syndrome and based on my strong clinical experience, there is really no type of nutrition need I cannot service.
My practice is based in FrimIey Road, Camberley in Surrey. I am currently accepting new patients for one to one nutritional counselling as well as family sessions and I also offer skype and telephone review consultations.

name: Bianca Parau
bio: Bianca is a Registered Dietitian specialising in paediatric nutrition. She obtained her BSc. Human Nutrition and Dietetics (Hons) in 2005 at the University of the Free State in South-Africa and in 2017 her PGDip (Nutritional Medicine) at the University of Surrey. With more than 16 years’ experience, Bianca is passionate about helping children of all ages develop a healthy attitude towards food whilst meeting their nutritional requirements to sustain optimal growth and development. Since relocating to the United Kingdom, Bianca has worked at various top NHS hospitals as well as private health centres across the country. In addition to her current NHS post Bianca has a busy private practice, specialising in food allergies, gastrointestinal conditions, feeding difficulties, tube weaning, chronic conditions and overall growth optimisation for all children up to 16 years of age. She also does consultancy work for various companies, she is a medico-legal nutrition expert and she writes peer reviews as well as articles for various publications. She works closely with Paediatricians, Paediatric Allergists, Paediatric Gastroenterologists and various paediatric Allied Health Professionals to provide comprehensive multidisciplinary evidence based treatments.

bio:
I'm an award-winning Advanced Practice Gastroenterology Dietitian who is passionate about helping clients manage their diet in relation to their gastrointestinal disorders to help clients feel well and be well. With nearly a decade of experience in the field I bring a wealth of knowledge and expertise to my practice.
Areas of specialism include;
- IBS
- IBD
- Coeliac disease
- Nutrition support
- Liver disease
- Pancreatic exocrine insufficiency
- Bile acid malabsorption
- Bowel dysfunction
- Reflux
- Eosinophilic oesophagitis
I provide a personalised approach to wellness taking into consideration the unique challenges faced by individuals with gastrointestinal disorders and work closely with them to develop customised nutrition plans that address their specific needs. Whether it's managing symptoms, improving digestion, or achieving optimal gut health, I'm committed to helping clients achieve their goals.
As an advocate for evidence-based practice, I always stay up-to-date with the latest research and treatment strategies in gastroenterology. I'm committed to ongoing professional development to ensure that I provide the most current and effective guidance to clients. With my guidance and support, clients can expect a compassionate and empowering experience on their journey to improved digestive health.
If you're looking for a knowledgeable and compassionate Dietitian who specialises in gastrointestinal disorders, I'm here to help. Please get in touch!
Email: info@christinethegastrodietitian.com
Book your free 15min discovery call now: https://calendly.com/christinethegastrodietitian-info/15mins

name: Laura Clark
contact_address: COMBE DOWN, COMBE DOWN United Kingdom
company_name: Laura Clark Nutrition & The Menopause Dietitian
bio:
Do you feel overwhelmed with information, but lacking in clarity as to what is right for you and your body? My ethos is to be realistic and down to earth and cut through the confusion so you gain insight, with advice that’s tailored to your day to day life. No gimmicks, no fad diets, just an holistic approach, grounded in science, to empower you. How does that sound?

I have over 20 years of experience as a registered dietitian, in the NHS, healthcare services abroad, and in the commercial sector which have given me the opportunity to work with thousands of individuals, allowing a unique depth of understanding into the challenges many people face when exploring changes to their diet and lifestyle.

My post-graduate training in many aspects, including Behaviour Change Therapy, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy and Intuitive Eating, facilitate us to consider all that influences your food choices, to enable you to develop a much happier, healthier relationship with food.

Free discovery calls are available to book. I typically see women in their mid-life experiencing perimenopause and juggling other factors such as a challenging food relationship, chronic dieting syndrome, PCOS or gut health issues. More information at www.themenopausedietitian.co.uk as well as details below.

I am passionate about cutting through the often confusing arena of nutrition, and frequently contribute to main stream press and media. I have appeared on the BBC and ITV a number of times and many radio stations.

I also deliver workplace health and well-being seminars and also support brands with PR campaigns and their nutrition content/ messaging.

Lots more information on my website so please take or look or drop me an email.

name: Marie Skerry
company_name: Marie Skerry Avanti Nutrition and Dietetic Services
bio:
I am an experienced Dietitian with nearly 25 years post graduate practice. I have extensive experience across a wide range of dietetic areas with particular skills in diabetes, heart health, allergy, malnutrition and elderly care including dementia.

I am a good listener and will help you understand how diet could improve your health and wellbeing and keep you healthy in the future. I can give you practical advice, based on evidence, to help you keep your diet balanced while making adjustments to achieve any health related goals you have.

Since 2014, I have worked freelance seeing patients with a range of conditions and helping them understand how to improve their nutrition and health. I work regularly for a group of Dementia Specialist Nursing homes, in primary care supporting a GP practice with their patients in care homes and as a Community Paediatric Dietitian for the NHS.

I began my career working in a large teaching hospital where my work included general medicine, general surgery, oesophageal surgery, elderly care, orthopaedics, dermatology, stroke, heart health and gastrointestinal conditions.

I specialised in diabetes, working for several years as a Diabetes Specialist Dietitian before working as a community dietitian, covering general clinics, home visits, diabetes and rehabilitation services. While in this role I developed specialist skills in the identification and treatment of malnutrition and its consequences, particularly in elderly care.

I now enjoy working Freelance, supporting Nursing Homes with their nutrition practices, working with individuals to improve their health through diet and seeing children and their carers’ with allergies and weight concerns.

name: Ravneet Oberai
bio:
I'm Ravneet, a registered dietitian and founder of Nutrition with Ravneet.

I qualified in 2016 with a first class degree from King's College London in Nutrition and Dietetics (BSc). I am a member of the British Dietetics association and registered with the Health and Care Professions Council.
My years in the NHS and private practice have allowed me to gain experience in a range of fields including oral nutritional support, weight management, gastroenterology, surgery and respiratory conditions.

I have specialised in nutrition support in cancer with a particular focus on those with gastroenterological cancers. This includes helping people to gain weight during struggles with treatment, lose weight in preparation for surgery and also to modify their diet in relation to side effects they may be experiencing from treatment. Educating and advising on the impact food can have in relation to your condition can have a significant influence on your overall quality of life and it is incredibly satisfying to watch those thrive with the right information to empower them.

If you would like to chat about whether I can support you, please do not hesitate to book a free, no obligation, 10 minute discovery call through my website. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Caroline Hill
bio:
Hello,
I'm Caroline, a HCPC (Health & Care Professions Council) registered dietitian with over 17 years experience supporting individual private clients and nutrition consultancy services to the food and medical nutrition industry. Following a successful career in the NHS and the medical nutrition industry, gaining valuable clinical and industry experience, Caroline Hill Nutrition was founded in 2018.
Dietitians are the only nutrition professionals to be regulated by law, and are governed by an ethical code to ensure that they always work to the highest standard. I use the latest scientific evidence to support individual private clients for a wide range of clinical conditions, including:
- women's health including menopause
- gut health
- weight management
As an expert freelance dietitian specialising in menopause, I am dedicated to guiding women through this transformative phase with tailored nutrition strategies and support. I understand the unique nutritional needs and challenges that accompany menopause, thereby providing personalised support to help women navigate this transition smoothly while optimising their well-being. I offer comprehensive support tailored to your unique needs and goals. Whether you are experiencing bothersome symptoms such as hot flushes, weight gain, mood swings, or seeking to optimise your health during this transition, I am here to provide expert guidance and practical solutions.
Book a free 15 minute call with me here or visit my website to learn more (www.carolinehillnutrition.co.uk)
Are you a business looking for consultancy services? Using my previous experience as a medical affairs dietitian I can support businesses in the food and nutrition industry with the following:
- educational content creation

Please visit my website and contact me to see how I can help you (carolinehillnutrition.co.uk)

name: Emma Townsin
title: MSc (honours)
bio:
Support for binge eating, emotional eating, yo-yo dieting and general food stress to stop obsessing over food and bring joy back to food.

This is for you if:
- You can't stop thinking about food ALL THE TIME and it's getting draining
- You try so hard to eat healthy but have moments where you feel OUT OF CONTROL around food
- You jump between diets and meal plans but nothing really sticks
- You worry if you eat when you are hungy you will NEVER STOP EATING
- You're just done with feeling OBSESSED WITH FOOD

This is NOT a diet or meal plan. 
Instead you are supported to:
- Using CBT (cognitive behavioural therapy) you naturally shift your thoughts so food is not on your mind ALL THE TIME
- Using mindfulness techniques you develop connection with your body's innate hunger and fullness so healthy eating comes naturally
- Learn the types of foods your body needs to feel truly satisfied so out-of-control emotional eating and binge eating will ease
- Understand your nervous system (stress and emotion) and recognise what emotions you are feeling so food can be comforting but you are also able to cope without food
- Eat food that provides your body the nutrition it needs as well as joy, comfort, pleasure, culture, memories and social experiences.

My background: I am a Specialist Eating Disorder Registered Dietitian and a Certified Intuitive Eating Counsellor

How you are supported to joyful eating
"Stop Obsessing Over Food" 1-to-1 private counselling programmes
Stop binge eating, stress eating and emotional eating online course
Learn more: www.foodlifefreedom.com (free discovery call available)
Or check out my Podcast and other FREE STUFF to get started

name: Lesley Reid
bio:
I am very lucky I LOVE being a Dietitian, it is one of the most diverse, interesting and satisfying jobs. I get to work with such a wide range of clients from home visits with chronic conditions to children with fussy eating habits. Lecturing to working with companies on healthy working lives, no two days are the same.
I work with many nutritional problems including IBS, IBD, Nutritional Support, Obesity, weight management, weight loss surgery, diabetes & heart disease.
I also offer nutritional advice and support with fussy eaters (children and adults), sports nutrition, preconception, pregnancy, breastfeeding, healthy eating/ living and nutritional assessment.
My specialist area of interest is IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome).  This is such a multilayer complicated condition which I love supporting clients with.  This involves mapping the clients symptoms, diet, stress, sleep, gut health, hydration, likes & dislikes to figure out the best plan for them.
I also provide training for schools, nurseries, care or nursing homes. I have also delivered training on behalf of the BDA and Strathclyde University.
I work with private companies advising on nutrition in the work place and help them work toward health living awards. I also worked for 2 years with a medical weight loss company supporting there clients with there nutritional needs.
I have a Bsc (Hons) in Nutrition and Dietetics from Glasgow Caledonian University, HCPC registered dietitian and active member of the BDA.
Recent qualifications include:
Counterweight and Counterweight Plus training
Qualification from Kings College London in Low Fodmap diet in Functional gastrointestinal disorders.
BDA Professional development award in Behavioural Change
Certificate in Sports Nutrition

I am a registered dietitian who specialises in weight management, type 2 diabetes and restoring intuitive and natural eating patterns.
I take a holistic approach to my care and promote overall wellbeing and health through nutrition, exercise coaching and stress management.

name: Briony Caffrey
company_name: Briony Caffrey; Learning Disability Specialist Dietitian; Consultancy, Assessment, Supervision, Education
bio:
An experienced specialist Dietitian passionate to reduce health inequalities experienced by those with learning disabilities. Dedicated to implementing the MCA in practice, addressing diagnostic overshadowing, taking a relationship and person-centred approach and enacting reasonable adjustments to deliver effective dietetic care and improve health outcomes.
Founder & Chair of the British Dietetic Associations (BDA) Learning Disabilities (LD) Subgroup; Education Officer for Learning Disabilities with the BDA Mental Health Specialist Group; BDA representative on the LD Professional Senate.
A demonstrated history of developing and delivering nutritional curriculum, education and webinars for a range of professional bodies including the Royal Society of Medicine, Royal College of Physicians, Royal College of Psychiatry, British Dietetic Association, Care Quality Commission (CQC), Health Education England, MyNutriWeb, Edgehill, Cumbria and Winchester Universities. 
Author for magazines and journals including Dietetics Today; Royal College of Nursing Journal, Learning Disability Practice; Nutrition Society; NHS England and Health Education England. See LinkedIn account for full list of publication.
Available for freelance work for client assessment, lectures, clinical supervision, training for dietitians / care providers.

name: Sarika Mongia
bio:
Hello! I’m Sarika, a registered dietitian with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) and a member of The British Dietetic Association (BDA) for over 20 years.

I have specialist knowledge in the field of weight management and diabetes. I am passionate about these areas as with the right guidance, attitude and support, big outcomes can be achieved.

I began my career as a dietitian in Hammersmith & Charing Cross Hospital in departments that were cutting edge in the management of obesity, diabetes and heart disease. I then moved into weight management research at an established university where I joined a team leading the development of evidence-based structured weight management programmes for weight loss and reversal of Type 2 diabetes. This study has since been published in renowned medical journals. In addition, I have led training for health care professionals on best practice weight management both in the UK and at international forums.

My wealth of experience has demonstrated that I can provide the best support to my clients in achieving their dietary or lifestyle goals in a truly holistic manner. My advice and guidelines are evidence-based, tailored to your lifestyle and delivered in a way that can be sustainable by ensuring you are equipped with a toolbox of relevant skills for the long term.
industry_services: Digital Health, Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Obesity, Freelance Practice, Diverticulosis, IBS, Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), Menopause, Weight loss, Metabolic disease

name: Samuel Thearson
bio:
I am a clinical lead dietitian within the NHS specialising in Bariatric surgery. My current NHS work includes pre and post surgical management for gastric sleeve, gastric bypass and other novel techniques. I support patients who have had surgery abroad with getting the best outcome in the private sector. 
I have previous and ongoing experience with complex surgical pathways, prehab/rehab, nutrition support, oncology, IBS, liver and pancreatic disorders. Other interest are assisting with male and female factor infertility, diabetes remission.
Before working as a dietitian I had several head chef positions at large successful independent restaurants and have significant cooking and industrial catering knowledge. 

I am available at KIMS hospital Maidstone, or remote/telephone calls for self pay or private medical insurance patients.

name: Sarah Almond bushell
bio:
THE CHILDREN'S NUTRITIONIST
I'm Sarah Almond Bushell a registered paediatric dietitian, fussy eating feeding therapist & baby weaning expert with 25 years of expertise. 
My business is called The Children's Nutritionist and my team and I help you fix fussy eating through our online course. We specialise in sensory and the psychology of eating.
In addition, I also offer consultancy to food brands including Heinz Baby, Hovis, Annabel Karmel, Tommee Tippee, Thermomix. 
I am a published author and motivational speaker.
I am also a masters level certified business coach with a specialism in online marketing and digital products (courses, memberships, ebooks and making money blogging). I have a business focussed podcast called Beyond The Clinic which is all about helping dietitian's expand their business beyond the traditional clinic model.
You can find out more about me and my business via my website www.childrensnutrition.co.uk

name: Karen Hawthorne
bio:
I can help you reduce and prevent complications of disease by working with you to achieve effective dietary changes that suit you.

Have you been told that you can’t eat certain foods because of your diabetes?
Or that you must lose weight to prevent high blood pressure and its consequences?
Have you been told your kidneys aren’t working as well as they were and wonder if there is anything you can do to help them?
Are you worried about your never going to be able to lose weight or get your diabetes controlled?
If you’re saying yes to any of the above, I know how you feel, having worked with 1000's of patients as a renal specialist dietitian for 5 years and in dietetics for over 10 years.
Here is how I help:
1. Free 15 minute initial consultation for you to explore your needs and ex-amine the facts.
2. Full consultation to look at your medical history medication and previous advice and agree new goals.
3. Follow up consultation to evaluate what is working and set new goals
4. Full macro and micro nutrient analysis to check for deficiencies.
5. Empower you with the skills you need to make good food choices that benefit your health
6. Enable you to understand how the dietary changes we agree will improve your life.
Book your free 15 minute consultation now via phone or email.
Look forward to speaking with you soon
Karen
industry_services: Lecturing & teaching
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Adolescence, Mental health, Nutrition support, Renal nutrition, Weight loss

name: Lisa Waddell
bio: Lisa Waddell is Director of her private business; Food Allergy Nottingham Service Ltd (FANS) and also works part time for the NHS as lead community paediatric dietitian. She is an expert in paediatric food allergy and has over 21 years’ experience helping families identify whether their infant/ young child is suffering from food allergy or other feeding related problem.  She has been involved in numerous working groups such as the NICE food allergy guidelines and RCPCH food allergy care pathway working groups, an expert advisor for NICE and has been a member of the BSACI Primary Care group committee since its inception.  Much of her private work involves lecturing, which includes being a member of the RCPCH paediatric allergy training faculty and lead facilitator on the BDA cow’s milk allergy accredited course.  She has also been involved in research, being part of the NIHR TEST (Trial of eczema allergy screening tests) feasibility trial, undertakes peer review, supports the Allergy UK patient helpline and BDA food allergy specialist group development of numerous allergy free dietary publications.
industry_services: Articles, Private practice, Lecturing & teaching
clinical_expertise: Early years nutrition, Food allergy, Paediatrics

name: Kelina Fili
title: MSc
bio:
Kelina Fili, BSc (Hons), MSc, RD

My name is Kelina Fili, and I am a highly qualified and experienced dietitian specializing in the nutritional management of Eating Disorders and Disordered Eating. With a rich academic and professional background, as well as a passion for supporting individuals to achieve a healthier relationship with food, I am dedicated to providing compassionate, evidence-based nutritional support tailored to your unique needs. I am dedicated to helping individuals reclaim a healthy relationship with food and their bodies.

My journey began with a BSc (Hons) in Dietetics, and I’ve since built a career combining clinical expertise with a deep understanding of the psychological aspects of eating behaviors. I hold an MSc in Health Psychology and an MSc in Sport and Exercise Nutrition, and I am currently working on my PhD in Social Psychology.

My approach to dietetics is holistic and client-centered. Understanding the emotional, psychological, and social factors that influence eating behaviors is crucial to effective treatment. Whether you’re struggling with Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, Binge Eating Disorder, ARFID, OSFED, or any form of disordered eating, I can provide personalized guidance that empowers you to make positive, sustainable changes.

I provide holistic care and integrate nutrition science with psychological insights to address the root causes of disordered eating. I am aware of the complexities of eating disorders and committed to supporting you with empathy and respect throughout your journey to recovery. Every individual is unique, so together we can create a customized plan that fits your specific needs, lifestyle, and goals.

If you’re ready to embark on a path toward healthier eating and a better quality of life, I’m here to help. Let’s work together to find the best solutions for you! Feel free to get in touch whether you are seeking to heal your relationship with food, improve your nutritional health, or support a loved one.

Services Offered
- Nutritional counseling for eating disorders
- Support for disordered eating patterns
- Personalized meal planning and guidance
- Workshops and seminars on nutrition
clinical_expertise: Coaching/ mentoring, Eating disorders, Nutrition support, Obesity, Research, Veganism and Vegetarianism

name: Susan Burry
bio:
Susan is a qualified Registered Dietitian, Health and Wellbeing Coach and Nutrition Consultant for the past a 30 years. Her career has encompassed food service, nutrition counseling, research, lecturing and public health.  After moving to London from Canada, Susan specialised in the treatment of Obesity at the University of Roehampton, London, UK with completing her Masters. Susan has a keen interest in weight loss management with a track record of success stories in the both the private and public medical sectors. To compliment her private work on Harley St.  Susan also works in Bariatric Surgery in Jersey.

She helps global clients through Betterup career coaching to help clients have more energy, feel better and live healthier. There is not a quick approach, its about small changes and goal setting to be the best you can be at any age. 

Throughout her career she has worked in hospitals, schools and her own private practice offering tailored nutritional education to patients, clients and students.
As part of her ongoing development, Susan has researched vegetarian diets and is the Nutrition Consultant for the Vegetarian Society.  This work includes answering enquiries for their members and developing evidence based nutrition education tools. Her research on the diagnosis and treatment approach to poly-cystic ovarian syndrome at the University or Roehampton has just been published. Nutrition Genomics testing is just been added to her services.
Susan is a member of the Health and Care Professionals Council, British Dietetics Association, and the Freelance Dietitian Group. Her services are covered my most Private Insurance Policies.
Susan counsels and gives nutritional advice and support to patients wishing to lose weight and gain a healthier lifestyle.  Her nutritional advice is both practical and tailored to each patient to ensure healthy and long-term weight loss.  Susan genuinely cares for her clients short and long term success by offering not only face to face consultations but also constant remote access.
Latest initiative is corporate wellness as part of the BDA Workplace and Whole Foods PLant based eCertificate.
industry_services: Business consulting, Conferences, Corporate Health, Private practice

bio:
Hi, I'm Lisa, a Registered Dietitian based in Hampshire. I offer online and in person consultations in the Hampshire and surrounding areas.
With many years of experience, I cover a diverse area of nutrition. I am passionate about providing evidence-based advice, specifically tailored to your individual needs and goals.  
Supporting you as an individual and working together to implement a bespoke plan is my key focus, ensuring the best for your health and well-being.
I am HCPC registered and have a wide range of practical experience through my work in both acute hospitals and the community covering everything from Eating Disorders in children and Teenagers to Oncology dietetic support.
Please see the list below for areas in which I have particular specialist experience.
I am also available to speak at events, deliver training, and write for online magazines.
If you would like to find out more about me and how I can help you meet your health and nutritional goals, please visit my website or contact me via the enquiry form. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Anjali Parmar
bio:
Hello and welcome to Your Dietitian. 
My freelance work involves supporting clients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Weight Management, Heart Health and Type 2 Diabetes/Pre-Diabetes.
After graduating from the University of Nottingham with a degree in Masters in Nutrition (Dietetics), I have been working with the NHS and have gained experience working with weight management in children, maternal obesity, geriatric rehabilitation, neurological conditions, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), obesity and cardiovascular diseases amongst other conditions. My experiences in different fields have allowed me to have a good insight into the importance of optimum nutrition during the ever-changing course of a lifetime.
My personal experiences with gut health and gestational diabetes have given me a unique insight into how best to support my clients and feel very privileged to be in a position to share my experiences and professional expertise without the constraints of limited resources and time. 
I am a full member of the British Dietetic Association, Freelance Dietitians Specialist Group and Diabetes Specialist Group. I am registered with the Health and Care Professions Council, professional member of Diabetes UK and an information review panel member of the British Nutrition Foundation. 
I am here to support you with evidenced based dietary advice that fits in with your traditions, beliefs and culture. Please get in touch for your free consultation.

name: Nicky van Zyl
title: BSc(MED)Hons
bio:
Nicky is a HCPC registered dietitian based in West Berkshire. She qualified at the University of Cape Town and worked in private practice before returning to the UK. Nicky has both clinical and freelance experience and continues to work as a NHS mental health bank dietitian in the South West of England and as a freelance dietitian. 

Nicky specialises in mental health and disordered eating and eating disorders including binge eating disorder. She works as part of a multidisciplinary team at the Bluebird Centre and has her own private practice supporting clients with insulin resistance, type 2 diabetes, polycystic ovarian syndrome and general wellbeing. She offers remote dietetic consultations. 

Nicky is also a qualified yoga teacher and has been teaching yoga to both adults and children since 2017. 

Nicky is passionate about the mind and body connection and NourishandFlow with Nicky was borne out of this passion; how to nourish our bodies and minds through food and mindful movement

name: Jean Sullivan
bio:
Jean is a West Yorkshire-based Registered Dietitian with extensive dietetic experience gained in both the NHS and private sectors.

Jean specialises in one-to-one personalised consultations

Clients will be provided with in-depth, personalised and high-quality dietary advice. Clients can be advised on a range of nutritional areas including:
Irritable bowel syndrome
Weight management
Diabetes
Renal disease
Diet in pregnancy
Diet and the menopause
Diet in heart disease
Coeliac disease
Osteoporosis
Sport's nutrition
This is not an exhaustive list, therefore if you have a concern regarding a nutritional area not listed above, please do not hesitate to contact Jean.

Jean graduated with a first class honours degree in Human Nutrition and a State Registration in Dietetics from the University of Ulster in 1992. She went on to achieve a Masters in Clinical Research (Distinction) from Cardiff University in 2003.

Jean is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) – the independent, UK-wide health regulatory body for allied health professions and is a member of the British Dietetic Association.
Jean has worked in a number of NHS hospitals, where she was responsible for providing dietetic advice to patients with varying nutritional needs including; obesity, diabetes, hypercholesterolaemia, irritable bowel syndrome, coeliac disease, poor appetite, disease related weight loss and swallowing problems. Jean specialised in providing dietary advice to those with renal disease, which included renal transplant patients.
Jean has also worked in the private sector for a medical food company as a Project Leader, providing specialist dietetic input to allow new medical foods to be developed for specific disease conditions.
Having completed her Masters in Clinical Research Jean worked as a dietitian on a clinical research trial which investigated the effects on patients’ recovery rates of supplementing with the amino acid glutamine.
Jean has also worked as a Senior Fellow for the NIHR Clinical Research Network Co-ordinating Centre (part of the National Institute for Health I am a West Yorkshire-based Registered Dietitian with extensive dietetic experience gained in both the NHS and private sectors.  

Please visit Jean's website and contact her to discuss your dietary requirements in more detail https://www.jeansullivan-dietitian.co.uk

name: Simmone Lewer
bio:
Hello! My name is Simmone Lewer. I am a specialist Gestational Diabetes dietitian.

I have 11+ years experience working in diabetes. I am Australian and started my career helping pregnant Aboriginal women in outback Australia. I loved it so much and this developed my passion towards diabetes. 

In 2012 I moved to the UK and worked in the National Health Service (NHS) specialising in diabetes and antenatal diabetes services, meanwhile studying a masters in public health and completing post graduate courses on fertility and pregnancy.

I left the NHS in 2021 as I felt burnout and frustrated. I hated the restriction of having only 10 minutes to help Mums with Gestational Diabetes and I knew I WANTED TO DO MORE! 

I saw a close friend of mine really struggle with gestational diabetes. I was able to help her so much so she could still enjoy her pregnancy and found this so so rewarding. 

Many women I work with COME TO ME feeling so lost, overwhelmed and stressed. No wonder, when there is so much conflicting advice around! This all makes navigating gestational diabetes alone so confusing. 

I now dedicate my career to help mums so they can learn how to balance blood sugars while still ENJOYING pregnancy.

Check out my instagram page for helpful tips and advice or book in a free 1:1 chat with me to find out more about my services.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Coaching/ mentoring, Diabetes, Freelance Practice, Maternity, inc. maternal obesity, Women's health

name: Ciara Caleshu
bio:
Ciara is a registered dietitian specialising in Bariatric Surgery, Weight Management and Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). As well as working for the NHS, Ciara is a Freelance Dietitian and co-owner of Peninsula Dietitians, an online service offering nutritional guidance and support. She is CORU and HCPC registered, so can offer her service across both the UK and the Republic of Ireland.
She has several years of experience supporting people on their weight loss journey, before and after bariatric surgery or by non surgical methods. She provides guidance and education on nutritional requirements, correction of nutritional deficiencies, eating techniques as well as other diet and lifestyle changes needed to help optimise patients’ health and weight loss success. She has extensive experience guiding patients through complications that can occur after bariatric surgery such as reactive hypoglycaemia, dumping, vomiting and weight regain.
Ciara also works with expectant mothers who have had bariatric surgery and may need some additional support while pregnant.
She has completed the British Dietetic Association training on low FODMAP diet for treatment of IBS and enjoys supporting people with this condition, either with first line diet and lifestyle advice or using the low FODMAP diet if appropriate. 
So, whether you are pre or post bariatric surgery, looking for weight management advice or IBS symptom control, Ciara would like to support you in a collaborative way, using bespoke nutritional advice and realistic goal setting.

Hello, my name is Anne Wright and I am a Registered Dietitian and team leader at AM Dietetics.

Our small but friendly team of expert, private, Dietitians works with people and organisations to help improve their health and wellbeing by making healthy food and nutrition choices.

We can help you to prevent and manage a wide range of health conditions, helping you to feel better with a kind approach.

Available online, from the comfort of your own home, from anywhere in UK or worldwide.

name: Amy Vaughan
title: BSc
bio:
Consultant Specialising in Health Communications
With over 7 years as a Registered Dietitian, I now focus on helping businesses, brands, and professionals within the health and wellness space communicate effectively and drive positive health outcomes. 
My expertise spans content creation, and educational program development, combining evidence-based insights with impactful storytelling.
I provide expert guidance for organisations seeking to create innovative, engaging, and accurate health content. From developing educational courses to ghostwriting, I translate complex nutrition science into accessible materials that inspire action and enhance brand credibility.
I am passionate about making a real impact through strategic health communication, offering services that range from peer review of nutritional content to public speaking and lecturing. 
Whether you need tailored nutrition content or expert advice on health marketing strategies, I work with brands to amplify their message and influence in the nutrition space.

name: Laura Kyte
bio: I graduated from the University of Surrey in 2005, with a degree in nutrition/dietetics. Following registration with the Health Care Professions Council (HCPC) I started working in district general hospital. After a few years working in a range of specialities I joined a childhood obesity programme called MEND (Mind Exercise Nutrition Diet) where we provided nutrition education and exercises to children and their families. Following on from this I moved to a community dietitian role designing and rolling out weight loss groups in GP surgeries. Whilst in the community I managed weekly community clinics working with people with bowel disorders, diabetes, hypertension, cancer, malnutrition and a range of other problems. I then had the opportunity to work in the local haemodialysis unit and eventually moved to work in the Exeter Renal Unit. My role here allowed me to be involved as a committee member of the national Renal Nutrition Group, to present at national conferences, to be involved in setting up staff and patients weight management groups and to complete my Post Graduate Certificate in Advanced Practice with the University of Plymouth. More recently I have worked to build the Kidney Kitchen with Kidney Care UK and I continue to work in the NHS as a Primary Care Dietitian.

name: Laura Cowley
contact_address: Driffield, East Riding of Yorkshire United Kingdom
bio:
Hi, I'm Laura. I’m a registered dietitian and PCOS specialist, but I’m also someone who has PCOS—so I know first hand how frustrating it can be to try everything (cutting carbs, taking inositol, following TikTok trends) and still feel out of control.

When I was diagnosed, even with over a decade of experience in nutrition, I struggled with irregular periods, acne, fatigue, and weight gain. The only advice I got? “Just lose weight or go on the pill.” It wasn’t enough—and it definitely wasn’t supportive. So I went deep into the research, experimented, and developed an approach that truly worked.

Now, I help other women with PCOS do the same through my 12-week Thrive with PCOS program. Using my evidence-based NOURISH framework, we work together to regulate your cycle, reduce symptoms, and restore hormonal balance—without extreme diets or guilt.

My approach combines:
✔ Personalised nutrition and supplement advice
✔ Lifestyle and mindset support
✔ Cycle tracking and education
✔ Gentle accountability and intuitive eating principles

You’ll finally stop Googling conflicting advice, feel confident in your choices, and break free from diet culture—for good.

Let’s get your period back and help you thrive with PCOS.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Fertility, Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)
geographical_areas_served: International, UK, Ireland, Europe, East Anglia, East Midlands, Greater London, Home Counties, Isle of Wight, North East, North Wales, North West, Northern Ireland, Scotland, South East, South Wales, South West, West Midlands

name: Caroline Bletcher
title: BSc
bio:
Hi I'm Caroline, a Registered Dietitian based in Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey. I offer online virtual consultations nationwide and face-to-face consultations in Kingston Upon Thames and Surbiton.
My primary focus has always been the health and wellbeing of my clients. With years of experience and a passion for helping people achieve better health, I consider myself dedicated to my profession.
I hold an HCPC registration as a dietitian and have worked in various healthcare settings, including community, acute care, and the private sector. I strongly believe in tailoring my approach to each individual's unique needs to support their wellness goals.
My areas of expertise include weight management, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), plant-based diets, and women's health.
My personal journey of overcoming weight challenges has given me a unique perspective, allowing me to approach my work with empathy and understanding.
During my time in the NHS, I initiated the weight management group service for Central Surrey Health, and was awarded the title of Allied Health Professional of the Year, an accomplishment that I'm proud of.
I have a particular interest in gut health and the impact of diet manipulation for the management of conditions like IBS and diverticular disease. My skill in dietary manipulation enables me to assist clients in relieving uncomfortable gut symptoms and enhancing their overall quality of life.
Continuing education and specialisation are essential to me. I've completed specialised post-qualification training in diet and the management of conditions such as PCOS and the menopause. This additional training equips me to better assist women looking to optimise their health during significant life stages.
If you're searching for a dedicated and knowledgeable partner on your journey to improved health and wellbeing, I'm here to help. My focus is on your needs, and my aim is to provide the support and guidance you need to reach your health goals.
If you would like to find out more about me and how I can help you meet your nutrition goals, please visit my website or contact me via the enquiry form. I look forward to hearing from you :)

name: Ruth Kander
bio:
Ruth Kander is a state-registered dietitian, registered with the British Dietetic Association and the Health and Care Professions Council since January 1996.
Ruth is an Advanced Clinical Practitioner in renal medicine at Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust. 
Ruth has been working in the NHS for 28 years
 All consultations are online video or video calls on Sundays or Fridays
The first consultation is approximately 1-hour session to find out about your lifestyle, medical history, and dietary intakes. Advice that is up to date and practical to follow will be given. 
Follow-up appointments are half an hour to find out how you have managed with the dietary advice I have given.
No faddy diets, pills or potions are used.
All the dietary information provided is practical and up to date with medical practice.
Ruth is currently only seeing clients with Kidney disease stages 1-4.
Clients have been happy with the advice I have given.
Ruth has won the following awards;
Nurse education teaching pack SHS award
British Dietetic Association  Elizabeth Washington Award for an online doctors training program in Nutrition.
Imperial College Healthcare award for patient care.
Full Monty awards part of the mental healthcare team at Cambian Churchill hospital.
Ruth has lectured at the University
Imperial college; The medical course and Gastroenterology BSc
Kings College London; Nutrition and Dietetics courses
London Metropolitan University; Nutrition and dietetics course
Surrey University; Nutrition masters course
Let me organize your food and nutrition to suit you. Looking forward to hearing from you.
industry_services: Lecturing & teaching, Private practice, Speaking

name: Lorraine McCreary
bio:
Lorraine McCreary has been a practising Dietitian in the acute setting, community, private and corporate sectors for 27years.  Also guest lecturer at Glasgow Caledonian University  department of biomedical sciences for 6 years. Recently worked as a Specialist Dietitian with NHS Lanarkshire Eating Disorders Service. 

Lorraine has acted as an expert witness on behalf of Digby Brown on multiple occasions.

Her company, Dietscotland operates as an independent Dietetic service provider and advisory resource to the public, press, corporate and education sectors. Lorraine Specialises in Eating Disorders across the spectrum and post covid-19 recovery.

name: Gillian Rajan
title: BSc PgD
bio:
Gillian Rajan Nutrition is run by Gillian Rajan BSc PgD, a UK state registered Dietitian. Gillian has extensive experience in clinical nutrition and dietetics and is passionate about health and nutrition.  Her goal is to provide individualised advice to enable you to make the best food choices for your specific needs.
During her career, Gillian has specialised in gastroenterology, surgery, critical care and complex nutrition support.  She is experienced in the nutritional management of crohn's disease, colitis, liver disease, diseases of the gallbladder, pancreatitis, coeliac disease, small bowel bacterial overgrowth and irritable bowel syndrome.  She is passionate about the importance of pre operative nutritional optimisation to improve outcomes for those undergoing surgery.  She can help you to optimise your gut microbiome through diet and evidence based advice on pre and probiotics.
Gillian has an Honours degree in Nutritional Science and a post graduate diploma in Dietetics.  She started working as a dietitian in 2005 and still works in the NHS part time as clinical lead dietitian. Gillian is trained in supporting people to follow the low FODMAP diet for functional bowel disorders (Kings College London)
Gillian Rajan Nutrition is located in Chester. Please get in touch to learn more about the services and to book your virtual or in person consultation.
industry_services: Private practice
clinical_expertise: Diverticulosis, Freelance Practice, Gastroenterology, IBD, IBS, Low FODMAP, Nutrition support, Parenteral & Enteral Nutrition

name: Rachel Griffin
bio:
Rachel is a registered dietitian specialising in bariatric surgery, weight management & Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). She is co-owner of Peninsula Dietitians, an online service offering nutritional guidance and support. She has several years of experience in supporting individuals to optimise their nutrition, work towards a healthy weight and improve symptom management. 
She offers guidance and advice regarding eating techniques, meeting protein requirements, interpretation of nutritional blood tests and correction of nutritional deficiencies. She is experienced in managing complications that can occur after surgery such as dumping syndrome, reactive hypoglycaemia, vomiting / regurgitation, weight regain, reflux and food intolerances. 
Rachel has a keen interest in the psychology of eating and enjoys supporting people to make realistic and sustainable dietary and lifestyle changes to help them achieve better health. 
She has experience with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) and gut health having completed a BDA course in FODMAPs allowing her to support people with a sensitive gut to improve their symptoms through first line advice and / or exploring a low FODMAP diet if indicated. 
She works as a Freelance Dietitian outside of her NHS role and would like to support anyone who is looking for help in improving their nutrition and well-being, whether that's after bariatric (weight loss) surgery, for weight management or IBS advice.

name: Alice Connolly
bio:
If you are looking for a lifelong approach to weight-management & wanting to get off the yo-yo dieting cycle - you are in the right place! It's my mission to support you to develop the knowledge, confidence & skills to self-manage your weight & health for the long term.
I am a Registered Dietitian with over 15 years clinical experience in specialist weight-management, PCOS, fertility & pregnancy.  I have been fortunate to work alongside a specialist multidisciplinary team including physiotherapists, psychologists and doctors; this has given me the insights to build a truly holistic approach to my dietetic services as well as having a great network of experienced colleagues to support me when I need it.

I self-manage my own diagnosis of PCOS and have gone through the IVF process and am grateful I can contribute my professional skills and lived experience to support others going through similar. 

What are people saying?
https://uk.trustpilot.com/review/aliceconnollydietitian.uk

Where to next?

I would love to offer you a free introductory call to answer any outstanding questions you may have and see if we are suited to working together. You can book this directly via my website or send me an email: alice@aliceconnollydietitian.uk

name: Felicity Lyons
title: BSc PG Dip Diet PG Cert Spor Nutr
bio:
I specialise in helping people achieve better health through customised, science based, and agreed, dietary and lifestyle changes. Lifestyle medicine to optimise your well-being. Specialist areas include:
Weight Reduction and Weight Loss Maintenance
Mental Health: Eating Disorders & Disordered Eating
Diabetes Remission including  Counterweight Plus Programme
Irritable Bowel Syndrome including using low FODMAP diet
Sports Nutrition and Body Composition Analysis (ISAK)
I am an experienced dietitian of over 25 years and have worked within the NHS as an obesity specialist for Imperial College Healthcare Trust, as well as a research dietitian  with Robert Gordon University. 

I am a mum of two teenage boys (!), try to live an active life (walk, cycle, yoga) and love food, cooking, baking, red wine, book club, movies, shopping… and learning, always learning.
If you need guidance and support to change your diet and lifestyle come see me at Clapham or uptown in South Molton Street, W1. I will listen.

name: Anna Pain
bio:
Hello,
My name is Anna. I have worked as a dietitian for 12 years in a large hospital and have a wide range of knowledge and experience.
As a freelance dietitian, I offer friendly, individualised guidance and support to reach goals on;
1. Weight Management
2. Cholesterol / Lipid lowering
3. Improving blood pressure 
4. Managing Irritable Bowel Syndrome with the Low FODMAP Diet.
5. Reducing Reflux / Dyspepsia
6. Type 2 diabetes
7. Heart health
8. General health and wellbeing
If you need dietary and lifestyle advice on any of the above, please give me a call to see if I can help. After completion of an initial questionnaire to gather some background information, I provide a one hour consultation to fully discuss your needs and to create a personalised dietary plan to help you achieve your goals.

name: Jennifer Low
title: RD, MSc, BSc
bio:
We help you to find freedom from disordered eating and eating disorders, so that you can recover and nourish yourself fully, without guilt.
We treat: all eating disorders, weight management/healthy living/intuitive eating, disordered eating and all associated gastrointestinal issues.
Download our FREE resources at the bottom of this page.
Based in a cosy clinic room in Sevenoaks, I work face to face or online with my clients.
I have worked in eating disorders since 2008 and have worked with both adults and children in specialist NHS services as well as privately. I am a Registered Dietitian with a degree in Psychology, an MSc in Nutrition & a Post-Graduate Diploma in Dietetics from King’s College.
Extensive qualifications in dietetics and nutrition, along with additional training in psychology, cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT-E), motivational interviewing, Guided Self-Help and body image training, equip us to offer you the highest standard of care.
Recovery is not just about changing what you eat — it’s about understanding and supporting you whilst you heal the underlying issues. That’s why our treatment integrates nutritional guidance, trauma-informed care and behavioural change therapies. We work with the “healthy part” of you to make sustainable changes, while always respecting your boundaries and readiness for change.
When you work with us, our membership site, “Small Steps to Freedom”, gives you 24/7 access to a wealth of resources & our package of care also includes optional online meal support sessions.
For healthcare professionals: We have a training course available for instant download – to help you have a better understanding of eating disorders. This can be found here (please note: this is only for healthcare professionals, not patients or carers): https://trainingineatingdisorders.thinkific.com/courses/understanding-eating-disorders
Media & PR
Since training as a media spokesperson for the British Dietetic Association in 2011, I have featured on both live and pre-recorded TV & radio shows, and have also been an off-screen dietitian for many TV shows.
For around 6 years I was part of the expert panel of the Healthy Food Guide magazine and wrote monthly features and blogs for them. I have also written and commented for many other consumer and trade press, and I've peer-edited many high profile nutrition books.
I have also consulted on brands, such as Yakult, working on market research and press releases.
We would love to hear from you, whether you'd like one to one sessions for eating disorder treatment, disordered eating, weight management, to learn intuitive eating or whether you are looking for PR and media work.

name: Kate Hilton
bio:
My name is Kate, a freelance dietitian and founder of Diets Debunked in 2021.
I have extensive experience in the management of gastrointestinal conditions such as IBS, reflux, diverticular disease, and other gastrointestinal symptoms and conditions. Alongside this, I am a specialist diabetes dietitian and can aide in improving your relationship with food to support weight loss.
I have a special interest is within Learning Disabilities and dietetics, and I am working to create a Tier 2 weight management service for individuals with Learning Disabilities within Hampshire County Council. I also provide private dietetic consultation for Learning Disability services throughout Hampshire. 
I have previously worked in various different fields throughout my career, including disease related malnutrition, Parkinson’s disease, dementia and cognitive decline, neurological rehabilitation, learning difficulties, COVID and management of respiratory conditions, amongst others.
I offer telehealth appointments over video call and telephone for clients, whichever suits you best.
Outside of clinical work, I have worked with varying brands to produce videos for their social media channels, and can provide consultancy services to companies. I have been featured in a variety of publications, including Cosmopolitan, Mens' Health and Bella.

name: Leticia Corominas
bio:
I am a UK Registered Dietitian with experience working in GP clinics, outpatient clinics and inpatient wards in the NHS. I hold a Nutrition and Dietetics BSc from King's College London. I currently work as a Specialist Dietitian at a health tech company. I have worked in one of the largest dietetics departments at a NHS Trust in Central London. I am originally Spanish however I grew up in the United States and I have been in London for the past 6 years. I am bilingual (English and Spanish) and happy to carry out consultations in either languages.
My holistic focus as a freelance dietitian is in supporting you to achieve personalised long-term dietary and lifestyle (movement, sleep, stress management, social support) changes to:
- Optimise your health, improve your energy and strength levels, and promote longevity through health-promoting anti-inflammatory diets. 
- Manage a condition you may be living with where dietetic input may be beneficial including improving your glycemic control (for both non-diabetic and diabetics), lipid lowering (i.e. high cholesterol), hypertension, fatty liver disease.
- Improve your gut health and manage digestive disorders including food intolerances, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Celiac Disease, Diverticular Disease, Bloating, Constipation, SIBO. If appropriate supporting you in following the low FODMAP diet as a trained FODMAP dietitian.
- Improve your relationship with food, your body image, and reach food freedom. Support those living with disordered eating, orthorexic-style eating, binge-style eating and emotional eating. 
- Reach your healthy weight by reducing body fat and increasing muscle mass. Helping you sustain this in the long-term.
- Increase your weight and/or muscle mass if you are living at a low body weight or have experienced unintentional weight loss due to stress, loss of appetite, or a clinical condition.
- Manage fatigue-related conditions (such as Long Covid, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome or Fibromyalgia) or conditions affecting executive functioning around mealtimes (such as ADHD).
- Perform at your best and optimise recovery through sports nutrition.
- Women's health including support around menstruation, menopause, and Polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS).
- Make healthier choices in different environments including the workplace and in your own home. 
- Empower young people to make healthy choices at different stages including transitioning to university.
If you are interested in one-off sessions or ongoing nutritional coaching sessions please reach out over email to see if my experience and skills suit you and your goals.

name: Varsha Nagaraj
bio:
Hello! 😊 I’m Varsha, I am a paediatric and public health dietitian by background and have worked in the NHS for 18 years. I am registered with the HCPC and a member of the BDA. I am passionate about health and wellbeing and enjoy working with children and families.
My areas of speciality are pregnancy and early years nutrition, infant feeding including supporting breastfeeding and safe formula feeding, introduction to solids- healthy weaning practices, allergies, fussy eating and weight management. I have twin girls myself and have first hand experience of managing these different life stages 😊
I also have a good awareness about the culture and diet of South-East Asia, being Indian myself, and would like to work to support these client groups as well. 
I am currently work in an exciting new role at Public Health Wales where I leverage my extensive clinical paediatric and public health expertise to lead and drive the implementation of the National Infant Feeding Plan for Wales.
I am an advanced mindfulness practitioner and a Pilates teacher and I bring these holistic elements of wellbeing into my practice.
I offer one-one consultations, group education and courses and as part of this, discovery calls to find out your individual needs.

name: Shannon Quigley
bio:
Voted Scotland's BEST FREELANCE DIETITIAN 2022!


I am a Registered Children's Dietitian with extensive clinical experience in the NHS.  I have particular expertise in children's food allergies, selective eating and autism, Children's nutritional support and weight management.

I have a BSc Honours degree in Human Nutrition and Dietetics.  I am also registered with the Health Care Professions Council and am a member of the British Dietetic Association.


I currently work as a Paediatric Specialist Dietitian both freelance and in the NHS.  I have a great passion for helping families and find my role rewarding.

name: Maeve Hanan
bio:
Myself and my team of Registered Dietitians support those who struggle with a difficult relationship with food in the Dietetically Speaking Online Clinic.
The clients we work with can be anywhere on the spectrum from food anxiety, chronic dieting, disordered eating or a diagnosed eating disorder. All eating difficulties are valid and deserving of support. We help our clients to achieve a peaceful, free and flexible relationship with food.
We have a variety of experience and training related to our specialist area of eating disorders, disordered eating and intuitive eating. As well this, our Dietitians also have training and experience related to other nutritional concerns including: sports nutrition, gut health & IBS, women’s health and nutritional deficiencies.
Our Dietitians work in an evidence-based, compassionate, person-centred and weight-inclusive way. You are the expert of your own life, so we are there to support and empower you, rather than just telling you what to do. Think of us as your tour guide, there alongside you on your journey to a more peaceful relationship with food.
We also offer some services for businesses such as consultancy, nutrition writing and webinars.

name: Barry Cullen
bio:
Hello! My name is Barry Cullen and I’m the Livewell Dietitian. I’m an expert in nutrition, based in Yorkshire, who is ready to help you, with whatever nutritional concerns you have.
If this involves having a medical condition that causes you symptoms, or you’re someone who wants to lose weight for good, why not drop me an email to arrange an informal chat, to see how I can help.
I also offer workplace nutrition sessions for companies and their employees and as a qualified Sports Nutritionist I can support individuals or teams with personalising nutrition around training to improve performance.
I have worked in the NHS for over 13 years and currently work as a clinical lead dietitian at Leeds Community Healthcare NHS Trust. I would love to hear from you. So if you would like to learn a little more about me or get in touch, please visit my website at: www.livewelldietitian.co.uk.

name: Helen Phadnis
title: MSc Dietetics
bio:
The Bespoke Nutrition Coach, led by Helen, is a private practice that offers personalized nutrition services. Helen is a registered dietitian with over 20 years of clinical experience, including 12 years in NHS teaching hospitals and 10 years in private practice, where she works with both individual clients and companies.
Helen specializes in supporting clients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), weight loss, and sports performance. She is FODMAP trained and offers expert guidance to help clients manage these conditions effectively.
A key area of Helen’s expertise is in DNA testing, which helps to identify individual variations in fat and carbohydrate metabolism, vitamin and mineral needs, and food sensitivities. By integrating this genetic information, Helen provides tailored advice to optimize gut health, energy levels, and athletic performance, helping clients achieve their unique health goals.
Helen is registered with all leading health insurance providers and works with self-paying clients. You can see Helen for dietetic consultations via Zoom, or face to face at Brighton Sports Therapy and The Montefiore Hospital. In addition, Helen offers personalized meal plans with recipes and shopping lists, and provides ongoing support via WhatsApp to coach clients through their dietary changes.
To experience Helen's approach, download her FREE Weight Loss & Gut Health 1 week meal plan.
Visit Helen's website to read more about her services, as well as in depth blogs around DNA testing for weight loss, identifying food intolerance, and identifying vitamin and mineral needs.
Don't forget to check out client testimonials on Helen's Google Business page.

name: Naomi Asembi
title: BSc
bio:
Hi, I am Naomi, a registered dietitian with the Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC) and a member of the British Dietetic Association (BDA).

I started my journey into nutrition while living in California, USA, where I became passionate about food for health and qualified as a coach. Wanting to learn more about nutrition, health and disease, I studied at and graduated from the University of Surrey with a First class Bachelor's degree.

I have over 5 years' experience in NHS and private healthcare specialising in gastrointestinal disorders with advanced FODMAP training from King’s College London. It always brings me great pleasure to see the impact dietary changes have on improving symptoms and quality of life. 
I take on private clients 1:1, both online or at my clinic in Wokingham. I am also recognised with several health insurance providers and with stool testing companies.

Writing is another passion of mine, and I have had articles published in several magazines for healthcare professionals, and worked for food companies, writing many posts on diet and nutrition. With my love for teaching, I have been honoured to guest lecture at Oxford Brookes University.

I love to not only help people improve their relationship with food, but also their relationship with themselves. I’m positive and kind and with my training in motivational interviewing and behaviour change, I’m able to explore an individual’s priorities and ascertain the goals they want to achieve and strategise how to get there.

Qualifications:
BSc Hons in Nutrition and Dietetics

Naomi’s Specialities:
IBS and FODMAPs and microbiome testing
Relationship with food
Other GI disorders (Reflux, Diverticular Disease, IBD, and coeliac disease)
Chronic diseases (diabetes, high cholesterol, hypertension, PCOS)

name: Sandeepa Soni
title: BSc (Hons)
bio:
I am a HCPC registered Dietitian with over 19 years experience working in the world of Nutrition and Dietetics, supporting clients with their nutrition needs. I offer free discovery calls to talk through your dietary concerns and expectations.
I provide both face to face or virtual consultations. My specialist areas are IBD, IBS, coeliac disease and gut health. I am able to provide advice on low FODMAP diets and conditions such as food intolerances, nutrition for various cancers, heart health and weight loss advice.
In addition to helping clients 1:1, I havewritten articles on nutrition,delivered group sessions, appeared on podcasts and worked for the Gut HealthClinic inLondon.
I am passionate about nutrition and well-being. My youngest son and I both have coeliac disease and we have to follow a lifelong gluten free diet. Living with Coeliac disease, I understand the impact of dietary restrictions and how to make changes towards eating behaviours, tailoring meals to a budget and adapting cooking methods.

My approach blends evidence-based nutrition with practical, sustainable changes that promote healing, balance, and long-term health. I can work with clients to develop bespoke individualised meal plans. My expertise in the latest health research, along with a compassionate and patient-centered approach, allows me to offer tailored nutrition guidance that fits each person’s unique needs and lifestyle.
Please visit my website nutritionwithsandy.co.uk for more information.

name: Joanna Lenz
bio:
Hi, I'm Jo Lenz and I'm a highly skilled registered Paediatric Dietitian with 17 years worth of experience.
Dietitians are the only qualified healthcare professionals to assess, diagnose and treat dietary and nutritional problems.
Working for leading NHS Trusts such as The Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust and Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, I've worked in both hospital and community settings, treating an array of complex conditions.
I now solely run my private practice and my passion is for helping children and their families.
As a mother of three young children, I know only too well the difficulties of providing children with a healthy diet whilst juggling the pressures of a busy family life.
Based in Oxfordshire, I provide one-to-one online consultations, online workshops and consultancy to commercial food brands and nurseries (please get in touch for more information).
I also provide mentoring for Nutritionists and newly qualified Dietitians or those wanting to become freelance.

name: Natalie z Strachan
bio:
Online Dietitian ~ Natalie is a CORU- and HCPC- Registered Dietitian and a member of the British Dietetic Association. She graduated with a First class honours degree in Nutrition and Dietetics in 2016. She is based in Devon, England, but provides online services across the UK and Republic of Ireland.
Natalie has delivered tailored nutritional care in both community and hospital settings. She has also worked in dedicated Eating Disorders Centres, with both adults and adolescents experiencing Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, and Binge Eating Disorder, as well as other types of Eating Disorder.
 
Natalie provides weight-inclusive nutritional care and aligns herself with Health at Every Size principles. She believes that successful long-term health plans are not only based on scientific evidence, but are also practical and flexible. She has a collaborative, compassion-focussed and holistic approach to her work and takes care to understand each client she works with - she acknowledges that the whole is always greater than the sum of its parts!

Book a free 15min discovery call at: www.nzsnutrition.com

clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Cookery/ recipe development & analysis, Diabetes, Diverticulosis, Eating disorders, Food allergy, Freelance Practice, IBD, IBS, Mental health, Nutrition support, Rehabilitation, Stroke, Veganism and Vegetarianism, Weight loss, Writing

name: Sarah Airey
title: MSc
bio:
Sarah Airey is a specialist dietitian with over 23 years clinical experience working as a dietitian in the NHS. She has specialised in treating people with heart and lung conditions for the last 14 years, where she provided nutrition advice and interventions for adults with a variety of medical issues. She values helping people improve their health through nutrition and finds that working in private practice allows the time needed to understand each individual’s needs to be able to deliver a high quality service.
Sarah has specialist knowledge and skills in nutrition assessments and the treatment of malnutrition. She has a keen interest in nutrition in later life. Including the impact nutrition has on muscle loss and function, leading to weakness and frailty.
Poor diets adversely affect lung function and the progression of lung disease but nutrition does not always get the attention it deserves. Sarah is passionate about raising awareness and promoting the benefits of the integration of nutrition screening and treatment into the clinical management of people with respiratory conditions. She has observed how having lung disease can negatively impact on nutrition and wants to combine her knowledge, experience, and enthusiasm to make a difference to this group.
Sarah completed her Bachelor’s of Science degree in Nutrition and Dietetics in 2000, at Kings College University, London. She has a love for learning and recently completed Master’s degree modules in Research Methodology, Pathophysiology, and Advanced Clinical Assessment Skills. She is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC).
Sarah is the founder of Respiratory Nutrition. They offer comprehensive nutritional assessments by registered dietitians, for adults with and without respiratory conditions. Individualised, practical advice is also given to help support people adapt their food choices and to treat or prevent malnutrition and frailty.
Respiratory Nutrition offer consultations at their clinic based in St Ives, Cambridgeshire or can perform home visits in and around the Cambridgeshire area. They also provide consultations via video call.
They can be contacted via their website: www.respiratorynutrition.co.uk
industry_services: Charitable sector, Private practice
clinical_expertise: Heart health & thoracic, Nutrition for older people, Nutrition support, Parenteral & Enteral Nutrition

name: Amanda Kerr
title: MSc RD
bio:
I have been a registered Dietitian since 2004. I started my Dietetic career working across multiple specialisms in the hospital sector, including; Weight Management, Oncology, Renal, Intensive care, Gastroenterology and Diabetes.

I have worked in the commercial industry for 12 years, across a range of roles, including Medical Affairs, Commercial Leadership and Learning and Development. Focusing on Oncology, Paediatric Care, Paediatric Allergy, Adult Malnutrition, Health & Wellbeing and Menopause.

I am a qualified Executive Coach with the Association of Coaching after completing my MSc in Coaching and Mentoring. I am qualified in Behavioural Change and NLP (Neurolinguistics Programming). I am a qualified Menopause Coach and practitioner with a BSc in Sport and Exercise Science and Sports Therapy.

I am passionate about helping people to create long-term sustainable change, in a way that is right for them, using the power of nutrition in disease prevention, treatment and holistic mind and body synergy. My specialisms are primarily oncology support pre, post and during treatment, women's health, weight management, peri/menopause, and gut health.

name: Clementine Vaughan
title: MSc, PGDip, RD
bio:
Third Sister is a London-based dietetics practice specialising in personalised diet plans for women’s health. From weight loss and hormonal balance to digestive health and overall wellbeing, we help real women navigate their unique challenges through compassionate, science-led nutrition. Whether managing PCOS symptoms, complementing medicalised weight loss, or simply wanting to feel your best, we’re here to guide you towards lasting results.
Based in London, we offer both in-person and online consultations to support women across the UK. Book your free initial consultation today via our website to find the personalised support you need.

name: Kirsty Wadsworth
bio:
We are based in Lincoln, Lincolnshire and dedicated to providing specialist nutrition therapy focused on fertility, pregnancy, and paediatrics and feeding therapy.
I understand that these stages of life are incredibly personal and can be filled with both hope and uncertainty. That's why I conduct thorough nutritional assessments and offer tailored nutritional therapy to meet your individual goals.
My aim is to enhance both male and female fertility, support healthy pregnancies, and improve diet quality for children with feeding disorders.
I am here to support you every step of the way, offering compassionate care and expert guidance to help you achieve the best possible outcomes for you and your family.
