name: Chloe Hall
bio:
I specialise in Gut Health, as well as Mast Cell Activation (MCAS), histamine intolerance and long covid.
I have over 10 years experience in the NHS and support those with
Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) including the low FODMAP diet
Coeliac disease
Histamine intolerance and other chemical sensitivities such as salicylate intolerance.
Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS)
Postural Tachycardia Syndrome (POTs)
Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS) and Hypermobility Spectrum Disorders
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) including Crohn's and Ulcerative Colitis
Pancreatic Exocrine insufficiency
Diverticular disease
Bile acid malabsorption
Long covid orpost-covid symptoms.
I can, also, offer support in improving general gut health and have masters level training in Food Allergy.
I offer 1:1 appointments by video or telephone call through my secure online system.
Reviews from clients can be accessed here https://www.doctify.com/uk/specialist/chloe-hall#reviews
I set up The Calm Gut Dietitian as I am so passionate about ensuring that everyone has access to the support they need if suffering with gut health issues or lesser known conditions. I have worked in the NHS for over 10 years and continue to do so, alongside working privately. I am, also, an advisor for The IBS Network, the national charity for IBS and a Dietetic Advisor for Mast Cell Action, the national charity that supports those with MCAS.
My personal experience of gut health issues and living with someone with histamine intolerance, MCAS, POTs and a milk allergy has enhanced my practical knowledge and understanding of these conditions. I have practical experience of shopping and cooking for the low histamine diet and the low FODMAP diet and can help support clients with these aspects of the diet.
I am, also, passionate about health writing and have written for a number of publications. I have been a media spokesperson for The British Dietetic Association since 2015 and have worked with a range of written media publications and radio stations.
Please see my website www.thecalmgutdietitian.com for more information or email ChloeHall@thecalmgutdietitian.com
I am registered with WPA, Cigna and Aviva and am able to accept clients who have health insurance with these companies.

name: Joanne Scott
bio:
I am HCPC / BDA registered dietitian specialising in paediatric dietetics (children’s nutrition). I have over 12 years of experience, most of which has been spent working at one of the leading children’s hospitals in the UK.
Feeding your child is a vital part of parenting, but it can cause a great deal of stress to many parents if you don’t feel you are getting it right, your child doesn't eat as you want or a medical condition makes your child’s relationship with food more tricky. I am here to support you in getting it right. As a mother to 2, I understand firsthand the pressure to feed your child “correctly” and this means I can tailor advice with a pragmatic, family-centred approach. I will work your child both as an individual and as a part of a family unit to provide appropriate dietary advice, aiming to ensure normal growth and development and building a healthy relationship with food.
I am able to support you and your child/family with a range of dietary and nutrition concerns
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Early years nutrition, Paediatric - Nutrition Support, Paediatrics

name: Bruno Mafrici
title: BSc Hons, MSc NMP
bio:
My name is Bruno and I have been a dietitian for over 20 years in the UK. I am the co-founder of Kidney Nutrition Matters LLP and I am dedicated to dietetic and nutritional interventions in people with kidney disease. As a senior lecturer in many UK universities and authors of scientific journal and books, I am keen to share my dietary knowledge and expertise, with specialist interest in the role of individualised dietary approaches in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD). I work with people at all stages of CKD, including early stage of CKD, later stages, dialysis and transplantation and with people with kidney stones.
If you are interested to know contact me via Instagram @kidneynutritionmatters or ring 07340 662230

name: Jeanette Starkey
bio:
Hello, my name is Jeanette Starkey and I am passionate and committed to helping people with gastroenterology related conditions.  I am a Clinical Lead and Advanced Clinical Practitioner specialist gastroenterology dietitian which means I am able to assess my patients both medically and nutritionally to provide a  complete and in-depth holistic assessment.  I continually seek to improve my knowledge and skills to always be able to provide the best support for my patients; I have qualified as a supplementary prescriber and completed my Advanced Clinical Assessment and Diagnostics training at Master's Level.  My depth of knowledge and clinical management experience means I am able to support my gastroenterology consultant colleagues in the assessment and management of patients with gastroenterology symptoms.  

My areas of research and expertise focus on irritable bowel syndrome, gut health, functional dyspepsia, reflux disease, small intestinal bacterial overgrowth, food allergies/intolerances and probiotics.  I also work closely with patients who have inflammatory bowel disease, coeliac disease and liver disease.

I set up Vie Nutrition to provide a unique service focusing on helping all my patients understand more about their condition and how to manage it with a focus on symptom improvement and longer term gut health. I am able to provide an in-depth assessment and fully understand the clinical, social and nutritional factors which affect bowel function and gut health. This enables us to focus on the key factors impacting on bowel health and thereby provide the right advice and dietary management. I can also undertake testing for SIBO (small intestinal bacterial overgrowth).

Vie Nutrition is based at the Nuffield Hospital in Chester but as we provide online assessments, I have supported thousands of patients locally, nationally and internationally to understand and improve their conditions and symptoms.  I would love to be able to help you with your symptoms.  
Please contact me for further details and an informal chat.

title: PgDipDiet
company_name: UKKIDSNUTRITION by Bahee Van de Bor
bio:
Bahee is an award-winning paediatric dietitian with 18 years of experience. I work with parents who wish to improve their child's gut health using evidence-based nutrition and gentle remedies so that tummy pain, gas, constipation, diarrhoea, irritable bowel syndrome, dairy allergy/intolerances and fussy eating no longer stop your child from doing the things they love.
I offer 1:1 appointments via my website www.ukkidsnutrition.com.  More details are below:
Nail Milk Allergy
Happy Belly Club
Fussy Eating Solutions
Feel free to book a complimentary call to learn more about my services here.

Whilst you are waiting for your appointment, why not read my blog and listen to my podcast.

name: Hannah Hartnett
title: BSc (Hons), MSc
bio:
I am a dedicated and passionate dietitian with extensive experience in both adult and paediatric nutrition. I began my career working with adult patients in areas such as gastroenterology, surgery, and critical care. Over time, I transitioned to working as a paediatric dietitian, specialising in complex nutritional needs, challenging eating behaviours, and allergies.
Currently, I work part-time with the NHS and offer private consultations for adult and paediatric patients outside of my NHS hours.
I am recognised for my commitment to evidence-based care and my passion for educating medical staff and families. My dedication to continuous professional development is evident through my specialised training in paediatric nutrition, the low FODMAP diet (for IBS), and my completed Master's degree in Sport and Exercise Nutrition.
Understanding the demands of modern life, I aim to accommodate my clients' diverse needs by providing convenient telephone consultations. This flexible approach ensures my clients can access my services from the comfort of their own homes whether they are in the UK or abroad.
Feel free to reach out today to schedule a free 15-minute discovery call!

name: Sarah Roberts
title: Bsc( Human nutrition and Dietetics )
bio:
I Qualified as a Dietitian with a Bsc(Hons ) Nutrition and Dietetics in 1997 from University of Wales . I have 25 years professional dietetic experience and am Highly specialised in Mental health and Nutrition . I am particularly sensitive and experienced in dietary issues and nutritional education to address issues relating to Eating disorders  ( Obesity, Binge eating , Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia ,OSFED ,ARFID and REDS)  providing constructive practical Nutritional support in a compassionate and effective way .
I have personal and professional experience  in working with people on the Autistic spectrum and those with Sensory processing difficulties. I can work with  Adults and Young people  providing Nutritional education , practical resources , meal planning and support on a  one to one , family or group basis .  I am  trained in Sequential and Oral Sensory feeding and am a registered therapist to practice using this model of care .
I am an avid runner and have a knowledge of sports nutrition especially when related to low weight, eating disorders  or disordered eating. I continue to work within the NHS which ensures I am up to to date with research and practice ,evidence based care is important to me .Please contact me if there are any issues relating to nutrition and mental health which effect you or a family member, pupil, work colleague etc that you would like support with . I mainly provide virtual assessments and reviews and pride myself in individualised resources and thorough dietary recommendations.

name: Susie Acreman
title: MSc FBDA
bio:
Hello, I am a HCPC registered Dietitian, a Fellow of the British Dietetic Association. and a member of the Association`s specialist oncology group.
I have 50 years experience helping people manage their illnesses and conditions by changing their diet and lifestyle. Since 1986 my specialist clinical interest has been cancer (oncology)
Having supported and cared for many people in health and illness for 50 years in the NHS in South Wales, I truly understand the daily struggles and challenges they face to improve their health and well-being – and feel supported during their difficult journey.
I know that people with cancer may find their diet affected and I can help them eat well and feel better with dietary changes, People with cancer need and want to know how their food and diet can help them during their illness.
I can help you with your nutrition and dietary challenges by :
Providing an individualised nutrition assessment and personalised advice tailored to your requirements and preferences
Advising you on how to many cancer treatment nutrition impact side effects using  dietary changes.
Guiding you through the maze of information about diet and health during and after cancer diagnosis and treatment .
Helping you maintain a healthy lifestyle while living with your cancer.
Helping you to minimise weight loss and promote weight gain.
Helping you to consider the benefits and pitfalls of all the information. myths and confusion found on media about nutrition, diet and cancer.
Help you make dietary changes if you have gained weight for whatever reason. My advice will help you realise sensible and sustainable weight loss.
email me on acremansue@gmail.com
Telephone me on 07855054737

name: Lucy Diamond
bio:
I’m Lucy Diamond, a Diabetes Specialist Dietitian, the Clinical Director at Oviva, a digital healthcare company and a Director on the Board for the BDA.  I spent a decade in the NHS, mainly at King’s College Hospital London, working my way through band 5, 6 and 7 roles, with the opportunity to specialise in Diabetes.

I work with all clients with a variety of different personal goals and clinical considerations, mainly within but not exclusively in, diabetes, weight management, IBS, and pregnancy.  I support each individual to reach their personal goals, using evidence based guidance and nurturing support as well as using proven behaviour change techniques.  I truly put the individual at the heart of everything I do.

I have over 14 years of clinical experience, but also a wealth of experience in Leadership within Dietetics.  With a passion for presenting, be it to small or large audiences, live or on camera.  Trying to spread evidence based information and raise the profile and importance of nutrition and dietetics in leading healthier and happier lives.

name: Rachel Ball
bio:
Hello!

My name is Rachel. I am here to advise and support you in the way that suits you best. I don’t believe in sending out the same meal plan to everyone. The best plan is one that YOU can stick to!

My particular strengths are:

Diabetes, Plant based and vegan eating, Nutrition for sports and fitness, Obesity management and weight loss advice, Managing Cardiovascular risks through diet,
Managing sensory profiles and food including under 18yo

I am registered with the British Dietetic Association and the HCPC and also undertake clinical work in an NHS hospital, so you can trust me to work ethically and professionally.

Aside from my dietetic work, I enjoy working on my garden and working out in the gym.  I care about environmental issues, reducing food waste and improving the way we produce food.

I would be delighted to meet you in a video call or chat on the phone!

name: Emily Holt
contact_address: Bridge of Allan, Stirling, Stirlingshire United Kingdom
bio:
Looking for dietary advice you can trust? Feeling stuck and unsure of where to start? Empowered Nutrition is here to help.
I am a HCPC registered dietitian with a passion for empowering people to better health through nutrition. I have experience and training in various specialist areas including:
• Weight loss support
• Type 2 Diabetes and Pre-Diabetes
• Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
• Perimenopause and Menopause
• Gut health (including IBS and the low FODMAP diet)
• Behavioural change

I am also a supplementary prescriber with an enhanced knowledge of medications, and a certified fitness instructor. This combination of skills and experience enables me to support people holistically, considering all aspects of life which influence our health.

I provide tailored advice, motivation and support through telephone and video calls at my private practice Empowered Nutrition. I also provide in person nutrition consultations at Willow Health in Bridge of Allan, Stirling (for in person appointments book directly via www.willow-health.co.uk).

This list is not exhaustive so if you want to explore whether I can help, contact me by email to book in for a free 15 minute discovery call. There are no expectations or pressure to book, we can have a chat and see if working together is the right next step for you.

Email: info@empowerednutrition.co.uk
Website: www.empowerednutrition.co.uk

name: Amzu Parpia
bio:
Registered Dietitian, BDA (British Dietetic Association), HCPC (Health & Care Professions Council), MSC Foods, Nutrition and Dietetics, Accredited Practitioner in Eating Disorder by Eating Disorders Education and Training Scotland (EEATS)
Specialist Dietetics Service | Anorexia Nervosa| Bulimia Nervosa | Binge Eating Disorder| ARFID | Mental Health conditions | Working with adults & young people
I am a Masters qualified dietitian, working in the field of dietetics since 2012. An accredited practitioner in the field of eating disorders with Eating Disorders Education and Training Scotland (EEATS).
I have worked both in private and NHS eating disorder settings since 2017, gaining expertise in helping individuals of all ages (children, adolescents and adults) with complex clinical conditions including anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge eating disorder and ARFID, as well as mental health conditions including anxiety, bipolar disorder, depression and schizophrenia.
I am passionate about helping people build a more positive relationship with food. I understand that life experiences and the media, which is flooded with conflicting advice, can cause us to lose our connection with our body and a healthy relationship with food. Sorting through complex information and advice about diet can require specialist help and support, which I aim to provide in a non-judgemental supportive environment. I understand that everyone is unique. Drawing upon my training in behaviour change techniques, motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioural strategies, I will work with you to understand your eating behaviours as part the bigger picture of your life as a whole and find ways to support dietary change using appropriate tools and techniques, including mindfulness. It is about finding the right answers for you, to provide you with the solid foundation needed for healthy lifelong eating patterns.
How can I support you?
• Individually tailored nutritional guidance to assist you in achieving a lasting dietary behaviour change that is beneficial for health and wellbeing, both for now and in the future (for example, in relation to mental health, bone health or fertility)
• Helping to dispelling food myths or misconceptions
• Supporting you to let go of unhelpful and unnecessary food rules, to allow for increased food freedom and flexibility
• Supporting you in challenging any identified ‘fear foods’
• Providing education when needed around what a balanced dietary intake looks like and what appropriate portions sizes are
I look forward to working with you and being a part of your journey to health.
Book a free 20 min discovery call to explore how we might work together and if I am the right health professional for you. Online consultation available.

name: Joanne Durkin
bio:
My name is Jo Durkin, I’m a registered Dietitian in Cardiff, Wales. I have been working as a Dietitian for over 7 years in a variety of specialty areas in the NHS in both England and Wales. I have worked with many different groups and communities; in Nursing homes, Care homes, Educational settings, hospitals and with Community groups; delivering education to Health care staff, medical staff and other Health Care Professionals. I am registered with the Health Care Professionals Council and a member of the British Dietetics Association.
My career so far in the NHS so far has brought me to many different areas; Weight management consultations and group work, IBS consulting and group work, Nutrition support in elderly care, Enteral feeding in range of conditions; Neurological disorders, Brain injuries, Stroke, HIV patients, Renal patients on Dialysis and patients with Renal conditions. I also worked during the COVID-19 pandemic in the Dragon's Heart Hospital which is the Principality Stadium, providing nutritional support to those patients who were suffering with the COVID-19 virus. 
I have a special interest and experience in providing support for people struggling with side effects from cancer treatments; Chemotherapy, Radiotherapy, Immunotherapy and surgery. Throughout my years of service, I have worked with patients at different stages of their cancer journey and I am dedicated to helping clients reach their goals through personalised strategies and tailored nutrition.
I am committed to helping others navigate the often-overwhelming world of nutrition. My area of expertise is in Cancer and Oncology and my current role is based in a Cancer Care Hospital, advising and helping patients navigate their cancer treatments and the side effects. I also offer pre-treatment and post-treatment dietary advice alongside other areas listed below.
Expertise:
Cancer care pre, current and post treatment advice
Gastrointestinal disorders: IBS, Colitis, Crohns, Gut health
Pancreatic malabsorption/Pancreatic disorders including Pancreatic cancer, Creon and malabsorption advice. Post cholecystectomy or gallbladder removal. 
Nutrition support and Healthy eating advice
Nutritional deficiencies
Vegan/Vegetarian diets
Nutrition and care of the elderly
Enteral feeding: PEG, BRG, RIG, NGT feeding 
Patients with Renal disease or Kidney problems; specialist diets; Low Potassium, Low Phosphate etc
Nutrition and HIV
Group work for Healthy eating, weight management/weight loss advice. 
I offer a free Discovery call to arrange further treatment and if I can meet your needs. Please contact me on my website, below or via my Contact Number/Email

name: Sonali Gandhi
title: BSc
bio:
I studied BSc Hons in Nutrition and Dietetics in 2007 at the Liverpool University following a career in Engineering. I realised during my engineering career that I am a people person and that I want to help people who were struggling to manage their health. Hence, I took a brave decision to change my career to become a Dietitian on 2003.
I am HCPC registered and a member of BDA professional bodies. I have achieved master level qualifications to be specialised in Paediatric dietetics and eating disorders. I am highly experienced as a Paediatric Dietitian specialising in food allergies, food intolerances, restricted diet (in the context of ASD, ADHD, Eating disorders, ARFID), sensory diet, feeding difficulties, faltering growth/nutritional deficiencies, constipation, reflux and support with artificial nutrition, tube feeding including NG/PEG/JEJ feeding. I am passionate about children’s health and their well-being. I strongly believe that supporting a child’s growth physically and mentally is very vital for their future stability and development.
I have extensive experience of working in a variety of settings within the NHS and I have grown in my passion and experience to help children. I have worked with children from infants to young adults up to 18 years old for over 8.5yrs and with adults for about 7yrs . I have had multiple opportunities to communicate and deal with a diverse range of patients and their carers who may be suffering with neurological conditions, genetic disorders, metabolic disorders or learning difficulties, causing them to have serious speech difficulties and/or behaviour challenges. As a result I have incredible communication skills that I can use with parents, carers, school staff and children to ensure I empower them to make a difference.
In addition I bring wealth of knowledge and experience from multiple cultures of South Asia. I was born in India and have been in the UK for 25yrs, I speak multiple languages including Hindi, Urdu, Marathi, Marwadi, English and understand Gujarati, Punjabi. In my personal life I have first-hand experience of looking after a child who has ADHD and multiple learning difficulties, and this has been challenging but rewarding helping him grow to a healthy young adult. I love cooking and enjoy exploring new dishes. I am a bubbly, happy, friendly and a positive person.
I hope I can help you and your child to make a difference in their nutritional health. I am very much looking forward to working with you and your child. 🙂
industry_services: Private practice, Business consulting, Education & Academia, Health screening
clinical_expertise: Adolescence, Coaching/ mentoring, Early years nutrition, Eating disorders, Food allergy, Freelance Practice, Paediatric - Nutrition Support, Paediatrics

name: Georgina Giebner
bio:
I’m a specialist cancer, rehabilitation & gastrointestinal dietitian with many years of experience in dietetics, nutritional treatment and preventative nutritional counselling. I have a special interest and strong background in providing support for people struggling with gastrointestinal side effects from cancer treatments, for example, side effects following pelvic radiotherapy (PRD or pelvic radiation disease), chemotherapy, immunotherapy and/or surgery. I have training and experience supporting those with neuroendocrine cancer/neoplasms (NEN or NET).

As well as this I have over 20 years of experience with chronic gastroenterological conditions such as  bowel surgery, diverticular disease, IBS, inflammatory bowel disease, gallstones (and post cholecystectomy) and food allergy/intolerance. I have completed training to assess and support those with small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), pancreatic insufficiency and bile acid diarrhoea/malabsorption. 

I have success supporting gastrointestinal issues such as constipation, diarrhoea, swallow problems (dysphagia), wind (and/or excess burping), heartburn, acid reflux, bloating, cramping (abdominal pain) or stoma output problems with a holistic dietary approach. Working with your medical team/Doctors if incidated.

Having experience working with clients with chronic diseases like thyroid disorders (hypothyroid, Hashimoto's), diabetes, high cholesterol, gout, liver disease, pancreatitis, heart diseases and auto immune conditions enables me to support you with multiple conditions or just one thing.

I work in all areas of nutritional rehabilitation and prehabilitation to optimise recovery and fitness. Including supporting people recover from Covid or long Covid. I am also trained to use personalised nutrition (coupled with nutrigenomics/nutrigenetics) to provide individual DNA based assessments. I can also arrange gut health assessments including microbiome stool analysis reports and recommendations.

I have taught and coached extensively, including planning and delivery of wellbeing programs and brief intervention support across all parts of the lifecycle (including pregnancy and menopause). I provide telehealth services nationwide and internationally.

Other areas of practice include skin and hormonal health (including PCOS, acne, rosacea, psoriasis). 

I run a clinic in Haddington, East Lothian for any face to face requests.

I can provide consultation for those with insurance or self funding. Please enquire.

name: Yvonne Mitchell
company_name: Yvonne Mitchell- BDA Registered Dietitian- Torquay-Devon
bio:
Hello! I’m Yvonne. I’m a Registered Dietitian and Nutritionist with over 15 years experience working in the NHS and as a freelance Dietitian. I am passionate about my clients health care and helping people improve their life and achieve goals. 
I am based in Torquay, Devon.  Am happy to do home visits,  online consultations via email or video calls and telephone advice.
If you are looking for a personalised, tailored plan to help you change your diet and improve your health please do give me a call.

name: Sian Shepherd
title: BSc Honour Nutrition
bio:
Sian is a HCPC Registered Consultant Dietitian with practising privileges at BMI/Circle The Cavell Hospital and Kings Oak Hospital in North London. Since the pandemic consultations have been carried out remotely. 'Face to face’ consultations have also recently resumed.
She has an extensive NHS portfolio and now works on a consultancy basis for the NHS on behalf of The Royal Free NHS Foundation Trust and The Whittington Hospital in London.
 She is a specialist gastroenterology dietitian for patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), coeliac disease, crohn's disease, liver diseases and digestive cancers including neuro-endocrine tumours. She has completed Advanced FODMAP training for the management of patients with IBS and digestive disorders. She has considerable clinical experience in managing pre and post bariatric patients, clients seeking weight management guidance and clients with Type II diabetes.
In recent years at The Whittington Hospital, she managed the dietetic care of patients with head trauma and neurodegenerative diseases including stroke, dementias and Parkinson’s disease.
Her passion alongside gut health, is hospital catering within the NHS, hospitality and commercial sectors. She was part of the award winning team when working at The Royal Marsden Hospital between 2004 -2011, receiving ‘Good Food on the Public Plate’ awards for incorporating local, seasonal and organic produce into the hospital menus.
Since 2015 she has been an Expert Witness for a number of leading London law firms and is registered with Premex and UK Register of Expert Witnesses. She was an Affiliate Ambassador for Symprove probiotics in 2021.

name: Holly Simpson
bio: My name is Holly and I am here to support you to improve your relationship with food and exercise in a sustainable manner. I am a Registered Dietitian specialising in Eating Disorders and Disordered Eating offering 1:1 sessions online, combining evidenced based practise with a passion for helping people regain joy in their life. My approach is one of compassion, encouragement and honesty; working alongside you to develop personalised goals, whilst empowering you to lead your sessions in the way that feels right for you. Please drop me an email to set up an intro call to have a chat about how I can support you!

name: Monika Bettney
bio:
I’m a Registered Dietitian dedicated to helping busy women break free from conflicting nutrition advice and develop a healthier, more balanced relationship with food. I specialise in supporting women struggling with disordered eating patterns- such as restrict-overeat cycles, binge eating, or feeling controlled by cravings- as well as those navigating digestive and hormone imbalances, fertility concerns, PCOS, and menopause.
HOW WE'LL WORK TOGETHER
I combine nutrition science with evidence-based behaviour change strategies to help you build realistic, sustainable eating habits. By addressing both practical steps and mindset shifts, we’ll work together to uncover the root causes of unhelpful patterns.
YOUR MIND
Knowing what to do is only part of the equation. Emotional triggers, ingrained habits, and the influence of diet culture can keep women stuck in cycles of guilt, shame, and restrictive or comfort eating. Together, we’ll explore the thought patterns behind these behaviours and develop healthier ways to respond to challenges- helping you build confidence and long-term flexibility around food.
YOUR BODY
Through a thorough assessment of your health and lifestyle, I provide personalised recommendations to better hormone balance, support fertility, and improve gut health- among many other areas. We’ll consider factors like nutrition, exercise, stress management, and sleep, tailoring everything to your unique needs.
YOUR JOURNEY, OUR COMMITMENT
In our one-on-one sessions, you’ll receive compassionate, personalised support to help you move toward the change you desire. My goal is to offer practical, down-to-earth guidance, without unnecessary tests or rigid meal plans.
- Book a free introductory call to learn more about my services and how we can work together!
- For more information about working together (including pricing), visit my website
- Feedback From My Clients: for client feedback, go to Trustpilot reviews

name: Katie Clark
bio:
I am a Paediatric Dietitian with 27 years’ experience working as a Senior Dietitian in the NHS. I currently work at the Royal Alexandra Children’s Hospital in Brighton. I see a wide variety of paediatric patients.

I play a central role within our hospital trust’s Paediatric Allergy Team. I keep up to date with research and translate this into practical guidance for parents with food allergic children. I facilitate groups for parents with infants with Cow’s Milk Protein Allergy. This has given me a wealth of experience in the management of this condition.

I have worked in a specialist weight management clinic for many years and bring my skills in cognitive behavioural therapy to help children and families adopt more healthy lifestyles.

I have had experience working in Primary Care seconded to the CCG for various projects. These roles involved education of other health professionals. I also write case studies and give lectures on various aspects of Paediatric Food Allergy and nutrition.

Areas of specialism are:
• Food Allergy
• Fussy Eating
• Early Years Nutrition
• Weight management
• Faltering Growth
• Irritable Bowel Syndrome

I am registered with the British Dietetic Association and Health Care Professions Council. I am also a member of the British Society of Allergy and Clinical Immunology.

I can offer 1:1 Video consultations or telephone calls in evenings or at the weekend.
clinical_expertise: Early years nutrition, Food allergy, IBS, Low FODMAP, Obesity, Paediatric - Nutrition Support, Paediatrics

name: Lorraine Hosey
bio:
I have over ten years' experience working in the NHS. I have worked with a range of individuals, providing dietetic advice and support in the management of a range of different conditions. My specialist interests are in obesity, binge eating disorder and gastrointestinal disorders and non-IgE mediated allergy. I also have a wealth of experience in nutrition support for malnutrition, nutrition for older adults and tube feeding.

I am now offering freelance dietitian services for clients. I am also available for public speaking events, conference, workplace health events and nutrition and health writing. 

www.rainemarie.co.uk

name: Naheeda Habib
title: BSc Hons Dietetics
bio:
Expert Dietitian Support: Simple, Effective and Tailored to You..
Struggling with weight management (all ages), cow’s milk protein allergy, faltering growth, or being underweight?
With 18 years of experience, currently leading in paediatric dietetics, I provide expert guidance to help you take control of you and your family's health with confidence.
My unique, simplified approach ensures you feel empowered to manage your concerns and achieve lasting results. Whether you prefer one-on-one or group support, I offer flexible appointment options, including one-off consultations and structured programs, available in person, via video call, or by phone.
With a strong track record of success and glowing client feedback, you can trust that your journey to better health is in expert hands. Let’s work together to make nutrition simple and effective for you and your family!

name: Katie Psarou
bio:
Hello I'm Katie, a Fertility Dietitian and Maternal Health Dietitian. I help couples who are trying to conceive and pregnant women to optimise their weight with proven nutrition changes for a healthy pregnancy and a healthy baby.
It can be very confusing to know what to do during this important stage of your life. Support from a dietitian can be extremely beneficial to help gain clarity and direction on how to achieve your desired outcomes.
I have been a Registered Dietitian for over 20 years and completed my PhD in diabetes and endocrinology. This gives me an advance understanding of how nutrition treatment can positively impact blood sugar and hormone management particularly in insulin resistance and PCOS. 
I have experience working in the NHS (hospital and GP surgeries), universities and private practice. I also specialise in Weight Management, Type 2 Diabetes and Women's Health.
Head over to my website www.sensiblenutritionsolutions.com for further information or to book one of my services.
industry_services: Private practice, Education & Academia, Research & Development
clinical_expertise: Diabetes, Fertility, Freelance Practice, Maternity, inc. maternal obesity, Menopause, Obesity, Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), Weight loss, Women's health
